Really? We count on you. I beg you, do not disappoint. They expect a real meal after having to resort eating scraps for weeks.
What are you doing on the ramparts?
I recall some old memories.
What are you doing?
I recall some old memories.
Then?
That's it, they are with the Pope. There's no doubt we can leave quietly.
Good, it's my task to explain this to the master. We'll share a mug at the tavern of Bourges if we ever bump into each other. Goodbye and thank you friend, for all your help.
Let's get out of here and pray that we don't get into trouble.
I don't know if what we have just done is really just, let's go.
Then?
I don't know, maybe we should wait a little before we message the surrender.
I don't like it if... NO! They are attacking us! Weapons!!! Defend your miserable lives.
Well? Go see the inquisitor's face... what do you want to do?
I'll go, but I hope he doesn't shoot me.
What are you doing around here mate? I hope you bring us reinforcements or a message.
I'm reinforcements, but I'm all alone and I have no message. The master would have given it to me if there was one.
What? The master really does questionable acts. He must think we're invincible soldiers, or he simply wants our death.
He sent me here as reinforcement without even telling me who is besieging. What is the situation?

Ha, Ha, Ha! Forgive me, but it's really laughable, you don't even know? Well open your ears comrade: the Duke of Provence is in a proper tussle with the Pope. Because of a disagreement, Avignon, which is under the protection of the Duke, found itself besieged overnight. We were hired to resist the Papal army. I hope that our action is legitimate, we have expected a messenger to arrive for so long and provide a confirmation but no one comes. So here we are holding the bridge for our company and the Duke of Provence. We were paid for in advance, but all of that was spent a long time ago.
Excuse me? What are the consequences and what alternatives are available to us?

It's pretty simple, if our action is not legitimate, an emissary courier should arrive and tell us to fall back and let the Pope take Avignon. If our action is lawful and just, we must continue to defend against a possible usurper, securing the city by holding the only access, the bridge.
And if the army should attack the Pope? Fight or surrender?

You know the situation... I refuse to make that decision, because if we're wrong and the inquisitor is legitimate, we risk excommunication, imprisonment or death at the stake. If we abandon the Duke of Provence we would also face similar trouble. So neither an attack or a surrender seems possible.
I would make it.

Okay! Start by talking to the inquisitor. It's been days since they spoke to us. Perhaps they are expecting a message too, with the stamp of the Pope affirming their action. But it could also be fake, I wouldn't take that kind of decision based on a message supposedly from our company. Go see the inquisitor in their camp. Don't worry they'll let diplomats through.
Let's get out, the work is out there.
I don't know if what we have just done is really just.
Glad to see reinforcements, however few in number. Go see the sergeant on the ramparts.
You are not very many either, the quartermaster of the company I assume?
It was a dirty battle.
Let's go.
It's been days since they even spoke to us. I don't like it, you've been to the sergeant of the company on the ramparts?
They may not know what to say... do not worry.
It was a dirty battle.
Let's go.
It makes me nervous to wait like that.
It will end one day.
It was a dirty battle.
Let's go.
Go see the sergeant on the ramparts.
I'm on it.
It was a dirty battle.
Let's go.
They attack, why wait?
They prefer that we leave. What they need to understand is that mercenaries have taken the city by this point. They may have not understood that the company will not let go of a contract.
It was a dirty battle.
Let's go.
Do something, or it will go wrong.
I'll try.
You can go, the city will be returned.
Well, I guess that's it.
So? Will you go? You see, I've had enough of this campaign.
Okay, we'll leave and won't oppose you.
Thank you for making the right decision, rest assured, we are the Papal army. Go in peace my son and always try to stay right and just.
I'm still thinking.
Engage the heretics! Did you know that you are opposing the Pope?
I'm just a diplomat. We are in a delicate situation, we do not know if... you are who you claim to be. If we were sure we could retire from this engagement.
You must leave unconditionally, go join your comrades at home. Make your fight against England. What are you doing here opposing His Holiness?!
Where can I see the Papal coat of arms? Why don't you have a banner? And why have you recruited mercenaries as a Papal guards?

I see, these mercenaries have been employed since the last Pope and our banner is... I'm sorry but it fell out of the supply wagon while crossing a river. You must believe me, don't take the risk of doing harm to the Kingdom of France and the Pope himself. I understand that you are trying to do your job, but please leave or we give the order to assault.
Okay, we'll leave and won't oppose you.
Thank you for making the right decision, rest assured, we are the Papal army. Go in peace my son and always try to stay right and just.
I'm still thinking.
Engage the heretics! Did you know that you are opposing the Pope?
I'm sorry, I can not tell you anything yet.
So back to hiding behind the walls like cowards.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
Rendezvous, or is death and hell waiting for you?
This is not a simple soldier.
What are you doing here? The city is being besieged, if you don't want to take part in the fighting I advise you to leave.
Which city are you besieging?
You worry me with your questions. Leave immediately.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Those who don't take part in the fighting must leave the rampart.
I was just going.
What are you doing here? Commoners are not allowed in the siege camp, leave immediately for your village.
An inquisitor on a battlefield? Will you burn someone?
Ignorant, if anyone it's you who should be burned at the main square. Forfeit your positions, that's an order.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
Get out, there's no work for you here.
I'm going, my lord.
To what do I owe the pleasure... knight? Or maybe I misunderstood, perhaps you are a horse breeder, is that correct?
Always in such a good mood monsieur, how are your slaves?
...I lost the letter of recommendation, will you give me another one?
I got to greet a nice man, but that was it.
You are not worthy of knighthood, you are not even a son of a noble bastard.
Enough, I challenge you to a duel!
Good day for a commoner knight...
Wait, I... do not know how to fight, so let's rethink this...
I have great pity for you, may you be judged for all your actions sooner or later.

Ah, ah, let me laugh, try not to lose also your horse and sword on the battlefield. Hold on, here's another one. I have a full chest just for you, but the next time I'll charge you the price of paper.
You?
Yes, it's me. You have another contract for me I suppose?
I aspire to become a knight and I need a letter of recommendation written by a nobleman.
I've seen enough, farewell grandmaster.
No, I can't give you other contracts. I'm sorry, but that was your last mission. The end justifies the means and war puts all of us in dirty situations, no-one is quite clean, believe me.
Well, I don't have blood on my hands.
You're sure?
You, a knight? In a time of war... well, here is one, just add your name if you have one.
I am {playername}. One day I'll be a great knight, but not of your kind.
What are you doing here? Is the siege of Avignon over?
Yes it's finished and we were forced to defend ourselves against the army... of the Pope! You concealed the truth well.

The Pope? No, you got me wrong. The inquisitor acted according to his own interests. The Pope does not recognize it and it was the reason why we were on it, at least for the client we got the contract from.

Nice maneuver on your part. The inquisitor is entirely legitimate and you knew it was going to end badly for us. However, you'd still take the client's money, arguing that we went on our own in defiance to your orders. Me and the handful of unfortunate who would've lost their lives.
Stop the lies and pray that I don't get into other problems because of your story. One last thing, you owe me 1000 crowns.
Hmm... of course, it was the agreed price. It's preferable that you no longer work for me and especially do not speak of it to anyone. These are things that go over your head.
What are you doing here? Is the siege of Avignon over?
Yes it's finished and we weren't able to do anything against the army... of the Pope! You concealed the truth well.

The Pope? No, you got me wrong. The inquisitor acted according to his own interests. The Pope does not recognize it and it was the reason why we were on it, at least for the client we got the contract from.

Nice maneuver on your part. The inquisitor is entirely legitimate and you knew it was going to end badly for us. However, you'd still take the client's money, arguing that we went on our own in defiance to your orders. Me and the handful of unfortunate who would've lost their lives.
Stop the lies and pray that I don't get into other problems because of your story. I don't want to work for you anymore, farewell.
What are you doing here? I have no other work to give you as long as you haven't finished your previous mission.
I'm going...
You again?... What do you want?
Do you have work for me?
Yes... yes, actually you could help me. There is a delicate contract, a difficult task that you could complete for me.
Are you going to send me to my death?
No, that's not the problem. You see the difficulty is of an entirely different nature, but I don't doubt that you could get away.
The difficult part being what?
I can't tell you anything for now, just know that you could get paid 1000 crowns. But for explanations, you'll just have to trust me, do you agree?
It just so happens that I need that gold, so I have no choice but to accept.
I regret, but no.
I suspected that you would refuse. Know that my offer still stands, maybe for a few months. So if you are ever in need of money, you know what to do...

I knew I could count on you in these difficult times. You are to join Avignon that is under siege. Our position is on the bridge of St. Benezet. Our contractor the Duke of Provence wants us to defend the city. But just get there, don't worry about the rest just yet.
Welcome back.
Do you have work for me?
I'm going.
No, there is nothing for you... probably later.
So what? How we're out?
There were injuries, but the bandits are dead or under arrest now.
Okay, that's good work. Here's 200 crowns and 500 from your last mission as promised. I think we're done with this Villandrandro for now, you can go to the tavern, I don't need you now.
So now what? We are out?
There were injuries, but the bandits are dead or under arrest now.
Okay, that's good work. Here's 200 crowns. I think we're done with this Villandrandro for now, you can go to the tavern. I don't need you now.
So now what? We are out?
They outnumbered and they had us, there are injuries and...
It's not possible! Why did I recruit such an incapable twat? You won't get a single denar, leave immediately.
Well, don't just stand there. There's a fight at the court warehouses!
I agree.
Well? The battle took place?
It took place and we were defeated.

I expected no less from you, seeing as you are mostly incapable... however you can be useful for a change. As I predicted, another group of robbers stormed the warehouses thinking I sent most of my garrison to their camp. You must leave immediately for the warehouses to support your comrades in this battle.
Well, I'm going there.
I can't, I must decline.
Leave, you are the worst rookie my company has ever encountered.
Well? The battle took place?
It took place and we won.

Finally some good news! My plan worked to perfection. While they expect us in numbers at the hills, I've sent only a small group. Most of us stayed here in wait for the bulk of their company to arrive. Their formation will be shattered at the warehouses that they thought was only guarded by the militia. The Dauphin will be pleased with my service, I'm sure.
So you sent us to feint them terribly outnumbered, at the risk of my life and all those men?
I didn't doubt your skills.
What about my pay... my 500 crowns?
Later my friend, later. There's still fighting going on at the warehouses. Go swiftly and lend a hand to your companions and we will add 200 crowns to your purse.
Well, I'm going.
I can't, I must decline.
Leave, you are the worst rookie my company has ever encountered.
I have a doubt... you wouldn't just want me to die in this last fight to save you from having to pay me 500 crowns?
How can you think of such a thing? This is... sacrilege. Go quickly to the warehouses, please.

What, are you still here? The robbers can attack at any moment. I suspect they'll be making a diversion for an attack to the warehouses with another group. If we send a small but powerful group out, we can defeat them because they are separated. You must act fast! Reinforce our troops at the hills opposite of Bourges... immediately.
On the double.
Sorry, I do not have the skills.
I see... perhaps you should do something else, like being a potter, logger or washerwoman. Now go, fool.
You know... what do you want?
Do you have work for me?

You're in luck, the robbers have virtually declared war on Bourges, attracted by the resources of the city. Their leader is Rodrigue Villandrandro. He gathered mercenaries currently out of contract with him and formed a troop of bandits. They have engaged in looting, murders and raping. The worst is that they know how to fight.
What should I do?

They want our merchandise. We were able to thwart their last push, but it claimed the lives of ten of my men. They have the numbers and according to my informants some of them are already camping around the city. Gather a group of volunteers and intercept them before they come into Bourges, a surprise attack might make all the difference.
Can I have some of your men to assist me?
I'm sorry, but I can't, for now.

Well it's quite risky if I separate the few troops I have left to defend the warehouses. I may favor a possible strategy to create a diversion. If they manage to attack the warehouses with a bigger concentration of force, they might prevail and cause significant damage to the economy of the city. That said, I can give you some men if you agree to this contract. Look for one of our patrols and ask them to follow you.
How's the pay?
No less than 400 crowns.
600 and they won't bother you any more.
Should I remind you that you are in my service? You disappoint me... 500 crowns, payable on your return if you win.
It's okay!
Perfect, but hurry up, you have two days to take care of it, not one more.
I'm sorry, but it's too dangerous.
Then disappear.
Welcome back.
Do you have work for me?
I'm going.
No, there's nothing for you, maybe later.
So what? What has happened to you?
He broke down, I think he knew how it would end, he was expecting an execution.

It's unfortunate, that soldier... perhaps had seen too much. Seems I have to consider paying retirement to the soldiers who have served or suffered too much. I think you see me as a monster, but it's not so simple, you know, I'm just trying to lead this company as best I can and...
My wages?

Oh yes, you are right in having earned 600 crowns. What do you think, do you still want to work for me? I might have something for you soon. With my thanks, though I'll be having some trouble trying to put a lid on this case.
So what? What has happened to you?
He had to, I wasn't able.
NO!... He had to be stopped by the guard. The Dauphin will hold me accountable, get out of my sight, miserable peasant!
Hurry, damn it! He'll kill everyone in the tavern of Three lilies.
I'm running.
You're still here, what do you want?
Do you have work for me?
There is something you could do, it's a mission we can't... a delicate matter, it's a very annoying problem with respect to our main employer Dauphin Charles VII.
Keep going.

One of our men did the unthinkable. He killed a town militia in a fit of drunken rage. Now he's at the tavern of the Three lilies in the poor neighborhood of Bourges. If this were to reach the Dauphin's ears that would be the end of our contracts. The faster you get rid of him the better. Do it as discretely as possible, I do not care how.
It's a dirty job, but we don't always have a choice.
I refuse to kill one of our own, farewell.
Perfect, I knew I could count on you, my nimble friend.
You're still here, what do you want?
Do you have work for me?
I'm going.
No, there's nothing for you, maybe later.
You are back already, how was the patrol?
It's done, master. The streets were fairly quiet, but at the warehouses I got jumped by two bandits. I had to kill both of them.
Perfect! All in a day's work. These warehouses are a problem, we haven't seen the last of it. But it won't keep me awake at night, at least for the time being.
You are back already, how was the patrol?
Well... I came across two bandits, armed to the teeth. They took me by surprise and knocked me out, fortunately I was able to escape with my life...

What?! Oh, that's just perfect. Now everyone will think that the Freelancer is a group of pansies, and it's not worth it to hire them. Just let the looting continue as these so called protectors are incapable of getting things in control. The bandits have moved their loot to their hiding place by now. Disappear! I am disappointed that I was so misguided about your abilities.
You are back already, how was the patrol?
I'll get on it, master.
Master, I'm sorry, but I can't take care of it.
Really? You refuse a mission? Get out of my sight! I wonder about the efficiency of our admissions test.

Don't forget to talk to those responsible for their neighborhood! It's they who decide if they still want to keep paying us. To do so they must see that their money is being spent well. You don't have to know all these details, just do your job.
Here you are.
I passed your tests successfully. Do you have a job for me?
I'll be back, I just wanted to pay my respects.

I saw it, not too bad work I guess. Anyway, we have many mercenary contracts to complete. Here's a brigandine with our coat of arms. Take good care of it. Wear it proudly and defend our colors against our enemies, whatever they may be. You now belong to the Freelancers!
Am I to fight against anyone?

Rest assured, we are allies of the Dauphin Charles V of France and we are on his payroll. It could last. But when we have to change sides or fill out a delicate contract, you will have to do so without qualms. The company motto is that we will fulfill the contract even if it takes us to hell. Are you willing to go that far? Of course in return you will be very well paid, but this depends on the nature of the contract of course.
Long live the Freelancers! I am yours, master.
I'm afraid I don' have a choice, I need money.
I have to think, I'll be back.

Understood. You are in and I have a task for you. Bourges militia has seen their numbers and quality decline recently because of the war and the resurgence of bandits. Their number is deemed insufficient by the noble bourgeois, so they paid us to strengthen the ranks of their men. Your mission is to patrol the streets of Bourges. Display your shining arms while walking through the streets as a show of force, so they can in good conscience continue to pay heavy taxes for their safety.
Understood.

We also need to scare the robbers away, but beware, if you fall prey to one of their ambushes we will be ridiculed. The Dauphin would have to think twice before offering us another contract. So we are counting on you, do you understand?
Yes. Do not worry, I will arm myself heavily and I will stay on my toes.
I'm sorry, but I can not do this job for the moment.
Well, here are the details of the mission. You are to patrol the city and talk to the vendors and officials in each area. Ask them if everything is ok.
I got it.

It goes without saying that you shouldn't allow yourself to get beaten by the robbers, or the company's name will be tarnished. You will receive your pay when the task is completed successfully. Now off you go to do the soldier's work!
What impudence! Leave immediately, don't you know who I am? Go back to take the admission tests. After those we'll talk, before that you are not allowed to enter.
I'll leave if that will calm you down.
My apologies, I did not know where I was going.
It sickens me having to hire soldiers with so little education. I'm unfortunate to have you in my company, now disappear!
Still alive? You're not so bad then.
What do you think of the master?
I'll take this opportunity, farewell.
Who? Oh yes, the master. I do not want to return.

The battlefields of the north are truly horrible. The cold, the blood on the snow. Wolves everywhere that come to eat the carcasses of the victims of the fighting. Sometimes I wonder why I committed to this lot.
What else is there to do? Become a potter and live off the land?
It is never too late to get the hell out.
I know it would be nice to be rich, to have land...
It is certainly not so simple as it sounds.
Perhaps, but if we don't have a purpose then life is really for naught. It's better to die pursuing your dreams than to live a sheltered life.
It's a private operation. We won't let just any peasant with a pitchfork come here in search of gold.
Fighting here would be a very bad idea.
You got the all-inclusive, so off you go.
Let me drink alone.
What do you think of the master?
Bottoms up, you drunk. Farewell.
I don't think so. I'm doing my job and I get paid. You will learn soon enough to do the same and you will see that this is the good life.
I think you're right
I'm always right. You'll never be rich, but still richer than many French.
I'm well on my way to forgetting my last mission ever happened.
What happened?
In that case, I'll leave you.

A beautiful mess! Sometimes I think that the Dauphin Charles hired us just to keep the dirt and corruption from touching his good lords. Anyway, I was on the job with some city grunts to escort a convoy. These guys seemed like proper soldiers so I didn't worry too much. But at the first blush of combat the bastards fled. We got ambushed by some roadside bandits armed with just pitchforks. Seeing I was hopelessly outnumbered I had to do the same. I escaped and left the cargo behind.
You did the right thing, why risk your life if you had no chance?

I think you don't understand, the master would've wanted me to give my life rather than flee. It's bad for the reputation of the company, a soldier of the Freelancers fleeing mere peasants. The master doesn't know it yet and I'm in no hurry to report back to him, for sure.
Hey! This is the tavern of the company. You're not one of ours, so go somewhere else!
No need to take that tone.
So you're one of us, eh? It's nice to see that our numbers are increasing. The more people we have in the Freelancers the better my back will be covered! This one is on me.
Cheers! How about we play a few crowns in a game of chance?
Thank you, but I do not have time.
Play heads or tails.
Good... what are you waging?
1 coin.
2 coins.
3 coins.
4 coins.
5 coins.
10 coins.
We played enough.
I'm not interested.
Heads or tails? Ecu or Lys?
Ecu.
Lys.
Begin! I hope it does not fall into my glass.
I win! ha,ha ha !
{s2},I lost, damn it!
Bad luck. Here's your {reg6} coins.
Play some dice.
Fair enough.
That's it then? Well, back to work.
What's the bet?
1 denar
2 crowns
3 crowns
4 crowns
5 crowns
10 crowns
Fair enough.
I'm not interested.
I'll throw the dice.
I won! Ha ha ha.
I lost.
You can't win every time.
Tie, all bets are off.
Did you just take the test?
Yes, any advice?
Not at all, farewell.
Good advice, yes. Go back where you came from... Ha, ha, ha!
You're are not much for conversation, are you?
Don't wander around here while we practise.
My apologies.
Stay back.
What do you want? Aren't you already one of us? Why did you come to bother me again?
Still as aggressive as ever, nevertheless we're in the same company.
Yes, the same moody older brother of all the farmers who dream of carrying a weapon. What are you doing futtering around the camp?
So, are you ready to give me an answer or were you just trying to find the tavern?
I'm ready.
I prefer the filthy tavern to your stupid tests, I'm telling you.
Well... here's the riddle: The man who makes it doesn't want it. The man who wants it doesn't use it. The man who's using it doesn't know he is using it?
The wind
The shield
A hat
A coffin
A mug of beer
A lie
I do not know
Wrong. Leave and don't come back, do you understand?
Ah! A quick wit, I see. The master will be notified and I'm sure you'll be tasked with the difficult task of beer delivery.

Go to see the master of the company at the top of the tower overlooking the square. He will give you armor and your first assignment. Forgive me if I don't celebrate your victory with you, but I have better things to do. Like teach those two scrubs how to fight.
Oh, but this must be our would-be genius! You returned to take the test that you felt you were too stupid to complete the first time around?
Do not go too far...
It wasn't that hard, am I right? You showed that you know how to use a blade. You have the skill to face our enemies and sufficient force to break them.
I commit.

Not yet, the last test is a quiz. When you are given a contract to complete for a client, strength, speed and knowledge, as well as an ability to adapt to new situations are required. You tell me, are you smart enough to become a Freelancer?
We will find out soon enough.
Listen carefully, probey. The man who makes it doesn't want it. The man who wants it doesn't use it. The man who's using it doesn't know he is using it?
An instructor
The wind
The shield
A hat
A coffin
A mug of beer
A lie
I do not know...
You filthy drunk. Did you really expect that such a fool like you would be issued a weapon and the right to carry Freelancer colors?
Hmm... that's it?
It's... the right answer, is it not?
Yes.
So I passed?

Go to see the master of the company at the top of the tower overlooking the square. He will give you an armor and your first assignment. Forgive me if I don't celebrate your victory with you, but I have better things to do. Like teach those two scrubs how to fight.
What are you waiting for? The mannequins are out there... pummel them to pieces.
Ha! I...
Not bad for a beginner. Now I know that you can carry a sword. Strength is an indispensable quality for soldiers like us. Go and engage three straw dummies over there. I'll look how you go about it.
Very well.
I'd like to complete this... but I have an urgent problem to resolve.
Old acquaintance, back again?... Are you kidding me? If you want another chance you are allowed to take the test again.
I'm ready.
Surely not.
You know how it goes. Speed, strength and precision...
Get up, you are weak. Go back and return when you are finally up to it.
I hope that you are here to pass the recruitment test. Loitering around here without proper reason may be regarded espionage. Spies we treat like they should be, by hanging them at the yard.
I am here to pass the test, Captain!
What are the Freelancers exactly?
I'm going... right away!

You don't know anything, is that it? I'm short of patience, so I'll just tell you that the Freelancers are the largest mercenary company there is. We are currently employed in the service of the city of Bourges. We stay in the royal barracks, which is where you are now.
Well, if you think you can live up to the standards... know that we treat comrades with respect, but have no mercy for the weak and those who fail. Are you ready rookie?
I am willing, Captain!
I don't think I'm willing to endure all this for just a few crowns.
Get out of my sight!
First of all I need to know why you want to get involved.
I want to earn my living as a man of arms, and climb levels up to serve the King himself.
I have a deep admiration for the company.
I don't know...
Okay, I'm convinced, you can take the tests. Know that we are looking for fighters that are a perfect match for our company.
Maybe, but if you want to be a part, it will be up.
Moron, you miss the most important quality for a man of arms. Be a man already and go away. I've already lost too much time.
We require of our men skill with a blade, strength and intelligence.
For the first test, your weapon skills will be assessed. Show me how quick you draw your blade to parry the first blow.
I'm going to clean up the blood.
Become a butcher in that case.
It's over? Then you...
That's it, no need to be afraid any more.
Thank you, you removed a cursed thorn. I'll have to clean up the blood, but at least I can reopen my tavern.
Don't talk about it to anyone. No-one in the tavern can hold his tongue.
Run away, a drunken soldier killed a militiaman and then took refuge in my tavern.
I'm here to deal with it, where is he?
There, at the top, please watch out. He's a professional mercenary, crazy and very dangerous.
Don't move from here.
It's incredible, it would be enough to write a book, what an adventure!
You mean what a tragedy? So write about this nobility who treated their serfs like a herd of pigs.
I'd like to defend the ladies, but I'm just a bookseller, you see, and...
I'm on it, nobody is asking you to fight today.
Get back clown! Rot... bugger!
Do we know each other?

Freelancers, unscrupulous bastards the whole lot of you. Your great teacher accumulates mountains of crowns with the empty stomachs arriving from the countryside. Norbert, pick up the bodies of your comrades. Norbert, attack the camp of war wounded who scare the merchants who pay us to keep the roads clean. Norbert this, Norbert that. Band of bastards!!!
You should calm down and drop your weapons.

Remove yours if you want to talk. If you stay in this company, soon you too will reach the breaking point, and it will end badly, oh yes! And I'm not talking about battlefields, where the horror is at its most.
You've had too much to drink. Follow me, you'll do some time in the dungeons and get out sooner or later.
What are you talking about? I'm not drunk.
Yield and everything will be...
Death to the Freelancers!
Need wood, rope... or perhaps a whetstone?
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
I'd like to buy raw materials.
Where can I find more resources vendors?
Would you like to play some dice?
With pleasure!
You're welcome.
I suppose there are some in the north of France, but I can't tell you where, you know we are at war against France. I know there's a vendor in Bordeaux.
That's the whole stock.
Something else?

If you're interested in manufacturing weapons, you start with a blueprint that you can buy from a blacksmith. That'll include a list of required resources and tools. Then you just forge them. Some advanced weapons require higher level of agility.
Of course, I doubt it, but if I have no workshop and I'm not set in a city?
Well, you know, itinerant smiths do exist. In that case you need to work in a makeshift studio in a camp on the outskirts of the city.
Welcome to Dijon, stranger. If you came to set up shop here, you'll need to buy some resources, whether you are a blacksmith, a carpenter, or even a shoemaker.
Why not buy from wholesale?
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
You're welcome.

Of course you can compare prices and buy the cheapest resources, but we strive to offer the lowest prices. Moreover the variety of materials we gather to ensure the continual operation of all of our craftsmen is impressive. It's almost priceless for them not having to move from town to town in a time of war.

If you're interested in manufacturing weapons, you start with a blueprint that you can buy from a blacksmith. That'll include a list of required resources and tools. Then you just forge them. Some advanced weapons require higher level of agility.
Of course, but if I have no workshop and I'm not set up in a city?
Well, you know, itinerant smiths do exist. In that case you need to work in a makeshift studio in a camp on the outskirts of the city.
Okay, in that case I'd like to see what raw materials you have for sale.
I'll remember, thank you.
Of course, this is all I have left.
At another time, I hope.
Wood, strong ropes, jars...
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
I'd like to buy raw materials.
Where can I find more resources vendors?
Would you like to play some dice?
No thanks, I hate that.
You're welcome.
I suppose there are some in the north of France, but I'm sure of only one that's located in Dijon.
Of course, this is all I have left.
Something else?

If you're interested in manufacturing weapons, you start with a blueprint that you can buy from a blacksmith. That'll include a list of required resources and tools. Then you just forge them. Some advanced weapons require higher level of agility.
Of course, but if I have no workshop and I'm not set up in a city?
Well, you know, itinerant smiths do exist. In that case you need to work in a makeshift studio in a camp on the outskirts of the city.
Good day, what are you looking for? Wood, rope, or something special perhaps?
Why not buy from wholesale?
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
You're welcome.

Of course you can compare prices and buy the cheapest resources, but we strive to offer the lowest prices. Moreover the variety of materials we gather to ensure the continual operation of all of our craftsmen is impressive. It's almost priceless for them not having to move from town to town in a time of war.

If you're interested in manufacturing weapons, you start with a blueprint that you can buy from a blacksmith. That'll include a list of required resources and tools. Then you just forge them. Some advanced weapons require higher level of agility.
Of course, but if I have no workshop and I'm not set up in a city?
Well, you know, itinerant smiths do exist. In that case you need to work in a makeshift studio in a camp on the outskirts of the city.
Okay, in that case I'd like to see what raw materials you have for sale.
I'll remember, thank you.
Of course, this is all I have left.
At another time, I hope.
Go, or I disfigure you with the burning ember.
You'd never have the courage, coward.
Hello my lord, what do you want to drink?
We'll drink when you have given me some information.
Oh, I know what you mean. Unfortunately I know nothing of interest.
My employer sent me to pick you up to take you to a place where you can talk.
What do you say? I'll go and complain to the lord, I'll receive his protection and the rascal is cast to the dungeons.
You know it won't happen. Waste of time, my employer will deny everything and you have no proof. You'll just lose your inn... so talk now.
I see, you leave me no choice.
Who are the men you served with and where are they? Did they go with the girl?
You don't know who you are messing with. These people worship the devil, they, they will drink the blood of a poor girl in exchange for eternal life. Lord protect us.
Stop with the nonsense. Where did they go, speak up.
Everyone knows they have a den in the forest north of here. You'll be there too late, she's probably already dead.
In addition, you will attract their curse, the whole city will be sick, so leave the young girl to die. This is the only way to protect yourself from these demons.
What can I do for you?
Villandrandro sent me to get his protection money.
No, I want nothing.
No, please, not now!
You have to pay me, or I'll take your blood.
I suppose I'd have to pay interest for you if I don't want any trouble.
Um... thank you, finally, I suppose.
No, wait, I'll settle the debt in merchandise, what do you say? That's all. Tell them the next time I really have nothing.
A coat of mail? A helmet, perhaps? For plate armor you will need to order a...
Villandrandro sent me to get his protection money.
No, I want nothing.
That's it, cursed thieves. Take this and go to hell.
Do you need a weapon?
Villandrandro sent me to get his protection money.
No, I want nothing.
Well, like I have a choice? One day you'll find yourself in a dungeon, and you'll all hang... ...forgive me! I don't know where that came from. Look, just leave now.
What do you want to drink? Or maybe you want to...
I'm on patrol. Robbers have caused you problems lately, am I right?

Not really, apart from few barrels that have disappeared and few drunks that have been cleaned. I don't feel danger at the moment. It's not likely to change if the mercenary company begins finally to show themselves in our streets.
What can I do for you?
I patrol the city in case of robbers, have you seen any suspicious activity recently?

Actually my shop is not under direct threat. It's just that no goods reach me. The warehouses of the city are being targeted. I guess if they saw the mercenaries based in our city begin protect the warehouses, it would deter them from continuing to plunder. That would be good.
Greetings soldier, what can I do to help you?
I reinforce the militia of your city. I'm currently on patrol searching for robbers, have you seen them?

We are not short of militia in the area, in fact it's the warehouses where we have problems. That area has become infested by bandits. No-one dares to venture there. I was present at the assembly when the king decided to give a new contract to his most trusted mercenaries. With the war and disease, the scourge of the bandits is really more than unwelcome, it is time to solve this problem. Now that I see you at work I feel better already, thank God!
You've got it! Incredible! I will tell everyone how competent your mercenary company is. Thank you, soldier, thank you.
Just doing my job.
You've got it! Incredible! I will tell everyone how competent your mercenary company is. Thank you, soldier, thank you.
Just doing my job.
What can I do for you?
I have a letter for your master.
Ha! Show me that.
Here it is. Forgive me, but this trip was exhausting, I must leave you.
Well, I lost it.
Hmm, that's not very responsible of you, it was an important letter you know?
What can I do for you?
I have a letter for the Master of the Merchant Guild in Marseille.

Guards! This way!!! Oh, lord, get rid of these robbers. They want the goods. Beware, they are armed!
Don't fear, I'll take care of them. Stay back.
Clear out virgin, or you bleed like a pig. Don't stick your nose into our business.
It's my job to interfere your business.
You've been warned.
Do you know the motto of the company? The blood of the weak...
It will be him!
I prefer not to meddle, simply stealing your chickens.
Clear out, don't worry about that, we are two and you're alone.
A contract is a contract.
You've been warned.
Do you know the motto of the company? The blood of the weak...
It will be him!
I prefer not to meddle, I'll simply steal your chickens.
Wood, strong ropes, jars...
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
I'd like to buy raw materials.
Where can I find more resources vendors?
You're welcome.
To my knowledge there is a merchant in Paris, Rouen, Caen, Nantes and Orléans. There may be others elsewhere in France, but I don't know...
Of course, this is all I have left.
Something else?

If you're interested in manufacturing weapons, you start with a blueprint that you can buy from a blacksmith. That'll include a list of required resources and tools. Then you just forge them. Some advanced weapons require higher level of agility.
Of course, but if I have no workshop and I'm not set up in a city?
Well, you know, itinerant smiths do exist. In that case you need to work in a makeshift studio in a camp on the outskirts of the city.

Wood, strong ropes, jars... what is your profession? I've never seen you in the city, if you came to set up shop, you'll need to buy some resources, whether you are a blacksmith, a carpenter, or even a shoemaker.
Why not buy from wholesale?
I'd like to learn how to forge weapons.
You're welcome.

Of course you can compare prices and buy the cheapest resources, but we strive to offer the lowest prices. Moreover the variety of materials we gather to ensure the continual operation of all of our craftsmen is impressive. It's almost priceless for them not having to move from town to town in a time of war.

Okay, in that case I'd like to see what raw materials you have for sale.
Thank you, I'll remember.
Of course, this is all I have left.
At another time, I hope.
