Excuse me?
Already leaving?
Keep quiet.
You should relax.
I saw you on the corner of my eye.
I just want a loan, not to steal the chests.
Back! Get out of the convoy, scrublord.
(Give the signal to attack...)
Please forgive me, I'm going...
Spare me, spare me!
Go away, dirtbag.
How kind of you to come and greet us. Did you bring bread and eggs? You could join us for lunch.
Get back, scum. Engage or die.
You are not numerous enough to defeat us, rather join our ranks, and you'll make more crowns than you could count in a lifetime.
Even if it means violating and slicing the throats of innocent people?
Exactly, our survival depends on it. It's their life or ours.
En garde, cutthroat!
Dirty bastards! I'll find you!
Welcome to your new home... the dungeons of Bourges.
What are these black crows on my way? Tell them to leave or we will clear the passage ourselves.
We are not prey but hunters. [attack]
You can pass...
Bloody ravens! Plague upon you.
[Finish]...
Why do you bleed like a dirty pig?
It's time, lads! Up and at them!
Thank you! Thank you, {sir/my lady}, for rescuing me from those fiends. Did my brother in {s9} put you onto their track?
Yes. I told him that I would find you. I advise you to return to your family as quickly as you can -- and be careful on the road.
Ay! Spare me! Spare my life! Let me go, and I'll go far away from here, and learn an honest trade, and you'll never hear of me again!

I'll spare your life -- but in exchange, I want information. Either you or your mates kidnapped the brother of a prominent merchant in town. Tell me where you're hiding him, and give me your word that you'll stop troubling the people of these parts, and you can go free.
What do you want?
I've been looking for you. Tell me where you keep your prisoners, and I'll let you go.
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
Hah! Those prisoners are only going free if you pay their ransom. Did you bring any silver?
No, but I brought steel.
Oh bless you, {sir/my lady}. Bless you. We've done the lad no harm. We've been keeping him in our hideout near {s9}. I'll describe the area nearby in detail, so there's no mistaking it...
{playername}, you saved him! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}. Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.
Always an honour to serve, {s65}.

Are you all right? Well.... I guess you're alive, at any rate. I'm not sure that we can say the same for the other fellow. That's one less thief to trouble our streets at night, although Heaven knows he won't be the last.... Anyway, maybe you can help me with something. Let's talk more inside. Out here, we don't know who's listening

Splendid work. You have hired enough men to take on the bandits. Now -- travellers entering {s9} have told us that there is a small group of robbers lurking on the outside of town. I suspect that they are all from the same band, the one that took my brother. Hunt them down and defeat them, and make them disclose the location of their lair!

So, you've found out where they hid my brother? Splendid work. I flatter myself that I'm a fine judge of character, and you look to be a {man/woman} who can get things done. Now, go out and save his unworthy hide!

Well... My brother is home safe. I'm not sure what to do with him -- maybe pack him off to a university in Italy. That way, if he gets knocked on the head in a street brawl, no one can say it's my fault. But that's not your problem. Here's the rest of your reward. It was well-earned.
The money is most welcome, and I am glad to have been of service
Good! Now... Are you interested in making some more?
Possibly. What do you need?

Remember how I told you that the bandits had an ally inside the walls? I think I know who it is -- the captain of the watch, no less. Some months ago this captain, seeing the amount of profit we merchants were making from trade across the frontiers, decided to borrow some money to sponsor a caravan. Unfortunately, like many who are new to commerce, he failed to realize that great profit only comes with great risk. So he sank all his money into the most expensive commodities, and of course his caravan was captured and looted, and he lost everything.

As a consequence, it seems, our captain turned to villainy to recoup his fortune. I supposed I'd do the same if, the Heavens forbid, I ever faced indebtedness and ruination. Now, any watch captain worth his salary will have a few thieves and robbers on his payroll, to inform on the rest, but our captain decides to employ these bastards wholesale. He brings them into the town, lets them do as they will, and takes a share of their take. You've heard of poachers turning gamekeepers? Well, in the unfortunate land of France, sometimes gamekeepers will turn poacher. Luckily, there's are still a few brave, honest souls in the watch who've told me how he works.

Now -- here's my plan. I could bring this to the attention of {s4}, lord of the city, but that would mean an inquiry, my word against the captain's, and witnesses can be bought and evidence destroyed, or maybe the whole thing will be forgotten if the enemy comes across the border again, and all I'll get for my trouble is a knife in the ribs. In time of war, you see, a king's eye wanders far from his domain, and his subjects suffer. So I've got another idea. I've got a small group of townsfolk together, some men in my employ and some others who've lost relatives to these bandits, and we'll storm the captain's home and bring him in chains before {s4}, hopefully with a few captured bandits to explain how things stack up.
All I need now is someone to lead my little army into battle -- and I can't think of anyone better than you. So, what do you say?
How do I know that you're telling me the truth?

Oh, well, I suppose it's possible that I found a dozen bandits who were willing to give their lives to give a passing stranger a false impression of life in old {s4}... Well, I guess you can't really know if my word is good, but I reckon you've learned by now that my money is good, and there's another 100 crowns, or maybe a bit more, that's waiting for you if you'll do me this last little favor. So what do you say?
All right. I'll lead your men.
I'm sorry. This is too much, too fast. I need time to think.
Splendid. It's been a long time since I staked so much on a single throw of the dice, and frankly I find it exhilarating. My men are ready to move on your word. Are you ready?
Yes. Give them the sign.
Not now. I will need to rest before I can fight again.
Good! Now -- strike hard, strike fast, and the captain and his henchmen won't know what hit them. May the heavens be with you!

Right. I can keep my men standing by. If you let this go too long, then I suppose that I shall have to finish this affair without you, but I would be most pleased if you could be part of it as well. For now, take what time you need.
Very well. I shall hunt for bandits.
Why don't you come with us?

Because I'm paying you to go take care of it. That's the short answer. The long answer is that I've got some leads to follow up here in town, and I have just as much chance of getting knocked on my head as you, if that's what you're asking. But I respect your question. Now, what do you say?
I cannot deal with this matter at this time.
Very well. I go now to attack the bandits in their lair, and find your brother.
I cannot deal with this matter at this time.
You may do as you wish, {sir/my lady}, but I am disappointed. You would do well to reconsider. I am a rich men, and would show you my gratitude in coin.
You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
You make a persuasive case. I will help you.
As I say, I have more important business elsewhere.
Now -- go find and defeat that group of bandits.
Now -- go attack that bandit hideout, get my brother back, and show those brigands what happens to those who threaten my household.
Oh -- thank the heavens... Thank the heavens... Am I safe?

Ah... {playername}. Things didn't go quite so well as I had hoped. {s5} couldn't quite find it in him to overlook my little breach of the peace. Oh, he's grateful enough that I got rid of his crooked captain -- a guard who'll let in bandits will let in an enemy army, if the price is right -- but he can't exactly have me running around here as a lasting reminder of his failure to take care of things himself.
That hardly seems fair...

Fair? This is France, {my boy/my lady}! Kings do what they will, and the rest of us do as they must. He didn't string me up, and instead gave me time to sell my properties -- even put in a word with the other merchants that they best pay me a fair price, too. That's gracious enough, as kings go -- but he's a weak king, as they all are here, and weak kings must always look to their authority first, and justice second. I suppose I'd do the same, in his shoes.

Anyway, I wouldn't go rubbing your part in this affair in {s5}'s face -- but he's taken note of you, and decided that you're not worth hanging, and that's something to which I'll raise a glass any day of the week. He might even have work for you, further down the road. Or, you can sell your sword to one of his competitors. Anyway, I hope you've learned a bit about what it will take to stay alive in this troubled land, and I suspect that the money you've earned won't go to waste. Good luck.
I am preparing to leave town in a short while. It's been an honor to know you. Good luck.
What have you discovered?
Greetings, stranger.
It's time to pull you out. Let's leave town separately, but join me soon after
You're doing good work. Stay here for a little longer
{s11} I notice that you have been keeping some notes about individual lords. I have annotated those with my findings.
Which fief did you have in mind?
Never mind -- there is no fief I can offer.
Please do not waste any more of my time today, {sir/madame}. Perhaps we shall meet again in our travels.
Very well. You've made your point. I have nothing more to say.
Unfortunately, I can't take on any more hands in my party right now.
Sorry. I can't afford that at the moment.
We meet again.
So... What have you been doing since our last encounter?
Good day to you.
Yes?
My apologies if I was rude, earlier. What was your story again?
Never mind.
I might be able to use you in my company.
I'll let you know if I hear of anything.
Good! Give me a few moments to prepare and I'll be ready to move.
I hope we don't have to rot here for days. How about you, captain?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
It depends. I have some, but you won't like them.
Although I'm noble or of noble nobility, I grew up on the farm of my parents in Blois. I preferred the sword instead of pitchfork.
Something else?
It's a quiet place. It'd be nice to be able to remove the armor, which stinks of rust.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
Certainly, let's see.
I was born in Paris, where I have spent most of my life. I learned the trade of arms at the barracks. When I was little, I brought a sword to the soldiers and they showed me some moves with it.
Do you have anything else to say?
Don't worry captain, I'll keep my eye on you. If a man approaches discreetly, I'll spot him early enough.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That'll be all, see you later.
It's up to you to tell me what you expect from me.
I was born in Brittany, where I grew up strong as an oak. I am of noble birth, from the both sides of my parents.
That's all?
Captain?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
No worries captain, I know how to fight.
I'm Enguerrand. We had a prosperous farm, but soldiers burned it down and massacred the rest of my family. I have a great desire for revenge that I must satiate.
Anything else?

My friends, we should think of all the possibilities to make some money. I don't want to bore you while you are resting, but think of all the things we could do if we just prepare in advance. Marching is mostly a waste of time, so it might be a good idea to group up for some businesses opportunities while on the road.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
Actually, I'm just a merchant.
My name is Hermance, I come from Bordeaux. I left it animated by the hatred of those who dispossessed me. I was also also attracted by the adventure.
Anything else?
Fast sword and fast to empty my mug. Have you come to admire the work, captain? Will you join me?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I am a mercenary captain. Fighting until I die.

I'm Guillaume de Bourges, captain. I blame myself for being the sole survivor of the massacre of my old mercenary company. I'm a victim of this stupid war. There are times when I'd prefer to be killed in combat, rather than being the sole survivor of the battle that cost the lives of my comrades. Sometimes I think that life can still be a beautiful thing.
Anything else to tell me, captain?
A little silence, finally... only the sound of nature.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm a hunter and tracker, it can be useful for finding a group.
My name is Pierrick, I come from Nemours and I am a hunter. Name the enemies who try to hide from you and I'll find their tracks for you.
What else?
Goodbye captain, how are you?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm John. John is very strong, John is death, like the King of England says. The innkeeper of my village also agrees.
My mother gave me life in Scotland. She stayed there with my so-called father.
What?
Oh, sir! How not to waste time? I mean how not to waste life? How to succeed and how to live every second the best we can? I ask myself so many questions, don't you?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm a knight, Captain. Just forget the past, I beg you. It's on horseback and with a spear how the knight fights for causes.

I'm Gael de Bourbon, French noble and knight. I was born in Toulouse, where I also grew up and developed false hopes. The joy and determination are mine. I'm on the true road of chivalry in a corrupted world. I'm on the path to redemption.
Anything else?
The sharpness of the blades is unsatisfactory. Did you know that, Captain? It would be good to put some of these limestones to work.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
My job is a master of weapons. I'm a warrior first and foremost, but my role is to pass on my knowledge to recruits.
I was born near Monterean. I've been a master of arms for many lords and knights at the castle since the age of twenty.
Anything else?
No, I'm not sleeping. Sir, is that what you're telling me? I'm just resting a little bit, that's all.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
A little haggling from time to time. I also know how to fight, do not worry.
I'm a blacksmith, or at least I was. Now I'm a bounty hunter, and I hit on my anvil only the worst of the worst.
Anything else?
There are some cases of infected wounds, but rest assured we will handle them.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm a doctor. I'd pull you and your men out of the clutches of death as many times as you could count. Provided I keep myself at bay. Who can I save if I'm unconscious?
I'm a doctor. My mission is to save all the patients who are afflicted with various plagues. For the priests and the God to judge them afterwards.
What do you want to talk to me about?
To the glory! To... our pretty camp for the moment. Will you drink something with us?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
If you need a good foot soldier. I'm yours, captain.
I'm Mathieu, a cold-blooded mercenary killer, and so many other things that are not worth mentioning. How about we just drink before a blade pierces our bellies?
Anything else?
Captain, I hope you aren't forgetting the cause of resistance in the middle of all this? Just a reminder, I joined you to support the French resistance.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm archer most of the time, but I'm counting on you to teach me the tricks of the mercenary profession.
I'm Michel de Chartres, son of Simon the Blacksmith. I am a rebel, and I'll never stop fighting until the invader is thrown to the sea.
Anything else?

Captain! We'll finally be able to have a conversation. Since this morning I've been told about chickens and their eggs, carpenters bitten by insects and a bucket where the water level was judged to be insufficient. Are we finally going to talk more seriously about the war?
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.
I'm a siege engineer, no castle can resist me. There's always a flaw in the defenses, you see. It takes time, but we always end up finding a flaw and exploiting it.
I was born in Paris and studied modern war machines. I also have some skills in literature and Latin.
Anything else?
My good sir? I don't make fun of you, I'm just in a happy mood, I'd take advantage of it if I were you.
Since we have time, let's take a closer look at your equipment.
We should talk about your skills. What are those?
Tell me your story.
That's about it, see you later.

I know how to handle knife and small blades, as well as my tongue, in both the literal and the figurative sense, which could be useful if you need diplomacy. I can kill a man in cold-blood, right after telling him that I offer him my soul. But please, captain, avoid sending me to battle against a mountain of muscle since mine pale in comparison.

Well captain, my name is Blanche, just Blanche. I was born in a village near Peronne. My mother and my sisters were servants in the castle of a perverse nobleman, until I seized it all to myself by my... charms. So where a company couldn't have taken this castle I managed it. I have been given many nicknames, but the one that suits me best is the white viper.
Anything else?
My offer to rejoin you still stands, if you'll have me.

It is good to see you alive, {s5}! {s6}, and I did not know whether you had been captured, or slain, or got away. I've been roaming around since then, looking for you. Shall I get my gear together and rejoin your company?
I've come to break you out of here.
Thank the heavens you came! However, I'm not going anywhere with these chains on my legs. You'll need to get the key away from the guard somehow.
It is good to see you, {s21}! To tell you the truth, I had hoped to run into you.
{s5}. Would you want me to rejoin your company?
Welcome back, my friend!
Sorry, I can't take on anyone else right now.
Well... Look me up if you change your mind, eh?
So... Do you want me back yet?

There is a matter which needs your attention. The quarrel between {s11} and {s12} has escalated to a point where it has become unseemly. If you do intervene, you risk offending one of the lords. However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {sire/my lady}.

{s1} currently does not have a lord. You may wish to keep it this way, as lords will sometimes gravitate towards lieges who have land to offer, but for the time being, no one is collecting any of its rents.

At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention. I should point out though, sire, that I am not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I am anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?

If I may offer you a world of advice, my {lord/lady}, it seems that your right to rule as an independent monarch is not sufficiently recognized, and this may bring us problems further down the road. It may be advisable to find another kingdom with whom you have shared interests and seek its recognition, to establish yourself as an equal with France's other kings.
At this point, there are no particularly urgent matters which need your attention. Is there anything you wish done?
Is there anything you wish done?
Do you have any ideas to strengthen our kingdom's unity?
Let's abandon our plan to {s10}.
Are you sure you want to drop that idea?
Yes, I am sure. Let's abandon that idea.
Actually, never mind.
I wish to dispatch an emissary.
I wish to indict a disloyal vassal for treason.
I wish to replace {s4} as marshal.
I wish to appoint a new marshal.
You have just made such an appointment, {sire/my lady}. If you countermand your decree so soon, there will be great confusion. We will need to wait a few days.
I wish for you to retire as minister.
I wish you to rejoin my party.
I wish you to grant one of my vassals a fief.
I wish to make myself lord of {s4}.
As you wish. You shall be lord of {s4}.
That is all for now.
Who should be the new marshal?
I shall be marshal
For a short while, we should have no marshal
Never mind
To whom do you wish to send this emissary?
Unfortunately, there is no one to send right now.
{s10} of the {s11}{s14}
What do you wish to tell him?
That our two kingdoms should enter into truce.
That I wish to put myself under his protection, as his vassal.
That I wish to express my goodwill, as one monarch to another.
That I declare war upon him.
Never mind
It is. I wish to make war on {s12}.
Hmm. Perhaps not.
As you command. We are now at war with the {s12}. May the heavens grant us victory.
Who shall be your emissary? You should choose one whom you trust, but who is also persuasive -- one who can negotiate without giving offense.
Actually, I can't think of anyone.
Very well -- I shall send {s11} to the {s12} to {s14}.
Yes, do that
Actually, hold off on that
Very good. Whom will you appoint in my stead?
My wife, {s4}.
Actually, hold off on that.
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. I shall make ready to rejoin you.
Very good. {s9} is your new minister. It has been an honor to serve you.
Which of your fiefs did you wish to grant?{s12}
Never mind
And who will you choose to receive the fief?{s12}
Never mind
Very well - {s2} shall receive {s1}.
Grim news, {sire/my lady}. Who do you believe is planning to betray you?
Never mind.

Think carefully on this, {sire/my lady}. If you indict {s4} for treason unjustly, you may find that others become nervous about serving you. On the other hand, if you truly believe that {reg4?she:he} is about to betray you, then perhaps it is best to move first, to secure control of {reg4?her:his} fortresses.
I have thought long enough. Issue the indictment!
Perhaps I should wait a little while longer..
It has been sent, {sire/my lady}.
{s12}I want to have {s1} for myself. (fiefs: {s0})
{s66}, you should have {s1} for yourself. (fiefs: {s0})
As you wish, {sire/my lady}. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.
Hmm. All right, {playername}. I value your counsel highly. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.
Excuse me {s5} -- there is something I need to tell you.
To tell you the truth, {s21}
Very well. You be off, then.
Perhaps I can persuade you to change your mind.
Hmm. When you put it like that, I suppose I can stay a while longer, see if things improve.
I'm sorry, but I don't see your point. I am leaving whether you like it or not.
We hang deserters in this company.
Oh... Right... Do you mean that?
Absolutely. You either leave this company by my command, or are carried out on your shield.
No, actually I don't mean that. You are free to leave.
Then this is goodbye. Perhaps I'll see you around, {playername}.
Hmm. I suppose I'm staying, then.
Thanks, I appreciate your support.
Hopefully it won't happen again.
Your objection is noted. Now fall back in line.
{s11} is a valuable member of this company. I don't want you picking any more fights with {reg11?her:him}.
Tell {s11} you have my support in this, and {reg11?she:he} should hold {reg11?her:his} tongue.
I don't have time for your petty dispute. Do not bother me with this again.
{s11} is a capable member of this company. I don't want you picking any more fights with {reg11?her:him}.
Tell {s11} you have my support in this, and {reg11?she:he} should hold {reg11?her:his} tongue.
I don't have time for your petty dispute. Do not bother me with this again.
Very good.
Thank you.
I would prefer not to discuss such things.
Tell me more.
We don't have time to chat just now.
I prefer my companions not to bother me with such trivialities.
It was an honour to fight for your cause, {reg65?madame:my lord}.
You will always have my loyal support, {reg65?my lady:sir}.
I will miss living this life of adventure with you, but my duties await me. So... farewell for now, {playername}. I hope I'll see you again soon.
Your opinion is noted.
Greetings, {s21}. Are you ready for me to rejoin you?
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I've been out spreading the word about your claim, and am now ready to rejoin the company.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. {s11}. The rest of my report I submit to you in writing.
Well, {s21}, at last I've found you. I have returned from my mission to {s31}. In general, I would say, {s14}.
In this letter, {s12} addresses you as {Lord/Lady} of {s4}, which implies some sort of recognition that you are a sovereign and independent monarch.
In his letter, {s12} merely refers to you as {playername}, omitting any title. This does not constitute recognition of your right to rule.
{s12} says that your current truce should suffice.
{s12} says that he is willing to consider a truce of forty days.
{s12} says that he is unwilling to conclude a peace.
Very well - let this truce with the {s4} be concluded.
On second thought, perhaps this is currently not in our interests.
{s12} says that you are already pledged to another ruler.
{s12} says that he does not believe that you would honor your obligations as a vassal, and suspects that your offer is just a ploy.
{s12} says that he accepts your offer of vassalage. He will give you 30 days to seek him out, in which time he will refrain from making war on you.
Tell him that I accept his terms...
Welcome back, friend!
Unfortunately, I cannot take you back just yet.
As you wish. I will take care of some business, and try again in a few days.
Would you have me rejoin you?
There! I can see the walls of {s3} in the distance. We've made it safely. Here, take this purse of {reg3} crowns, as I promised. I hope we can travel together again someday.
My lady, I look forward to our marriage, as soon as there is an opportunity to hold a proper feast.{s12}
My lady, if you wish to marry, we can proceed to the feast at {s4} to exchange vows before the lords of the realm.
My lady, I grow tired of waiting for the lords of this realm to assemble. Come with me to {s4} exchange our vows.
My lady, I grow tired of waiting for the lords of this realm to assemble. Perhaps we should take the first opportunity to marry, in any great hall that is open to us.
My lady, I have grown tired of waiting. Let us proceed with the vows immediately.
My lady, my eyes rejoice to see you. We may proceed with the vows.
My lady, with this assembly as my witness, I vow to take you as my wife, to honor, cherish, and protect you. My the heavens bless us with health, prosperity, and children.
I vow to take you as my husband.
Wait -- I need to think about this.
We are now husband and wife. Let the festivities commence!
Well, {sir/my lady}! Please, do not trouble yourself to rise from the ground, as I would simply have to knock you down again. I shall take your silence as an apology. Good day to you.
Very well. You've made your point. I retract what I said. I hope you have obtained satisfaction.
Hah! Not so gallant now, are we? Now trouble me no more.
Very well -- you have won. Let all those present today witness that you have defeated me, and I shall abandon my suit of {s10}. Are you satisfied, you heartless bastard?

Get up. Let all those present today witness that I have defeated you, and you are now bound to relinquish your suit of the {s10}. I will permit you one final visit, to make your farewells. After that, if you persist in attempting to see her, everyone shall know that you are a man of scant honor.
How wonderful it is... In a short while we shall be married! However, I should point out that, in the remaining few days, it is not customary for us to speak too much together.
What do you want?
Surrender! Your situation is hopeless!
Nothing. I'll leave you now.
Perhaps... Do you give your word of honour that we'll be treated well?
We are ready to leave this castle to you and march away if you give me your word of honour that you'll let us leave unmolested.
Surrender? Hah! We can hold these walls until we all die of old age.
I give you nothing. Surrender now or prepare to die!
Bastard. We will fight you to the last man!
You will be ransomed and your soldiers will live. I give you my word.
Very well then. Under those terms, I offer you my surrender.
You have my word. You will not come under attack if you leave the castle.
Very well. Then we leave this castle to you. You have won this day. But we'll meet again.
Unacceptable. I want prisoners.
Then we will defend this castle to the death, and this parley is done. Farewell.
I've come to get you out of here
Never mind -- just stay quiet
Thank the heavens! I don't know how long I could have lasted in here

But wait -- how will we escape? We'll be rushed by the garrison the moment we step out that door. I can help you hold them off -- but I'll tell you now, they have fed me nothing but watery porridge and a few scraps, and I'm not as strong as I could be.
You keep well behind me, and try to stay out of the fighting.
I'll need you to grab a weapon and help me, despite your weakness.
Actually, don't get involved in this.
Let's go!{s14}
I am in your debt for freeing me, friend.
You're not going anywhere, 'friend'. You're my prisoner now.
I'll have your head on a pike for this, you bastard! Someday!
You are free to go wherever you want, sir.
Thank you, good {sire/lady}. I never forget someone who's done me a good turn.
You are my prisoner now.
I am at your mercy.
You have fought well. You are free to go.
{playername}!
Halt!
We will fight you to the end!
Stay your hand! There is something I must tell you in private.
Is there no way to avoid this battle? I don't want to fight with you.
Don't attack! We surrender.
I owe you a favor, don't I. Well... all right then. I will let you go just this once.
I await your counsel, {playername}.
Do I know you?.
My name is {playername}. At your service.
I am {playername}. Perhaps you have heard of my exploits.
I thought {s12} was ruled by {s11}?
Greetings, {playername}
What was your story again, {reg65?my lady:sir}?
I shall tell you.
I want to take up your cause and help you reclaim your throne!
I must leave now.

Are you sure you will be up to the task, {playername}? Reclaiming my throne will be no simple matter. The lords of our realm have all sworn oaths of homage to {s11}. Such oaths to a usurper are of course invalid, and we can expect some of the lords to side with us, but it will be a very tough and challenging struggle ahead.
I am ready for this struggle.
You are right. Perhaps, I should think about this some more.

I have no doubt that your support for my cause is heartfelt, {playername}, and I am grateful to you for it. But I don't think we have much of a chance of success. If you can gain renown in the battlefield and make a name for yourself as a great commander, then our friends would not hesitate to join our cause, and our enemies would be wary to take up arms against us. When that time comes, I will come with you gladly. But until that time, it will be wiser not to openly challange the usurper, {s11}.
Haven't you already taken up the cause of {s17}? You must have a very strong sense of justice, indeed. But no, thank you. I will not be part of your game.

{playername}, you are already oath-bound to serve {s15}. As such, I cannot allow you to take up my cause, and let my enemies claim that I am but a mere puppet of {s16}. No, if I am to have the throne of {s17}, I must do it due to the righteousness of my cause and the support of my subjects alone. If you want to help me, you must first free yourself of your oath to {s15}.
You are a monarch in your own right, {sir/my lady}. If you were to back me, I would be merely your puppet.

You are a capable warrior, {playername}, and I am sure with your renown as a commander, and my righteous cause, the nobles and the good people of {s12} will flock to our support. The time is ripe for us to act! I will come with you, and together, we will topple the usurper {s11} and take the throne from his bloodied hands. But first, you must give me your oath of homage and accept me as your liege {reg65?lady:lord}.
I am ready to pledge myself to your cause, {reg3?my lady:sir}.
Let us bide our time a little longer.
Forward, then! Our first task is to take hold of a fortress and persuade other lords to join us. You lead the way!
Farewell for now, then.
I heard that you have befriended that {s43} called {s6}. Believe me, you can't trust that man. You should end your dealings with him.
I assure you, {s65}, I am no friend of {s6}.
Glad news, {playername}. I would fear for your safety otherwise. If you do encounter {s6}, be on your guard and don't believe a word.
{s6} is an honourable man, you've no right to speak of him thus.
As you like, {playername}. A fool you might be, but a loyal fool at the least. {s6}'s loyalty may not be so steadfast, however...
I don't want to be involved in your quarrel with {s6}.
Hmph. As you wish, {playername}. Just remember that a {man/woman} needs friends in this world, and you'll never make any if you never stand with anyone.
Yes, my wife?
Yes, {sire/my lady}?
It is good to see you, old friend

Well, {playername}. I am willing to forgive your impudence in proclaiming yourself {king/queen}, and will welcome you into my realm with full honor, as one of my vassals. Shall we proceed to the oath of allegiance?
Yes... my lord.
No. That oath sticks in my throat.

{playername}, I've been expecting you. Word has reached my ears of your exploits. Why, I keep hearing such tales of prowess and bravery that my mind was quickly made up. I knew that I had found someone worthy of becoming my vassal.
Thank you, {s65}, you honour me with your offer.
It is good to have my true value recognised.
Aye. Let us dispense with the formalities, {playername}; are you ready to swear homage to me?
Yes, {s65}.
No, {s65}. I cannot serve you right now.
My lady, I have been giving much thought to our recent conversation. It is time for me to ask. Would you do me the honor of becoming my wife?
Yes. I would.
Let me think about this some more.
No. I have decided that it would not be appropriate
Of course, my lady. Take all the time you need.
Do you mean to reject my suit outright, my lady?
Yes. I do.
No, you misunderstand. I just need some more time to think

Well, in that case, let me tell you something -- with those harsh words, you have removed the scales from my eyes. I would agree that it would not be appropriate for me to marry one such as you. Good day, my lady.
Such is your right, my lady. If you ever wished to reconsider, I would be overwhelmed with joy.
My lady, it brings my heart great joy to see you again...
My lady, I am always your humble servant.
If it isn't my brave champion, {playername}...
If it isn't my brave champion, {playername}...
Good to see you again {playername}...
Good to see you again {playername}...
Who are you? A knight?
I'm {playername}.
I'm {playername}, madame... at your service.
I'm {playername}, and I'm not really a knight...
I know you'll one day make a great knight. Come see me again when you've been knighted. I have big plans for you... and for France.
It seems... can we talk about other things, please?
France needs brave warriors such as you. Hear the voice of heaven and join under this banner, together we will free this country and all the people who suffer.
Are you this shepherdess that everyone speaks about, Joan from Domrémy?
I carry my own banner or that of the king.
Well, if I wasn't a shepherdess I could be offended.
Do you have an action to suggest?
I have other more urgent tasks to do.
I hear voices, they come from St. Michael. He told me to lead the people of France and kick the Englishmen out of our country. Join me in my fight and I will lead you to big victory.
I'm with you, madam. It would be an honor to fight at your side.
Thank God. Be ready, I'll summon for you when it's time, and one last thing... just call me Joan.
Excuse me madam, but you seem to be mad. I wish you luck and success in your venture. May you find someone as crazy as you.
Who the hell are you, a spy for the English?
I'm {playername}, my noble king.
My name is {playername}, my lord. I'm not a spy, but a simple fighter.
I'm {playername}, valiant fighter for my own glory...
Very good... We need competent fighters. Spend your wages on drink or build a fortune, I don't care. The key is that you are ready to kill Englishmen.
What do we have here? French, Burgundian? Or maybe one of those soldiers praising their patriotism to the highest bidder? ... Talk.
I'm {playername}, my lord. Subject of the English crown.
My name is {playername}.
I'm {playername}, and you are?
I'm {playername}, valiant fighter for my own glory. Available for hire, of course.
Certainly...
Mind your manners, miserable beggar. Do you know who you are talking to?
Burgundian, pay respects to your Duke.
My name is {playername}, mighty Duke.
My name is {playername}, and you're are mistaken, Duke, I'm not Burgandian.
I am {playername}.
I guess you're one of the mercenaries I enlisted to fight those French dogs...
Usually only two categories of soldiers are sent to me, my allies and my enemies ... where do you stand?
I'm with you... great Duke.
I'm just looking for work. I'm not really a soldier and I won't make history.
I work for the highest bidder.
I'm a mercenary, working for the French.
You are correct, my Lord...

What insolence... the soldiers of your kind are only carrions who loot the corpses on the battlefield, to pay for drink in taverns... However, since your lives have a price and I happen to need vultures like you, I'm willing to listen.
Who are you, clown?
I'm {playername}, respected Duke. A mercenary, the best one you can find.
I'm {playername}, and I am not a clown.

Your excellency? Well it isn't quite according to the protocol, but certainly I'll settle for this as greetings. Although you have no rights to even greet me. A mercenary you say?... Um, where are you from?
Really... and where have you been?
From all over my lord. I have traveled to find a cause or gold, or both.
It's good, I need mercenary of the kind that you describe. You'll be well paid for work of the highest importance, or you die trying. Are you ready to take on a mercenary contract?
My sword is yours, my lord.
All in all... that seems to be a certain death. I have to reconsider.
Well stop wasting my time in that case.

Well, first of all I need a mercenary who can stop the Englishmen, because I have little confidence in any of my subjects at the present. The house of de Penthièvre in Brittany want my destruction. My titles and my possessions, nothing less. Étienne de Penthièvre is behind this, he formed militias and siege units under my very eyes as if it was nothing. Then one day he was ready to put his plan in action.

His shock troops burn crops, farmers in their beds and cattle in barns. His other agents are eager to go and spread rumours in the nearby village taverns that the current Duke does nothing for them. Do I need to continue? His shock troops were located in the Lorges forest. I rallied my troops there, but they evaded justice. Rampant corruption among my besieging forces is enabling them to move in spite of everything being clamped down. Or is it something else... that is for you to discover in my name.

Currently no resources come to me from my iron mine in the heart of the forest. Go out there and find out why. Come back alive and you will be paid beyond your wildest dreams. Do you understand mercenary?
Perfectly... my lord.
Yes... well, here's a pass that allows you to enter the forest of Lorges. Your turn now. Don't get me wrong, you're not the only one I've sent. Just no-one has came back.
Do I know you?
I am {playername}.
My name is {playername}. At your service sir.
I am {playername}, {s65}.
They know me as {playername}. Mark it down, you shall be hearing of me a lot.
We meet again, {playername}...

Splendid work, {playername} -- your audacious attack is the talk of the realm. No doubt they, or others like them, will soon be back, but for a short while you have bought this land a small respite. We are most grateful to you.
Well, {playername}, I guess that at least some of those brigands eluded you -- and of course, it will be the peaceful travellers of this land who will pay the price. Still, it was good of you to try.
Have you found sword my friend? Time is short.
Here, Joan.
I haven't find it.
It's impossible, the voices can't be wrong. Go back there and look again, that is your job.

Yes, that's right, just like the voices described it to me. Thank you very much, my friend. You should join me in the attack I'm about to launch. This is the last mission I have for you, if you agree.
Do you have the sword, my friend? Time is short, the Englishmen will eventually march to the south of France.
I haven't found it.
I don't have time to waste, I can't continue the search.
It's impossible, the voices can't be wrong. Go back there and look again, that is your job.
Well, I'll find someone else, but know that my voices told me to ask you personally.
{playername}, I have a favor to ask from you.
How to storm a wall full of archers?
Don't be afraid. You are not risking death. Just a fetch quest, however it's very important that you aren't robbed on your way back.
Tell me more.
Not enough time, I'm sorry, but I can't take part.
It's a sword. I'm not sure, but you should be able to find it at the chapel of St. Catherine of Fierbois, south of Tours.
You're not sure?
No, I mean... of course I'm sure. Just go to the chapel and bring me the sword, I beg of you.
Where can I find it exactly?
Well... I don't know. Improvise, but bring it to me.
Well, if it's possible, I'll return with it, Joan.
Thank you, I knew I could count on you.
Not enough time, I'm sorry, but I can't take part.
France needs brave warriors such as you. Hear the voice of heaven and join under this banner, together we will free this country and all the people who suffer.
I'm with you, madam. It would be an honor to fight at your side.
Thank God. Be ready, I'll summon for you when it's time, and one last thing... just call me Joan.
It's an obsession, you'd better go back to your chores and leave the battlefields for men.
Well mercenary, have you thought about my proposal?
I am with you, noble Duke.
I'm sorry, your excellency, but I don't think I am ready.

Well, first of all I need a mercenary who can stop the Englishmen, because I have little confidence in any of my subjects at the present. The house of de Penthièvre in Brittany want my destruction. My titles and my possessions, nothing less. Étienne de Penthièvre is behind this, he formed militias and siege units under my very eyes as if it was nothing. Then one day he was ready to put his plan in action.

His shock troops burn crops, farmers in their beds and cattle in barns. His other agents are eager to go and spread rumours in the nearby village taverns that the current Duke has no compassion for them. Do I need to continue? His shock troops were located in the Lorges forest. I rallied my troops there, but they evaded justice. Rampant corruption among my besieging forces is enabling them to move in spite of everything being clamped down. Or is it something else... that is for you to discover in my name.

Currently no resources come to me from my iron mine in the heart of the forest. Go out there and find out why. Come back alive and you will be paid beyond your wildest dreams. Do you understand mercenary?
Perfectly... your excellency.
Yes... well, here's a pass that'll allow you to enter of the Lorges forest. Your turn now. Don't get me wrong, you're not the only mercenary I've sent. None have yielded results.
Well, let's hear it.
My Lord, I'm here to announce that Etienne de Penthièvre died from my hands. I'm here to collect the bounty. To prove it, here's his signet ring which I recovered from his hands.
Really? Yes, that's his ring! How is this possible? You just saved my reputation. The reward is yours, and from now on I'll regard you as my go-to person in all situations.
Well mercenary, where do you stand in this case?
My lord, I found how de Penthièvre's troops escape the cordon. They have a hidden way in and out of the forest through the old mines.

Impressive, really impressive my friend. You pulled out a cursed thorn from my foot. Here's to you and know that I now consider you my best man. We will surely have other business in common, pending my troops will be able to indulge in a little extermination in this forest.
This really doesn't give a good impression... here's another, try to be careful.
Well mercenary, how's our deal?
I'm working, your excellency.
My lord, I'm afraid I have lost the pass to enter the Lorges forest.
This really doesn't give a good impression... here's another, try to be careful.
Well mercenary, where do you stand in this case?
My lord, I am pleased to announce that the production in your mine will resume. The bandits of de Penthièvre had ordered the serfs to cease all activity.
Dear Etienne de Penthièvre... this is surprising. I would've paid money to see his face at that moment, but we have other debts to collect. It seems to me you still have work to do, go back there.
Well, mercenary?
I'm working, your excellency.
My lord, I'm afraid I have lost the pass to enter the Lorges forest.
This really doesn't give a good impression... here's another, try to be careful.
Stop! Cease looking at the walls and go away from here.
Fine
Stop! Cease looking at the walls and go away from here.
Fine
Stop! Cease looking at the walls and go away from here.
Fine
Stop! Oh, it's you ...
I want to move.
Wait, I still have something to do.
Yes, yes... pay attention. Agreed? I wouldn't want to have to go in there to look for you if you disappear.
Stop! You can't pass, on the orders of the John V, the Duke of Brittany.
What a coincidence, I happen to have a pass signed by him.
Okay, I'm going.
Hmm... that's good, go, but only you. The orders are clear, no getting in or out without a pass. If you want to bring an army, it will take a pass for everyone.
Stop! You can't pass, on the orders of the John V, the Duke of Brittany.
Okay, I'm going.
Yeah yeah, I have no time to talk, you can come to the inn.
Ok...
So that rapscallion died?
Yes, indeed he did.
Well, it looks like you are not lying. I no longer see the swine poking around. All right, enter and head upstairs. We will explain the situation.
So, that knave has been dealt with?
Where can I find this guy exactly?
Damned if I know... try the forest. A simpleton with a hood, leather jacket and such.
Hey there! Where are you going?
...I want to work, I'd like to join in to wear your colors.
Really? ... Umm, in this case, I could introduce you to the chief, but need you to prove yourself. Can you kill a man that has done nothing?
For drink and gold? Of course.
Why on earth?
That's what I thought. Get out of here or I'll show you how you kill someone.

Good answer, this is what I like to hear, haha! Listen, there's a bad guy who comes and asks questions from those women and minors. Kill him and you get to see the chief. After these fine words it's time for you to act.
What are you doing here by the brush?
I'm going.
Well, have you found what you were looking for?
Yes, that's what you told me, my lord thanks.
Well, have you found what you were looking for?
Not yet, but I'm on the case.
Well? What happened?
You can relax. The miners are safe. The same can't be said of their captors.
How can I thank you? You are truly valuable mercenary!

Well, you can help me. On behalf of the Duke, I'm also responsible for finding out how the troops of de Penthièvre can freely pass in and out of the forest to make their misdeeds. Have you got any idea?
I have an idea, but I'm not sure. The miners noticed something suspicious around the old mine in the middle of the forest.

But now everything is clear! They must have found a passage out of the forest through the old tunnels. Go and find out. The entrance to the old mine is to the left upon entering the intersection from the south, you should see a sign on the ground indicating the former exploration site.
If you find anyone out there, remind them of our past.
Damn, what have you done? It's too late, the workers were all killed and their executioners buried them in the forest.

I couldn't be more sorry, I did my best... you have to make them pay. The Duke also asked me to find out how the troops of de Penthièvre can freely pass in and out of the forest to make their misdeeds. Have you got any idea?
I have an idea, but I'm not sure. The miners noticed something suspicious around the old mine in the middle of the forest.

But now everything is clear! They must have found a passage out of the forest through the old tunnels. Go and find out. The entrance to the old mine is to the left upon entering the intersection from the south, you should see a sign on the ground indicating the former exploration site.
If you find any scoundrels out there, give them hell on behalf of our lost children.
Have you found the miners? Hurry please.
I'm on it.
Are you ready to go down? Hurry please.
We have enough people to go in and descend into the tunnels!
Not yet, but I'll come back before tomorrow, or even go down alone.
Perfect. With any luck they won't notice that their leader is gone. Mind you comrades, please take these torches and prepare before going down. Try to bring everyone back alive.
Take the key to the mine and don't forget, we count on you. God be with you and the arm holding your sword.
What have you done? These soldiers are not the only ones. There are others who guard the mine workers. If they have no news of their leader, they will run everyone down!
Thank you for helping me with these brutes ... I will help you, what must I do to stop this massacre?

The Duke! Thank God, you have to find volunteers in the woods. There are many down there. Then make your way through tunnels and pray that you can kill the guards before they slaughter our own people.
Do you have any idea where I could find volunteers?
No, I don't know. Search the forest and bring everyone you can find, as soon as possible. By tomorrow they will have killed everyone, go promptly my friend.
Whoever you are, be cautious when you are dealing with this people, they are dangerous.
Do not fear.
Will you follow me, friend?
Are you the one who is investigating the miner village and its inhabitants?
Maybe.
I was summoned by the Duke of Brittany himself to investigate the mine.
Just like me then.
Okay! Then he'd have you disappear for a moment. The innkeeper let me go if I tell him what I find. We can continue the investigation together.
Are you kidding me? Out of the question. I'd rather go see the guard and tell that I killed you.
It might not work. The guard is suspicious.
You want to kill me?
No, you can go.
Still alive? Gosh, it's always a pleasure to see you come through that door.
What do you sell?
What can you tell me about my village?
I'll be back.
You won't start drinking and break because of some miner trouble, huh?
Anything else?
This is a miner village. People are working hard to extract iron on behalf of the Duke. Whatever we do we beggars always end up paying for the mistakes of others.
And the mine?
I've never set foot in it, but it seems that it descends over three levels. Realm of the Shovel Knights. No offense, I don't really care about the mine.
That for sure is what they all say.
Welcome back, is the road to the lake cleared?
The door is wide open, merchants will soon find out.
Great news! Here's to you, provisions as promised.
Welcome back, is the road to the lake cleared?
Working on it.
Do you want something else?
What do you have for food and drink?
Not at the moment, but I will.
You won't start drinking and break because of some miner trouble, huh?
For sure, they all come back.
Traveler, I have a favor to ask from you.
What do you need?
Nothing at the moment.

Goods shipments fail to reach us because the road to the lake is blockaded. If it was cleared then merchants would reach us once again and we could restock. If you are our man, we'd be grateful and offer you provisions. What do you say?
Understood, I'll see what's happening around there.
I can't for the moment.
Thank you, we believe in you.
Do you want something else?
What do you have for food and drink?
Not at the moment.
You won't start drinking and break because of some minor trouble, huh?
But this is our savior! I'll offer you a drink, any others willing to pay their share?
Thank you for the drink.
What do you sell?
What can you tell me about the miner village?
I'll be back.
It's the least we can do.
Not much in this day and age. The miners drink more than they eat.
Anything else?
This is a miner village. People are working hard to extract iron on behalf of the Duke. Whatever we do we always end up paying for the mistakes of others.
And the mine?
I've never set foot in it, but it seems that it descends over three levels. Realm of the Shovel Knights. No offense, I don't really care about the mine.
It's for sure, they all come back.
Save us, whoever you are.
Stay away.
Please, let us out of here. We haven't reassembled since I don't know when. I've never had a dry throat worse than this.
There is nothing to fear, you are free.
Please, let us out of here. Be careful, there are others.
Stay here, I'll take care of them.
Help, get us out of here.
Calm down.
Help.
You'll get out.
Let us recover.
It's almost over.
Thank you for finding my crossbow.
Thank you for the game.
Have you found my crossbow?
Got it, here.
I didn't find it. You have to learn to live without it.
This is bad news, but that's beside the point. Thank you anyway.
My crossbow! Heartfelt thanks, take this game as reward.
This game for all the trouble I went through? Such generosity, wow.
Where should I look for this crossbow...
I wish you good luck.
Have you found my crossbow? I'm sure I lost it somewhere in the deer woods.
Where's this deer den?
I'm afraid I can't take care of it.
I'm on it.
I understand. Too bad, I have to find someone else.
It's best to find a guide to take you there.
I know you patrol the forest. You'd be doing me a great service if you could find my crossbow while you're at it. I lost it when I was tracking down a beast. Surely somewhere in the deer woods.
Agreed, I'll keep my eyes open for the weapon.
I have no time.
Thank you very much, I count on you. This crossbow is of great value to me.
What do you want?
Let's go back to the inn.
I haven't finished.
Stay well behind me.
Do you need a guide? I know every corner of the forest.
Can you take me to the deers?
Naturally. It'll cost 20 crowns.
Sure... that's it.
I'm afraid not.
Maybe later.
On the way.
Turning around, you see that the door is not a door but hot air.
I think it's up to you to get away from it if you don't want to die.
I thought so.
You'll regret this!
Turning around, you see that the door is not a door but hot air.
I thought so.
What are you still doing here?
I was leaving.
You can not pass, walk away.
I'll leave for the time being.
My God, we're going to freeze to death.
Keep your calm and stay on the path.
Help! Get us out or we will die of cold!
Follow me, hurry.
What can I do for you?
I'd like to recruit mercenaries from the company, I have money.
We have {reg3} waiting for a contract. They will be yours for {reg5} crowns.
Perfect, I'll take everyone. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Currently, I can't afford to recruit as many.
Do you need anything else?
I have to leave, captain.
Get out of my sight. How do you have the nerve to appear before me? After you disobeyed my orders by trying to storm the citadel of Quintin for the bounty on the count of de Penthièvre's head?
I regret that we have come to this, captain.
Have you completed the siege of Quintin?
Yes, the Count is dead along with his family.

Do I understand that it's you who decided to take the castle without waiting for the Duke of Brittany? This will bother me for a long time. So keep your money and get the hell out. I never want see you again.
Yes, we were relieved by the army of the Duke of Bretagne.
Beautiful work, soldier. Here's your pay.
Have you completed the siege of Quintin?
...we have failed, captain.

How on earth could you mess it up when taking over only required holding the siege? Don't tell me that you and a few wretches at the tents favoured the Count. Get out of my sight, you'll get what you deserve.
Have you completed the siege of Quintin?
The relief troops haven't arrived yet, captain.
In this case, ask yourself why you are here and not at the siege? Was it absolutely necessary to leave?
What can I do for you?
Have you completed the contract for the Count of Rennes?
The mission was a success, captain.
Great news, now why not go and enjoy the city for a change. I will send a summon if I need you.
Captain, I request a new contract.

I'm not going to get you killed with these odd soldier duties. However I have something that fits your passion. You could join the ranks who are about to storm the castle of the noble that the Duke blames for treason.

The felon Count de Penthiévre must not escape punishment. The Duke put a price on his head and besieged the keep where the Count retreated with his family. We are responsible for tending the siege. When the bulk of the army arrives, the Duke will give a word to begin the assault. It seems that there's a huge bounty for the Count's head, but we only need to hold the siege and prevent any of his subjects from getting out. Is that understood?
I will hold the siege, captain.
I have to leave for now, captain. I will come by and see later if there are contracts.
Very well, in that case join the siege of Quintin. Come back when the Duke's troops relieve you. Don't try anything stupid.
I'd like to recruit mercenaries from the company, I have money.
We have {reg3} waiting for a contract. They will be yours for {reg5} crowns.
Perfect, I'll take everyone. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Currently, I can't afford to recruit as many.
Do you need anything else?
I must go.
Have you completed the contract for the Count of Rennes?
I weren't able to honor the contract, master. The crowd overwhelmed me.
That's annoying, very annoying.
Do you have another contract for me, captain? I know without fail that I can rebuild my reputation!
Really?... Well maybe you could join the ranks of soldiers, who are about to storm the castle of a noble the Duke considers responsible for treason.

The felon Count de Penthiévre must not escape punishment. The Duke put a price on his head and besieged the keep where the Count retreated with his family. We are responsible for tending the siege. When the bulk of the army arrives, the Duke will give a word to begin the assault. It seems that there's a huge bounty for the Count's head, but we only need to hold the siege and prevent any of his subjects from getting out. Is that understood?
I would like to tend the siege, captain.
I have to leave for now, captain.
Very well, in that case join the siege of Quintin. Come back when the Duke's troops relieve you. Don't try anything stupid.
Have you completed the contract for the Count of Rennes?
On it, captain.
Do not forget.
I can handle it captain.
I see, it's nice to be able to rely on your troops.
What can I do for you?
What's going on with the bandits? Did you kill them already?
They are dead captain, not one of them survived.
Excellent, here's your reward for the work.
Do you have another contract for me?

You have proven your worth by completing your last mission and coming back alive. I do have something for you. It involves guarding the entrance to a mansion of a noble Breton, who has been receiving death threats. You are to prevent the man from being killed. Use whatever means necessary.
I never refuse an opportunity, captain. I'll do it.
Standing still for hours? It isn't for me, I'm sorry.
Good. Go to Rennes and introduce yourself to the count. Do not get distracted. Good luck.
I'd like to recruit a few soldiers of yours. I can pay.
I have to leave, captain.
We have {reg3} soldiers available. They are yours for {reg5} crowns.
Fine, I'll take everyone. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Unfortunately I can't currently afford to recruit that many men.
Do you need anything else?
I must go.
What's going on with the bandits? Did you kill them already?
They took us by surprise, captain. I'm sorry.
Not so much as me.
What's going on with the bandits? Did you kill them already?
I'm working on it, captain.
I am counting on you, soldier.
I would like to recruit mercenaries from your company. I can pay.
I must beg my leave, captain.
I have {reg3} soldiers available for contract. They are yours for {reg5} crowns.
Perfect. I'll hire each and everyone. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Unfortunately I can't currently afford to recruit that many men.
That'll be all?
What can I do for you?
I would like to recruit mercenaries from your company. I can pay.
Do you need soldiers? I know how to use a weapon and follow orders.
I must beg my leave, captain.
I currently have {reg3} soldiers available for contract. They are yours for {reg5} crowns.
Perfect. I have use for everyone. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Unfortunately I can't currently afford to recruit that many men.
That'll be all?
Indeed, we are always in search of soldiers ready to fight for gold or whatever they want, as long as the orders are followed. I have an assignment which should allow you to prove yourself.
Usually our contracts don't involve chasing bandits, but this noble Breton wants to teach them a lesson and get his stolen merchandise back. You will be paid upon completion, of course.
I'd like to be in the interception force, captain!
I'm sorry, I have wounds to heal.
Perfect, these men will join you for the raid. Kill them without mercy, no survivors. Take this armor of the company and wear it proudly.
What should we do with their remains. Bury them in the forest?
Don't bother.
Greetings...
Hello.
I heard that the Duke of Brittany is looking for volunteers for a dangerous mission, but he didn't want our guys. What's that supposed to mean?
That would be good to know.
Who goes there?
I would like to recruit mercenaries from your company. I can pay.
I'm looking to join your ranks, I know how to fight.
I'm afraid I got lost, I'm leaving.
The captain's tent is at the end of the camp.
What brings you here?
I would like to recruit mercenaries from your company. I can pay.
I'm looking to join your ranks, I know how to fight.
I'm afraid I got lost, I'm leaving.
The captain's tent is at the end of the camp.
Beautiful horses.
Can I buy one?
Of course not. The company moves on foot. These horses are for the captain and he does not sell them. They are gifts from the Duke.
I’m on duty, no time to speak.
Enjoy your patrol, my friend.
Not bad, eh? I pulled these two rabbits myself. I considered sharing them... but ultimately decided against it.
I'd better leave you to your rabbits.
There's nothing quite like a nice dinner to celebrate the fact that we are still alive, right?
This is a game for you?
Maybe.
Of course you have to earn a living, but why not make yourself as comfortable as possible? I prefer to see the glass half full rather than half empty, although full glass would be even better.
How about a game of dice, friend?
Sure...
I'd like to be able to lay low like you, but sadly that's not possible.
Finally someone to take to the cleaners.
Don't touch the chests, is that understood?
Do I look like a thief?
Yes.
Where are you going? This is the captain's tent.
I want to see the captain.
I'm afraid I got lost.
What for?
I would like to recruit mercenaries from your company. I can pay.
I'm looking to join your ranks, I know how to fight.
Permission granted.

Your surgeon managed to convince my friend and made the operation.  The matter is in God's hands now, , and all we can do is pray for his recovery. Anyway, I thank you for lending your surgeon to me {sir/madam}. You have a noble spirit. I will not forget it.
May the heavens witness that I am ready to give you my {s11} {s4}, to have in marriage...
It is good to see you, {playername}. We look forward to the wedding, as soon as we can all gather together for the feast.{s12}
It is no problem. I can wait.
I have no faith that this wedding will be concluded. Please return my dower.
Well, that is your right, if you indeed have no confidence in our family's commitments. Take your money.

Hah! Our little plot against {s3} worked perfectly, {playername}. The fool has lost one of his most valuable retainers, and we are one step closer to bringing him to his knees. Here, this purse contains {reg5} crowns, and I wish you to have it. You deserve every copper. And, need I remind you, there could be much more to come if you've a mind to earn it...

You weren't able to complete a simple task. I had set up everything. The only thing you needed to do was sacrifice a messenger, and we would be celebrating now. But no, you were too damned honorable, weren't you?
Have you brought me any news about that task I gave you? You know the one I mean...
I have the reports you wanted right here.
Ahh, well done. It's good to have competent {men/people} on my side. Here is the payment I promised you.

Brilliant work, {playername}! Whatever you did, the nobles of the {s13} are clamoring for war! Soon, the time will come for us to reap the benefits of our hard work, from fields ripe for plunder. This war is going to make us rich, mark my words!

I'm told that you've collected the money owed me from {s7}. Good, it's past time I had it back. I believe I promised to give you one-fifth of it all, eh? Well, that makes {reg3} crowns, so if you give me my share -- that's {reg4} crowns -- you can keep the rest.
Of course, {s65}. {reg4} crowns, all here.
I must admit I'm impressed, {playername}. I had lost hope of ever getting this money back. Please accept my sincere thanks.
I am afraid I don't have the money with me sir.
Is this a joke? I know full well that {s7} gave you the money, and I want every denar owed to me, {sir/madam}. As far as I'm concerned, I hold you personally in my debt until I see that silver.

I heard you got rid of that poxy merchant that was causing me so much grief. I can see you're not afraid to get your hands dirty, eh? I like that in a {man/woman}. Here's your reward. Remember, {playername}, stick with me and we'll go a long, long way together.

Oh, it's you. Enlighten me, how exactly does one lose a simple fight to some poxy, lowborn merchant? Truly, if I ever need my guardsmen to take a lesson in how to lay down and die, I'll be sure to come to you. Just leave me be, {playername}, I have things to do.
You! Do you have sawdust between your ears? Did you think that when I said to kill the merchant, I meant you to have a nice chat with him and then let him go?! What possessed you?
Sir, I made sure he will not act against you.

Piffle. You were supposed to remove him, not give him a sermon and send him on his way. He had better do as you say, or you'll both regret it. Here, this is half the money I promised you. Don't say a word, {playername}, you're lucky to get even that. I have little use for {men/people} who cannot follow orders.

Beautiful work, {playername}! You captured both the spy and his handler, just as I'd hoped, and the pair are now safely ensconced in my dungeon, waiting to be questioned. My torturer shall be busy tonight! Anyway, I'm very pleased with your success, {playername}, and I give you this purse as a token of my appreciation.

Blast and damn you! I wanted TWO prisoners, {playername} -- what you've brought me is one step short of useless! I already know everything the spy knows, it was the handler I was after. Here, half a job gets you half a reward. Take it and begone.

I asked you for two prisoners, {playername}, not one. Two. Still, I suppose you did capture the spy's handler, the more important one of the pair. The spy will not dare return here and will prove quite useless to whatever master he served. 'Tis better than nothing. However, you'll understand if I pay you half the promised reward for what is but half a success.

Truly, {playername}, you are nothing short of totally incompetent. Failing to capture both the spy AND his handler plumbs astonishing new depths of failure. Forget any reward I offered you. You've done nothing to earn it.
I did my best, {s65}.
Thank you, {s65}.
Hrm. As you like, {s65}.
Splendid work, {playername}. All the serfs are back, properly cowed, and they're busy preparing for the harvest. You certainly earned your reward. Here, take it, with my compliments.

{playername}. I have been waiting patiently for my serfs, yet none have returned. Have you an explanation? Were you outwitted by simple field hands, or are you merely incompetent? Or perhaps you are plotting with my enemies, intending to ruin me...
Forgive me, {s65}, those serfs were slippery as eels.
Perhaps if you had treated them better...
Hmph, that is hardly an excuse for failure, {playername}. Now if you will excuse me, I need to recruit new men to work these fields before we all starve.
Hah, now you reveal your true colours, traitor! Your words match your actions all too well. I should never have trusted you.

You disappoint me, {playername}. There were 3 groups of serfs that I charged you to return. 3. Not {reg17}. I suppose the ones who did come back shall have to work twice as hard to make up for those that got away. As for your reward, {playername}, I'll only pay you for the serfs you returned, not the ones you let fly. Here. Take it, and let this business be done.
Thank you, {s65}. You are indeed generous.
Bah, this proved to be a waste of my time.

{playername}, I was told that you have crushed the bandits at my village of {s5}. Please know that I am most grateful to you for that. Please, let me pay the expenses of your campaign. Here, I hope these {reg14} crowns will be adequate.
Not a problem, {s65}.
Glad to be of service.
It was mere child's play.

Damn it, {playername}. I heard that you were unable to drive off the bandits from my village of {s5}, and thanks to you, my village now lies in ruins. Everyone said that you were a capable warrior, but apparently, they were wrong.
Ah, {playername}. My quartermaster has informed me of your delivery, {reg13} heads of cattle, as I requested. I'm impressed.
Not a problem, {s65}.
Glad to be of service.
Mere child's play.
You make a good scout, {playername}. My runner just brought me your reports of your scouting mission. Well done.
A simple task, {s65}.
Nothing I couldn't handle.
My pleasure, {s65}.
Cowardice is never an excuse for treason.
It was a difficult task, but it had to be done.
I will do better next time.

The army's supplies are dwindling too quickly, {playername}. I need you to bring me {reg3} heads of cattle so I can keep the troops fed. I care very little about where you get them, just bring them to me as soon as you can.
Very well, I can find you some cattle.
Sorry, sir, I have other plans.
Excellent! You know what to do, {playername}, now get to it. I need that cattle sooner rather than later.
That . . . is unfortunate, {playername}. I shall have to find someone else who's up to the task. Please go now, I've work to do.
Thank you for answering the summons, {playername}. However, as we are now at peace, we do not need your services. You may attend to your other business.
Ah, you have arrived at last, {playername}. We've been expecting you. I hope you have brought with you troops of sufficient number and experience.
I have a company of good, hardened soldiers with me. We are ready to join you.
I don't have the sufficient number of troops yet. I will need some more time.

Excellent. We'll be moving soon. Now -- you are a {man/warrior} of sound judgement, and we trust that you will do what is necessary to support our campaign. I do not require you to remain close at hand, and I will not count it against you if you believe that your forces would be of better use elsewhere. But if you do choose to remain with me, to support me in battle, that would be appreciated. I may also have additional tasks for you to perform.
Then you'd better hurry. We'll be moving out soon against the enemy and I need every able hand we can muster.

{playername}, I need a volunteer to scout the area. We're sorely lacking on information, and I simply must have a better picture of the situation before we can proceed. I want you to go to {s13}, {s14} and {s15} and report back whatever you find.
You've found your volunteer, sir.
I fear I must decline.
Good {man/lass}! Simply pass near {s13}, {s14} and {s15} and check out what's there. Make a note of anything you find and return to me as soon as possible.
Hm. I'm disappointed, {playername}. Very disappointed. We'll talk later, I need to go and find somebody to scout for us.
You have been most helpful, {playername}. My thanks.
It was an honour to serve.
I think you owe me {reg1} crowns, {playername}. Do you intend to pay your debt anytime soon?
That is why I came, {s65}. Here it is, every denar I owe you.
Alas, I don't have sufficient funds, {s65}. But I'll pay you soon enough.
Ah, excellent. You are a {man/woman} of honour, {playername}. I am satisfied. Your debt to me has been paid in full.
Well, don't keep me waiting much longer.
By the way, I hope you get a chance to meet my {s11}, {s14}.
By the way, I am sure that my {s11}, {s14}, would be delighted were you to pay her a visit. She awaits you in her chambers.

I heard that you have captured our enemy {s3} and he is with you at the moment. I can pay you {reg6} crowns for him if you want to get rid of him. You can wait for his family to pay his ransom of course, but there is no telling how long that will take, eh?
I accept your offer. I'll leave {s3} to you for {reg6} crowns.
I fear I can't accept your offer.
Excellent! Here's your {reg6} crowns. I'll send some men to take him to our prison with due haste.
Mmm. As you wish, {playername}, but you'll not get a better offer. Take it from me.
I lift a {s5} to your health, {playername}! You are most gracious to host us on this occasion. Now, what is it?
To your health, {sire/your Highness}. Long may you reign. What is your bidding?
What is your bidding?
I wish to welcome you to my hall on this auspicious occasion. Now, what is it?
Let us lift a {s5} to the health of our host, {s4}. Now, what is it?
I have the materials for {s4}'s gift.
Ah, let me take those. Hopefully this will mend the quarrel between you two. You may wish to speak to {reg4?her:him}, and see if I had any success.
My lord -- there is something I wish to tell you in confidence, about one of your vassals.
Whatever you have to say, I would ask you to wait until we are alone.
What is it? I value your opinion, although I hope that you are not trying to sew dissension among my vassals?
My liege -- {s4} is widely held by your vassals to be {s5}, and a liability to your realm
Actually, my liege, never mind.

Hmm... This is troubling to hear. Although I do not encourage my vassals to speak ill of each other, I value your opinion. Perhaps I should think twice about granting {s4} any further fiefs or offices...

Sew discord among my vassals, will you? With everything else going on, do you think I appreciate my nobles turning on each other like quarreling dogs? Let me ask you this -- did someone put you up this?
I stand by my words, my liege.
Yes, sire -- {s4} put me up to denouncing {s5}!
Indeed. You may stand by your words, but keep them to yourself. I will not have you undercutting my faithful follower {s4}.
I thought as much. Here's some advice for you, {lad/lassie} -- don't meddle in the quarrels of others. Now, enough of this.
I want to tell you something -- we have had enough of your {s4} ways
I'm sorry... What did you say?
You heard me. You will {s4}
Never mind. You must have misheard me.

Why would you say such a thing? To insult me like this, in spite of our friendship -- how much more cruel is a knife in my back from an erstwhile friends, than the sword of a sworn foe. I do not know what game you are playing, but I want no part of it. Go away. I do not want to look at you.
Hmph. Really? Is that your opinion, or did one of my rivals put those words in your mouth? Never mind. I will not play your game. Go away, and take your intrigues with you.
I will not have you shame me in public, {sir/my lady}. Retract your words, or meet me on the duelling ground.
Is that so? Well, hear this -- you're a snake, and a knave, and -- if you don't meet me on the duelling ground -- a coward. What say you to that? Do you retract your words, or shall we cross swords?
It would be a pleasure to fight you.
I spoke rashly. I retract my words.
I thought as much. Now, be gone from here.
But enough talking - yield or fight!
Anything else?
Anything else?
I wish to address your quarrel with {s11}
Stay your hand! There is something I must say to you in private.
I am hunting a group of bandits with the following description... Have you seen them?
Who do you think should be made the marshal of our realm?
Whom do you think should receive the fief of {s4}?
I need you to renounce your allegiance to {s4} and join the {s5} now, my husband.
Ask me again when we are outside of these walls, my wife.
As you wish, my wife.
There is a matter which I would like to discuss in private.
There is something which I would like to discuss with to you in private.
