Dear {playername}, you are kind to ask, but you know little of my troubles and I can't possibly ask you to throw yourself into danger on my behalf.
Tell me what the problem is, and I can make my own decision.

Very well, as you wish it... My husband has made certain enemies in his life, {playername}. One of the most insidious is {s13}. He is going around making terrible accusations against me, impugning my honour at every turn! Because he cannot harm my husband directly, he is using me as a target to try and stain our name. You should hear the awful things he's said! I only wish there was someone brave enough to make him recant his slander, but {s13} is a very fine swordsman, and he's widely feared...
I fear him not, {s65}. I will make him take back his lies.

Oh! I can't ask that of you, {playername}, but... I would be forever indebted to you, and you are so sure. It would mean so much if you would defend my honour. Thank you a thousand times, all my prayers and my favour go with you.
If he's that dangerous, perhaps maybe it would be better to ignore him...
Oh... Perhaps you're right, {playername}. I should let go of these silly childhood ideas of chivalry and courage. {Men/People} are not like that, not anymore. Good day to you.
No, {playername}, I've no need for a champion right now.
As you wish it, {s65}, it shall be done.
{s66}, I fear I cannot help you right now.
You are a true {gentleman/lady}, {playername}. Thank you so much for helping me
You'll not help a woman in need? You should be ashamed, {playername}... Please leave me, I have some important embroidery to catch up.
I want to improve my relation with a lord. Can you help me?
{playername}, I don't know you well enough to act on your behalf. I am sorry.
Hmm. I guess you got on the wrong side of somebody. Very well, who do you want to restore your relation with?
Never mind. I get along with everyone well enough.
Well I can try to help you there. I am sure a few expensive gifts will make {s10} look at you more favorably.

You can improve your relation with {s10} by sending {reg4?her:him} a gift worth {reg10} crowns. But if you can afford spending {reg11} crowns on the gift, it would make a good impression on {reg4?her:him}. And if you can go up to {reg12} crowns, that would really help smooth things out.
I think a gift of {reg10} crowns will do.
Maybe I can afford {reg11} crowns.
In that case, I am ready to spend {reg12} crowns.
I don't think I can afford a gift at the moment.
Excellent. Then I'll choose an appropriate gift for you and send it to {s10} with your compliments. I am sure {reg4?she:he} will appreciate the gesture.
Thank you for your help, madame.
I am afraid, I can't be of much help in that case, {playername}. I am sorry.
I must beg my leave.
I still don't see why I should accept what you're asking of me.
Then I'll make it worth your while. ({reg8} crowns)
Please, do it for the sake of our friendship. (-{reg9} to relation)
Let me try and convince you. (Persuasion)
Never mind.
Mmm, a generous gift to my coffers would certainly help matters... {reg8} crowns should do it. If you agree, then I'll go with your suggestion.
I'm afraid my finances will not allow for such a gift.
Very well, please accept these {reg8} crowns as a token of my gratitude.
Let me think about this some more.
Ah. In that case, there is little I can do, unless you have some further argument to make.
My dear {playername}, your generous gift has led me to reconsider what you ask, and I have come to appreciate the wisdom of your proposal.
You've done well by me in the past, {playername}, and for that I will go along with your request, but know that I do not like you using our relationship this way.
I am sorry, my friend, but I need your help in this.
If it will not please you, then I'll try something else.
All right then, {playername}, I will accept this for your sake. But remember, you owe me for this.
I don't think I owe you such a favor {playername}. I see no reason to accept this for you.
Is this a joke? You've some nerve asking me for favours, {playername}, and let me assure you you'll get none.
Very well. Make your case.
[Attempt to persuade]
Wait, perhaps there is another way to convince you.
By God's grace, {playername}! Haven't we talked enough already? I am tired of listening to you, and I do not want to hear any more of it right now.
All right, all right. You have persuaded me to it. I'll go ahead with what you suggest.
You've a point, {playername}, I'll admit that much. However I am not yet convinced I should do as you bid.
Enough, {playername}. You've a lot of arguments, but I find none of them truly convincing. I stand by what I said before.
Truthfully, {playername}, I fail to see the virtue of your reasoning. What you ask for makes even less sense now than it did before.
I must congratulate you on your victory, my {lord/lady}. Welcome to {s1}. We, the housekeepers of this castle, are at your service.
Are you the seneschal?

Indeed I am, my {lord/lady}. I have always served the masters of {s1} to the best of my ability, whichever side they might be on. Thus you may count on my utmost loyalty for as long as you are the {lord/lady} of this place. Now, do you intend to keep me on as the seneschal? I promise you will not be disappointed.
Very well, you may keep your post for the time being.
You can stay, but I shall be keeping a close watch on you.
Thank you, my {lord/lady}. If you do not mind my impudence, may I inquire as to what you wish to do with the castle?
I will sell it to another lord.
I intend to claim it for myself.
I haven't given it much thought. What are my options?

According to our laws and traditions, you can do one of several things. First, you could station a garrison here to protect the castle from any immediate counterattacks, then request an audience with some wealthy lord and ask him to make you an offer. It would be worth a tidy sum, believe you me. If you do not wish to sell, then you will have to find yourself a liege lord and protector who would accept homage from you. Without a royal investiture and an army at your back, you would have a difficult time holding on to the castle. Both you and {s1} would become great big targets for any man with a few soldiers and a scrap of ambition.
What do you mean, a liege lord and protector? I won this place by my own hand, I don't need anyone else!

Of course you don't, my {lord/lady}. However, no lord in the land will recognize your claim to the castle unless it is verified by royal decree. They would call {s1} an outlaw stronghold and take it from you at the earliest opportunity. Surely not even you could stand against a whole army.
Hmm. I'll give it some thought.

I am very pleased to hear it, my {lord/lady}. I am only trying to serve you to the best of my ability. Now, if at any time you find you have further need of me, I will be in the great hall arranging a smooth handover of the castle to your forces.
Good day, {sir/madam}. I do nott believe I've seen you here before. Let me extend my welcome to you as the seneschal of {s1}.
A pleasure to meet you, {s65}.
How can I help you?
What exactly do you do here?

Ah, a seneschal's duties are many, good {sire/woman}. For example, I collect the rents from my lord's estates, I manage the castle's storerooms, I deal with the local peasantry, I take care of castle staff, I arrange supplies for the garrison... All mundane matters on this fief are my responsibility, on behalf of my lord. Everything except commanding the soldiers themselves.
Good day, {sir/madam}.
Anything else?
I would like to ask you a question...
I wish to know more about someone...
Perhaps I may be able to help. Whom did you have in mind?
Never mind.
I must take my leave of you now. Farewell.
I'll do what I can to help, of course. What did you wish to ask?
Perhaps you know where to find someone...
Well, a man in my position does hear a lot of things. Of whom were you thinking?
Never mind.
Get lost before I lose my temper you vile beggar!
We've made it this far... Is everything clear up ahead?
There might be bandits nearby. Stay close.
Trust me, {playername}, we're already staying as close to you as we can. Lead the way.
No sign of trouble, we can breathe easy.
I'll breathe easy when we reach {s1} and not a moment sooner. Let's keep moving.
What do you want? We paid our toll to you less than three days ago.
Hail, friend.
What do you want? We are but simple merchants, we've no quarrel with you, so leave us alone.
Be warned, knave! This caravan is under the protection of {s9}. Step out of our way or you will face his fury!
Yes? What do you want?
Anything else?
You are trespassing in the territory of the {s17}. I am confiscating this caravan and all its goods!
What? What nonsense is this? We are at peace with the {s17}, and are free to cross its lands!
We'll see about that! Defend yourselves!
Hmm. Maybe this was all a misunderstanding. Farewell.
I have an offer for you.
What is it?
I can escort you to your destination for a price.
Nothing. Forget it
I am hunting a group of bandits with the following description... Have you seen them?
Tell me about your journey
We are coming from {s11} and heading to {s12}.{s14}
I demand something from you!
What do you want?
There is a toll for free passage here!
Please, I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} crowns, just let us go.
I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} crowns if you'll let us go.
Agreed, hand it over and you may go in peace.
Very well then. Here's {reg6} crowns.
I changed my mind, I can't take your money.
No, I want everything you have! [Attack]
Hand over your gold and valuables now!
Nothing. Forget it.
Are you robbing us?{s11}
Robbing you? No, no! It was a joke.
God, don't joke about that, {lad/lass}. For a moment I thought we were in real trouble.
Of course I'm robbing you. Now hand over your goods.
Damn you, you won't get anything from us without a fight!
These roads are dangerous indeed. One can never have enough protection.
An escort? We're almost there already! Thank you for the offer, though.
We are heading to {s1}. I will pay you {reg2} crowns if you escort us there.
Agreed.
I want you to stay close to us along the way. We'll need your help if we get ambushed by bandits.
Don't worry, you can trust me.
Good. Come and collect your money when we're within sight of {s1}. For now, let's just get underway.
Forget it.
Perhaps another time, then.
Not so fast. First, hand over all your goods and money.
Never. It is our duty to protect these goods. You shall have to fight us, brigand!
[Leave]
Do you have anything interesting to sell in your cargo?
Look, and quickly please... because of brigands.
Good day, my {lord/lady}. Will you be visiting the prison?
Yes. Unlock the door.
No, not now.
Yes? What do you want?
Who is imprisoned here?
I want to speak with a prisoner.
Currently, {s50} {reg1?are:is} imprisoned here.{s49}
Of course, {sir/madam}. Go in.
You need to get permission from the lord to talk to prisoners.
There is nobody inside, therefore you can freely go inside and look around.
All right then. I'll take a look at the prison.
I have more important business to do.
All right then. I'll try that.
Come on now. I thought you were the boss here.
He-heh. You got that right. Still, I can't let you into the prison.
All right then. I'll leave now.
I found a purse with 100 crowns a few paces away. I reckon it belongs to you.

Ah! I was looking for this all day. How good of you to bring it back {sir/madam}. Well, now that I know what an honest {man/lady} you are, there can be no harm in letting you inside for a look. Go in.... Just so you know, though -- I'll be hanging onto the keys, in case you were thinking about undoing anyone's chains.
Give me the keys to the cells -- now!
Help! Help! Prison break!
Never mind.
Your orders, {Lord/Lady}?
Open the door. I'll go in.
Never mind.
Get out of my sight, beggar! You stink!
You have come just in time. Let us join our forces now and teach our enemy a lesson.
I want to enter the hall and speak to the lord.
[Leave]
Are you out of your mind, {man/woman}? Beggars are not allowed into the hall. Now get lost or I'll beat you bloody.
What do you want?
I want to enter the hall and speak to the lord.
Never mind.
I'm afraid there is a feast in progress, and you are not invited.
You can go in after leaving your weapons with me. No one is allowed to carry arms into the lord's hall.
Here, take my arms. I'll go in.
No, I give my arms to no one.
Then you can't go in.
What do you want?
Yes?
We need shelter for the night. Will you let us in?
I want to speak with the lord of the castle.
I want to speak with someone in the castle.
[Leave]
Wait here. {s2} will see you.
My lord is not here now.
Who is that?
Never mind.
Wait there. I'll send him your request.
I'm waiting...
All right. {s2} will talk to you now.
{s2} says he will not see you. Begone now.
My lord {s2} will be happy to see you {sir/madam}. Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
My lord {s2} is not in the castle now. But I think he would approve of you taking shelter here. Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
Come on in. But make sure your men behave sensibly within the walls. My lord {s2} does not want trouble here.
My lord {s2} does not want you here. Begone now.
You are making a big mistake by fighting against us.
Again you save our necks, {playername}! Truly, you are the best of friends. {s43}
I don't think we have met properly my friend. You just saved my life out there, and I still don't know your name...
Your help was most welcome stranger. My name is {s1}. Can I learn yours?
Thanks for your help, stranger. We haven't met properly yet, have we? What is your name?
My name is {playername}.
Well met indeed {playername}. My name is {s1} and I am forever in your debt. If there is ever anything I can help you with, just let me know...
Well met {playername}. I am in your debt for what you just did. I hope one day I will find a way to repay it.
Well met {playername}. I am {s1}. Thanks for your help and I hope we meet again.
You arrived just in the nick of time! {playername}. You have my deepest thanks! {s43}
You turned up just in time, {playername}. I will not forget your help. {s43}
Good to see you here, {playername}. {s43}
Thank you for your help {sir/madam}. You saved {reg1?our lives:my life} out there.
Thank you for your help {sir/madam}. Things didn't look very well for us but then you came up and everything changed.
Thank you for your help, {sir/madam}. It was fortunate to have you nearby.
Oh {sir/madam}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
I am in your debt for freeing me friend.
You're not going anywhere. You'll be my prisoner now!
Alas. Will my luck never change?
You're free to go, {s65}.
Thank you, good {sire/lady}. I never forget someone who's done me a good turn.
Would you like to join me?
All right I will join you.
No, I want to go on my own.
You'll not live long to enjoy your victory. My kinsmen will soon wipe out the stain of this defeat.
You are my prisoner now.
Damn you. You will regret this.
You're free to go this time, but don't cross my path again.
We will meet again.
I think that is a wise move. Good luck to you.

Your relations with {s4} are not all that they could be. As {reg4?she:he} is my {s11}, I can mediate to attempt to mend your quarrel. Perhaps the best way for me to do this would be to send {reg4?her:him} a gift -- a fur-trimmed velvet robe, perhaps. If you can provide me with a bolt of velvet and a length of furs, I can have one made and sent to {reg4?her:him.}
Splendid. I shall await the materials.

As you may realize, {s4} has many enemies among the lords of the {s5}. In particular, they feel that {reg4?she:he} is {s7}, and worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. Were you to denounce {s4} to {reg4?her:his} face, you may reap much popularity -- although, of course, you would make an enemy of {reg4?her:him}, and risk being challenged to a duel.

As you may realize, many of us in the peerage of the {s5} consider {s4} to be {s7}, and a liability to our cause. We worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. People know my views on {s4} already, but if you were to denounce {reg4?her:him} to {reg4?her:his} face, you would further erode his standing -- and discourage our liege from entrusting {reg4?her:him} with any more power or responsibility. Of course, you would make an enemy of {reg4?her:him}, and risk being challenged to a duel.{s9}
We appreciate what you are doing. I find such intrigues distasteful, but it is all for the good of the {s5}.
Very well. It is always risky to involve yourself in intrigues of this sort, but in this case, I think you will benefit.

You and I have a common interest in seeking to curtail the rise of {s4}. I feel that {reg4?she:he} is {s7}, and worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. Were you to tell our liege {s9} your opinion of {s4}, it might discourage {s9} from granting {s4} any further powers or responsibilities, at least for a while, and I would be much obliged to you.
I cannot think of anything right now, but we will have some items of mutual interest in the future.
I like that idea.
Hmm.. Maybe you can think of something else?
Let us discuss another topic
Very well.
Very well.
Very well.
Very well.
Mercy! Please don't kill me!
I have nothing against you man. But {s2} wants you dead. Sorry.
Damn you! May you burn in Hell!
I'll let you live, if you promise me...
Of course, I promise, I'll do anything. Just spare my life...
You are going to forget about {s2}'s debt to you. And you will sign a paper stating that he owes you nothing.
Yes, of course. I'll do as you say.
And if my lord hears so much of a hint of a complaint about this issue, then I'll come back for you, and it won't matter how much you scream for mercy then. Do you understand me?
Yes {sir/madam}. Don't worry. I won't make any complaint.
Good. Go now, before I change my mind.
What do you want?
I am looking for a murderer by the name of {s4}. You fit his description.
Nothing. Sorry to trouble you.
I don't understand, {sir/madam}. I never killed anyone. I think you've got the wrong man.
Then drop your sword. If you are innocent, you have nothing to fear. We'll go now and talk to your neighbours, and if they verify your story, I'll go on my way.
I'm not going anywhere, friend. You're going to have to fight for your silver, today.
No problem. I really just need your head, anyway.
I come not for money, but to execute the law!
Alas, that you cannot be made to see reason.
Die, dog!
Yes {sir/madam}?
Take this letter to {s1} and give it to {s2}.
Nothing. Nothing at all.
Yes {sir/madam}. You can trust me. I will not fail you.
Good. I will not forget your service. You will be rewarded when you return.
Aargh! I can't do this. I can't send you to your own death!
What do you mean {sir/madam}
There's a trap set up for you in the town. {s3} ordered me to sacrifice one of my chosen warriors to fool the enemy, but he will just need to find another way.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. I will follow you to the gates of hell. But this would not be a good death.
Don't worry, {sir/madam}, I'm on my way.
Good day {sir/madam}. Such fine weather don't you think? If you'll excuse me now I must go on my way.
In the name of {s1}, you are under arrest!
You won't get me alive!
Never mind me. I was just passing by.
Greetings.
In the name of {s1} You are under arrest!
You will have to fight us first!
Never mind me. I was just passing by.
Good day {sir/madam}.
I have been sent by your {s4} whom you are running from. He will not punish you if you return now.
My good {sir/madam}. Our lives at our village {s1} was unbearable. We worked all day long and still went to bed hungry. We are going to {s6} to start a new life, where we will be treated like humans.
You have gone against our laws by running from your bondage. You will go back to {s1} now!
Well, maybe you are right. All right then. If anyone asks, I haven't seen you.
All right {sir/madam}. As you wish. We'll head back to {s5} now.
God bless you, {sir/madam}. We will not forget your help.
Good day {sir/madam}. Don't worry. If anyone asks, we haven't seen you.
I have changed my mind. You must back to your village!
Good. Go quickly now before I change my mind.
Good day {sir/madam}. We were heading back to {s5}, but I am afraid we lost our way.
Do not test my patience. You are going back now!
Well, if you are that eager to go, then go.
We are on our way back to {s5} {sir/madam}.
Make haste now. The sooner you return the better.
Good. Keep going.
Yes {sir/madam}. As you wish.
This must be your unlucky day, mate. We're just about the worst people you could run into, in these parts.
Heh. For me, you are nothing more than walking money bags. A merchant in {s1} offered me good money for your heads.
A bounty hunter! Kill {him/her}! Kill {him/her} now!
What do you want? You want to pay us some more money?
Sorry to trouble you. I'll be on my way now.
Yeah. Stop fooling around and go make some money. I want to see that purse full next time I see you.
No. It's your turn to pay me this time.
What nonsense are you talking about? You want trouble? You got it.
We are the free brothers. We will fight only for ourselves from now on. Now give us your gold or taste our steel.
When I'm done with you, you'll regret ever leaving your army.
There's no need to fight. I am ready to pay for free passage.

Good. You are clever. Now, having a look at your baggage, I reckon a fellow like you could pretty easily afford {reg5} crowns. We wouldn't want to be too greedy, now would we? Pay us, and then you can go.
All right here's your {reg5} crowns.
I don't have that much money with me
Too bad. Then we'll have to sell you to the slavers.
Heh. That wasn't difficult, now, was it? All right. Go now.
Welcome to the tavern of the Three Crowns... do you want to drink or eat? Paris is a great city, and as I always say, there are so many more good things than bad.
Good day, what do you want?
Please, pay your food and drink, and do not fuss... I've already seen enough of armed customers killing my business.
Greetings, you are at the Blue Boar. What can I do for you?
Good day, sit down for a drink.
Enter the Golden Pheasant... you'll have everything you desire.
Greetings traveller, come relax and dine by the fire.
Welcome to Marseille, what can I serve you?
Greetings, if you have money, I can offer you the specialties of our region.
Enter nobleman, if you have enough crowns, you'll be the king in my tavern.
Good day, enter the warm. I suggest you spend the night here, instead of outside with the wolves... what will it be?
Hello my lord, what do you drink?
Hello sir, you are in Bernard's Basement, what do you want?
Good day, would you like to try our best wine? Many people travel miles to have a taste.
Welcome to Floating Barrel, the best restaurant in Orléans.
Hello my lord, what do you drink?
Hello and welcome to the tavern of Two Deers. What do you want?
Anything else?
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}.

At last! My stock was almost depleted. I had paid the cost of the {s4} in advance. Here, take these {reg5} crowns. That should cover your pay. And give {s9} my regards. I'll put in a good word for you next time I deal with him.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost some of the cargo on the way.

Attacked by bandits eh? You are lucky they left you alive. Anyway, I can pay you no more than {reg5} crowns for this. And I will let {s1} know that my order was delivered less than completely, so you will probably be charged for this loss.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost the cargo on the way.
What? I was waiting for that {s4} for weeks! And now you are telling me that you lost it? You may rest assured that I will let {s1} know about this.
I'd like to buy every man who comes in here tonight a jar of your best wine.
Of course, {my lord/my lady}. I reckon {reg5} crowns should be enough for that. What should I tell the lads?
Let everyone know of the generosity of {playername} to the people of {s10}.
Don't worry {sir/madam}. Your name will be cheered and toasted here all night.
Actually, cancel that order.
Have you heard of anyone in this realm who might have a job for a {man/woman} like myself?
Hmm... Well, {s10} is often looking for mercenaries to fight in his wars.{s9}
Let me think some more...
I have heard that {s7} {s9}{s10} You may want to speak with {reg4?her:him}.

There may be other work, of course -- lords and guildmasters often have other tasks which we don't hear about. Also, the villages around here frequently need help, although they'd be more likely to pay you with a wedge of cheese and goodwill than with cold hard crowns.
I keep my ears open to other opportunities, ask me again from time to time.
What do you sell?
What do you need?
Anything else?
Anything particularly interesting to see in France?
The market of Bordeaux is worth a look, the St. Catherine street is full of merchants.
There's the great forge in Orleans, they make the best weapons there.
The Royal Stables in Paris are a sight to behold they say. They breed the best horses, it even seems that that you could actually buy one these days.
If you happen to get hurt, there's a very good doctor in Dijon. At least that's what the travelers have reported to me, I've never checked.
It seems that the Monastery of the Ladies in Marseille is infected with the plague. God forbid.
Be careful if you happen to go near the slums of Paris. That is a den of thieves and all kinds of thugs.
There is a siege engine workshop near Limoges. They say they are manufacturing new kinds of weapons there. Only if those could help us win this war...
There is a company of mercenaries based in Bourges. They recruit trained men at arms. It seems they pay well.

You could you commit yourself being a messenger if you have a fast horse. They don't pay so well but they have a lot of work to offer, that's what I keep hearing. You can find one of their guildmasters in Bourges, Bordeaux, Calais and Marseille.
Thank you for the information.
I don't feel like talking to you, please leave.
Well... if you want my opinion, we should take up arms and liberate France ourselves, expelling home-grown nobles at the same time.
What do you think of this war?

What I think?... It's too long. While the nobles dispute their land, peasants and honest people die in battle or elsewhere. For us little people, it's either die starving or on the field of honor. This strange choice even keeps coming back.
Can we do anything to change that?
What do you want... it's the way things are.
I've already said too much...
I'd like to learn to cook rations for my company, can you help me?
It's possible, but you have to pay for kitchen utensils and ingredients.
I'll pay.
I've spent enough for today, maybe later.

Well, you'll have to get a cauldron, kitchen utensils and some recipes. I just happen to have an extra cauldron that I could sell you for 230 crowns. I part with my utensils for 30 crowns, and every recipe you buy is 25 crowns. What do you want first?
I'd like a cauldron.
I'll take the kitchen utensils.
Show me your recipes?
I do not have enough gold...
And now you say that... still, I spent time trying to help you. If you don't have gold to spend, I suggest you go to win some and come back later... no offense, but this is a business, not a charity.
Thank you, anything else?
Thank you, anything else?
Well, I have recipes for vegetable soup, cabbage stew and fish soup. Which one do you want?
I'll take the recipe for vegetable soup.
I'll take the recipe for cabbage stew.
I think the fish soup should be interesting.
That's all for the moment.
Thank you, anything else?
Thank you, anything else?
Thank you, anything else?
That's all for the moment.
Want to play some dice?
Of course... it's not like I have any work to do.
Can I ask you a delicate question?
About what?
What would you like to discuss?
About women.
I can't tell you anything. Complete mystery, leave now.
...what do you want to know exactly?
Why should I marry...

Women... they say they want to take care of your property and cherish your offspring, no matter the size of your d... I mean your purse, of course. Indeed they'll take care of every one of your crowns.
I think we are defeated in advance...
I've been advised to keep my nose out of these things...
We must not lose hope... even though we were defeated, we'll see that God wants France to return to his people, have faith.
You are right... keep the faith and God will lead us to victory.
I really have to be in trouble to consider discussing this with the landlord...
Well spoken, can I serve you something?
What should I do if I was injured?
Well... if you were in pain, you could rest in the shelters of a tavern. If you were severely affected, you should look for a priest to heal you with his medicine.
Who could teach me to fight?
You'll surely find soldiers ready to teach their knowledge to a novice if you pay them properly. Start looking in cities and ask around.
You must hear incredible stories in your tavern?
Want to hear another story?

It's said that King Charles VI was mad... mad to the point of screaming and running around chasing people. I guess that royalty is also failing... eh... wait, I just understood why England declared war...
Yes, another story... hopefully a little better.

Ha, well... let me think... yes, have you heard of the three-horned beast? Yes, it would seem that it's hiding in the ruined castles, coming only out when hungry. Some say it's satan itself. Others believe that the beast was born in the beginning of the war. To make war with men and overcome all...
You want another?
Yes... and put me up for a drink.

Listen carefully... have you heard of Joan the Maid? This little shepherdess out of Domrémy. It seems, and I surely didn't invent it, that she soundly defeated an entire regiment of British soldiers, even better, captured a fortress by herself. The mere sight of her banner would bewitch soldiers, who would throw themselves into a river... Some say it's the work of an archangel, others think the devil is behind it. In any case, that's what is being said. Well, I can't talk to you any more, it's getting late.
You just made that up... for the sole purpose of making me drink... do I really look like a peasant?
I've heard enough... it's silly.
I have better things to do than talk.
I think I'd better go now...
Let me drink.
I don't like to drink alone.
You can drink all your booze, farewell.
Oh, yes? What would you say to a contest in this case? We put the money on the table and the one who is still standing leaves with it, what do you think?
A contest? Sounds good, I just needed an excuse to drink like a Templar.
I think I have better things to do than sleep on the floor of the tavern.
Here we drink mead, you think you're strong enough? So how much are you willing to bet, you little bitch?
10 crowns.
20 crowns.
30 crowns.
40 crowns.
50 crowns.
100 crowns.
That's enough.
Little bitch...
The first glass ... together.
RHA! It's good, eh? Again.
It was only to warm up, another.
No, I'll be fine, thanks for the drink.
Harf!... not bad.
Already tired, my friend? Come on, third.
I'll be fine, thanks for the drink.
Hey, hey hey hey... ha, ha ha!
I feel bad...
One more....for the road, hic!
That's enough... thank you, let's stop.
Ah... you didn't tell me where you goin, hic! Go... last.
Lassst Glassss, and you win, hic.
Need to sleep, keep the change, hic.
I'll take this gold, sweet dreams, friend...
Let me drink.
I don't like to drink alone.
You can drink all your booze, farewell.
Oh, yes? What would you say to a contest in this case? We put the money on the table and the one who is still standing leaves with it, what do you think?
A contest? Sounds good, I just needed an excuse to drink like a Templar.
I think I have better things to do than sleep on the floor of the tavern.
Here we drink mead, you think you're strong enough? So how much are you willing to bet, you little bitch?
10 crowns.
20 crowns.
30 crowns.
40 crowns.
50 crowns.
100 crowns.
That's enough.
Little bitch...
The first glass ... together.
RHA! It's good, eh? Again.
It was only to warm up, another.
No, I'll be fine, thanks for the drink.
Harf!... not bad.
Already tired, my friend? Come on, third.
I'll be fine, thanks for the drink.
Hey, hey hey hey... ha, ha ha!
I feel bad...
One more....for the road, hic!
That's enough... thank you, let's stop.
Ah... you didn't tell me where you goin, hic! Go... last.
Lassst Glassss, and you win, hic.
Need to sleep, keep the change, hic.
I'll take this gold, sweet dreams, friend...
Sir, come here. You look strong in combat, are you a soldier?
You can say that, what can I do for you?
No, I'm a merchant, farewell.

I organize fights in the cellar of the tavern, if you are interested you will be able to earn money by betting on you while reporting your bets to me. You say that this doesn't sound honest? Of course, these are not fights to the death, you will only risk a broken nose or a notch on the arm.
I am your man.
What kind of weapons do we fight with?

No worries for a champion such as you, you'll stick with a simple dagger, barely sharpened with a history that shows the blood of previous fighters. Not very impressive for a fighter of course, don't you agree? Good...
I have no pleasure in injuring myself of my own free will.
Beautiful, beautiful... just enter through this door and don't get seen, good luck.
Give us some of the money.
There will be plenty of blood.
What type of animal are you?
We want a show.
We're all here for this.
You pig.
Go talk to bookmaker ... know that I will not bet on you, so try to lose.
Well... good luck.
I would be happy to make you lose money.
When I'm done with you, you'll piss like never before.
You seem pretty sure of yourself for someone who's going to lose.
Why so much hatred? And if we were content with....
Go tell gamblers that I'm ready to kill another son of a bitch.
The winner is ... you ... amazing.
What about my winnings?
It wasn't that hard, find someone else next time.
What do you mean?
These gentlemen might like to bet on a fight between you and me...
Ah! Yes of course, bets... well, hello.
Are you ready, sir?
I want to bet on myself.
I'm ready, I would fight for nothing, just to keep me in shape...
I want to get out of here right now.
What, is that a joke? Oh, I get it, kid.
Of course, how much do you want to lose?
20 crowns.
50 crowns.
100 crowns.
Nothing.
It's very funny...
Sirs, no unfair shots and do not finish too fast, give us time to enjoy...
Fight !!!
Good evening. These muscles... they all seem so stiff. Allow me to rub one in particular... for a few pieces of course.
How much?
I don't need your service.
200 crowns.
Hmm... what better can you get with that price?
That's 200 crowns too much.
Master, I am your faithful servant. I could soothe and satisfy you... for the evening, of course. I have a grandfather to feed at dawn.
Okay, if you speak no more.
Not this time.
Okay, please follow me.
Stop! Where do you think you're going, miscreant?
We may be able to come to an arrangement...
We'll try to find one after your death.
I'm accusing! Attempting to steal the goods from Freemasons is punishable by Death.
And if you explain to me what's going on...
Enough talking, time to act.
You will not regret it. Be assured, I told you everything I know.
In that case, goodbye.
You're back, are you finally interested in my precious information?
Remind me of your story.
Not at the moment, we'll see later.

Were you drunk when I told you about it? The clues, the templar order, the masonic organization and especially the treasure! The information, which will put you on the trail of the treasure of the Templars, yours only for 3000 crowns.
That's okay, I'll try my luck.
Not at the moment, I have to think about it.
Well, I'll continue traveling as long as no one has freed me from this cursed treasure, it's the only thing on my mind.

You are making a good deal, trust me. Well... you'll have to look for the Map of the Secret Temples, that's where they stored the gold of the crusades and their many incomes. For the time being the clue will take you to the library of the Benedictine abbey of Micy in Orléans, good luck.
You have before you an exhausted man, but also a man who has the best deal to offer that you've ever heard. What do you say to that?
It doesn't hurt to listen, what is it?
I say no. Sorry, have had a good night. Farewell.

Well that's my story, but first do you know of the order of the Templars? They were very powerful and very rich, until their last representatives were executed in 1310 by the Capetian king. Their gold hoard went missing. Few people even know of its existence.
And you, how do you know this?
I heard of the legend while I was protecting my lord in his search for the treasure of Templars. He was murdered and I decided to continue the quest on my own when I realized I knew enough to do so.
Your quest looks quite dangerous. Did you find who killed the lord?
You're right, I've come to find out that it's a secret society whose members call themselves Freemasons.
What does this have to do with me?

I'm tired of this quest, it's been so long since I started. I'd now like to sleep without having to keep a hand on the hilt of my sword. I'd like to sell the information that I've collected in my travels. Though this is the kind of quest that can drive you crazy. Who knows how many have already tried and failed? I think I'm close to the goal but I feel I have to stop here. Night is falling for me and I've spent too many seasons running from town to town and wandered in the wild in search of clues. For 3000 crowns it's yours, what do you say?
It's okay. It seems to me that you'd be inspired to prove if this story is real.
I think you are an excellent speaker and I could see you being skilled enough to woo some ladies of the court.
It doesn't interest me at the moment. Let's talk about this later on, if we ever meet again.

You made a good deal, believe me. Well... once you'll find a map of their secret temples, it will lead you their gold hoard dating back to the Crusades, not to mention their other inheritance. Start your search at the library of the monastery of Carmel Micy in Orleans. Good luck.
Encore vous ? Que voulez-vous ?
Comment va votre rhume ?
Votre compagnie est des plus insupportable, je préfère revenir plus tard.
Beaucoup mieux, merci de faire semblant de vous en souccier.
Êtes-vous...toute la journée ainsi cloitré ? Pourquoi ne pas prendre un peu l'air ?
Et qui va s'occupper des livres, vous ? Il faut classer ce qui a été retiré des étagère, écrire l'ordre du jour, et tout ce qui s'en suit.
Rassurez-moi, vous dormez quand même ?

Bien entendu, quelle question. Je me retire dans mes appartements pour la nuit...pourquoi sommes nous en train de parler de ceci ? Vouliez-vous me divertir ? Et bien vous me faites simplement perdre mon temps, je ne vous retiens pas...
...NON, je ne veux plus parler avec vous.
Vous devriez sortir un peu d'ici.
Encore des sarcasmes ?!
...oui ?
Que représente la fresque du fond avec un guerrier ?

Et bien...je ne saurais quoi répondre...un instant! Oui, je me souviens avoir lu quelque chose dans un manuscrit ? propos de cette fresque il y a bien longtemps, vous rendez-vous compte ? Un livre entreposé dans un lieux qui décrit le lieux lui même, c'est précisément cela qui m'as marqué !
En effet, c'est incroyable...
Un instant, serait-ce un sarcasme ? Insinueriez-vous que ma vie n'est point passionnante ?
Absolument pas, je disait juste que c'est incroyable ! Mais alors, ? propos de la fresque ...

Ah! Oui, j'ai donc lu qu'il s'agit de...impossible de me rappeller de ce nom vous le comprendrez, mais je me souviens que les armoiries peintes sur le bouclier sont celles du bourg de Renne le château en Provence.

Si vous avez tant d'intérêt pour cette fresque et ce seigneur pourquoi ne pas faire le voyage jusqu'en Provence pour aller voir de vos yeux d'autres fresques le représentant ? Avec un peu de chance vous retrouverez même son armure dans son châteaux, Et oui cela est bien un sarcasme, Maintenant pardonnez mon impatience mais cessez de me tourmenter avec de telles futilités et laissez-moi profiter de l'humidité.
...ce rhume est vraiment agaçant, que voulez-vous encore ?
Puis-je poser quelques questions ?
Oh seigneur...bien, je vous écoute mais faites vite...
Les livres sont-ils tous dans cette pièce ?
Que représentent ces fresques murales derrière vous ?
Ça sera tout pour l'instant.

Non bien entendu, c'est la salle de lecture et d'écriture, ici nous relisont ce que nos ancêtres écrivent depuis la nuit des temps et nous écrivons pour les générations ? venir. Demandez-moi un ouvrage et je vous l'apporterais...si je le puis.

Et bien c'est évident ! Les fresques représentent le jugement dernier et les enfer, la fresque centrale est...disons endomagée par le temps, elle ne pouvait qu'être en rapport avec les deux autres, je dirais que la fresque centrale représentais le paradis, le salut par la prière, mais aucune importance cela est juste décoratif vous savez.
...pardonnez-moi, ces murs sont si humides... attendez! Qui vous a permis d'entrer ici je vous prie ?
Frère Patrique m'as autorisé l'accés de la bibliothèque.
Bon, et bien veillez ? ne point me déranger...
Mon frère, si vous voulez des renseignements adressez-vous ? frère Patrique.
Je vous remercie.

Mon frère? Que puis-je pour vous ?
Je désire entrer de nouveau.

Mon frère? Que puis-je pour vous ?

Certes mon frère, rigueur et discipline sont les pierres qui balisent le chemin du savoir.

J'étudie les arts de la calligraphie et je souhaite perfectionner ma maîtrise en étudiant vos manuscrits anciens.

J'enquête sur la descendance d'une noble famille, quelques manuscrits que vous possédez pourraient m'en apprendre d'avantage .

Ainsi vous partagez nostre art, pourtant vous n'estes pas frère n'est-ce pas ?

Vous etiez frère ici même vous dites ? Je ne me rappelle absolument pas pas de vostre visage, vous n'estes qu'un voleur qui souhaite dérober des manuscrits, GARDES... par ici !
Vraiment ? Certes, je pourrais vous laisser entrer, mais je dois être sûr de vos intentions, pour quelle famille travaillez-vous ?
Gilles de Rais baron de provence.
Messire Etiennes de Vignolles, que les anglois appellent la Hire.
Francois forgeron, seigneur du château de la Loire.
Jean Poton de Xaintrailles duc de Paris.
Vous vous amusez de moi ? J'ai austre chose ? faire, maintenant partez.
Certes, je vais vous laisser entrer Messire, cela a l'air important, loing de moi l'idée de faire obstacle aux affaires de nobles seigneurs.
En effet, je suis une simple personne lettrée ou ce que l'on appelle comunément un scribe.

Que me racontez-vous donc ? Qui estes-vous ? Vous dites que vous avez été frère et vous m'appellez mon père au lieu de frère, puis vous me parlez d'affectation ? l'ecriture...nous ne somme pas des soldats voyons, qui que vous soyez partez sur-le-champ avant que je n'appelle la garde.
Certes mon frère, certes...c'est d'accord, je vous laisse entrer pour l'étude de l'art de l'écriture, veillez cependant ? ne pas nous troubler avec des questions.
Je vous remercie de tout coeur, j'aimerais entrer sans délais.
Je vous remercie mon frère, je reviens bientôt.
Une telle fougue fait plaisir ? voir, tâchez d'en apprendre le plus possible sur l'écriture.
Encore vous ? Cessez de nous importuner, partez sur-le-champ
Tout ceci est un affreux malentendu, nous en reparlerons quand vous serez calmé.
Salutations mon frère, que puis-je pour vous ?
J'aimerais entrer pour étudier certains de vos livres.
Not at the moment my brother. We pray and talk later.
Fuck the camp.
I do not like that tone.
Greetings to you, {sir/madam}. You look like someone who should get to know me.
Why is that?

I broker ransoms for the poor wretches who are captured in these endless wars. Normally I travel between the salt mines and the slave markets on the coast, on commission from those whose relatives have gone missing. But if I'm out on my errands of mercy, and I come across a fellow dragging around a captive or two, well, there's no harm in a little speculative investment, is there? And you look like the type who might have a prisoner to sell.
What if their families can't pay?

Oh, then I spin them a few heart warming tales of life on the galleys. You'd be surprised what sorts of treasures a peasant can dig out of his cowshed or wheedle out of his cousins, assuming he's got the proper motivation! And if in the end they cannot come up with the silver, then there are always slave merchants who are looking for galley slaves. One cannot do Heaven's work with an empty purse, you see.
What can I get for a prisoner?

It varies. I fancy that I have a fine eye for assessing a ransom. There are a dozen little things about a man that will tell you whether he goes to bed hungry, or dines each night on soft dumplings and goose. The real money of course is in the gentry, and if you ever want to do my job you'll want to learn about every landowning family in France, their estates, their heraldry, their offspring both lawful and bastard, and, of course, their credit with the merchants.
Would you be able to ransom me if I were taken?
Of course. I'm welcome in every court in France. There's not many who can say that! So always be sure to keep a pot of crowns buried somewhere, and a loyal servant who can find it in a hurry.
That's all I need to know. Thank you.
Greetings. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Anyway, if you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
Tell me about what you do again.
I wish to ransom one of my companions.
Whom do you wish to ransom?
Never mind

Let me check my ledger, here... Yes. Your friend is being held in the dungeon at {s7}. How interesting! I remember hearing that the rats down there are unusually large -- like mastiffs, they say... Now... For the very reasonable sum of {reg5} crowns, which includes both the ransom and my commission and expenses, we can arrange it so that {s5} can once again enjoy {reg4?her:his} freedom. What do you say?
Here's your money.
I can't afford that right now.
Splendid! In a few days, I would think, you should find {s5} riding to rejoin you, blinking in the sunlight and no doubt very grateful! Is there any other way in which I can help you?

Of course, of course... Never mind what they say about the rats, by the way -- I've never actually seen one myself, on account of the pitch-black darkness. Anyway, I'm sure that {s5} will understand why it's important for you to control expenditures. Now... Was there anything else?
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
I will be staying here for a few days. Let me know if you need my services.

Greetings, friend. You look like the kind of {man/person} who'd do well to know me. I travel a lot all across France and keep an open ear. I can provide you information that you might find useful. For a meager price of course.
Greetings, {playername}. I saw your companion {s10} at a tavern in {s11} some days ago. I thought you might like to know.
Thanks. I'll go and find {reg3?her:him} there.
Thanks, but I don't really care.
Greetings, {playername}.
Yes?
What can you tell me about this land?

France is divided by rival claimants to the throne, who can neither of them manage to live in peace with the other, nor completely eliminate them. As a result, there's seldom a break to the bitter wars which plague this land and drain its life blood. Well, at least this must be a good place to be for an adventurer such as yourself. With some luck and skill, you can make a name for yourself here, amass a fortune perhaps, or gain great power. Opportunities are endless and so are the rewards, if you are willing to risk your life for them.
Tell me more about these opportunities.
Thank you. That was all I needed to know
Well, you probably know everything I could tell you already. You seem to be doing pretty well.

The kingdoms will pay good money for mercenaries if they are engaged in a war. If you have done a bit of fighting, speaking with one of their lords will probably result in being offered a mercenary contract. However the real rewards come if you can manage to become a vassal to a king. A vassal can own villages, castles and towns and get rich with the taxes and revenues of these estates. Normally, only nobles of the realm own land in this way, but in time of war, a king will not hesitate to accept someone who distinguishes {himself/herself} on the battlefield as a vassal, and grant {him/her} the right to own land.

It is not unheard of for adventurers to renounce allegiance to a European king altogether, declare themselves kings, and claim land in their own name. This is a difficult path, however, as the great nobles of the land, with their long ancestries, are not likely to accept such upstarts as their monarch. Such rulers would need to be very careful in establishing their right to rule, or they would be set upon from all sides.

It might be easier for an adventurer like yourself to pledge support to an existing king's rival. There are many such pretenders in France -- those who are born to the right family, who go around and stir up trouble saying they have a better claim to the throne than the current king. If those claim holders could find supporters, they could easily start civil wars and perhaps even replace the king one day.
Interesting. Where can I find these claim holders?
I guess I heard enough already. Thank you.

A claim holder's life would be in danger in his own country of course. Therefore, they usually stay at rival courts, raising support and hoping to find someone willing to champion their cause. I usually hear news about some of them, and may be able to tell you their location with some precision. But of course, I would ask for a little something for such a service.
I want to know the location of a claimant.
Whose location do you want to know?
Never mind.
I can reveal this information to you for a small price, let's say 30 crowns.
All right. Here is 30 crowns.
Never mind.
{s15} is currently at {s11}.
I am looking for one of my companions...
Maybe I can help you. Who are you looking for?
Never mind.
I guess I know where {s15} is. For 30 crowns, I'll tell you.
All right. Here is 30 crowns.
Never mind.
{s15} is currently at {s11}.{s12}
Farewell.
Greetings. They say you're the kind of {man/woman} who'd be interested to hear that I travel frequently to {s17}. I'll tell you all I know for a mere 100 crowns.
Here's 100 crowns. Tell me what you know.
Sorry friend. I am not interested.
Well, that's all I can tell you. Good bye.
Good day {sir/madam}, will you be looking at my books?
Yes. Show me what you have for sale.
Of course {sir/madam}.
Anything else?
Nothing. Thanks.
Greetings to you, {most noble sir/most noble lady}.
What is it you do?
I have some questions about courtship in France
Can you teach me any poems?

I can teach you the poem, 'The Storming of the Castle of Love.' It is short enough to be easily learned. It is an allegoric poem, replete with symbols and metaphor. It describes how a brave but rough warrior wins the heart of his lady by learning the virtues of chivalry, becoming a true and noble knight. Its theme -- that the role of a woman is to inspire but also civilize a man -- is appreciated by some noble ladies, but not all.

I can teach you the poem, 'The Heart's Desire.' It is a lyrical poem, which can be interpreted either erotically or spiritually. The lover realizes the majesty of the divine by gazing upon the body of his beloved. I believe that it appeals to women of a certain romantic temperament, but you risk scandalizing or boring others.

I can teach you the tale of Kais and Layala. It is a sad and simple story -- the shepherd boy Kais and the nobleman's daughter Layala love each other, but they can never marry. The poem is Kais' lament as he wanders alone, unwilling to forget his true love, driving himself mad with longing. Some ladies melt at the sweetness of his sorrows; others glaze over at his self-pity.

I can teach you part of the saga of Helgerad and Kara. It is a heroic tale, full of blood and battle. The shieldmaiden Kara chooses the warrior Helgered as her lover, as he is the only man who can defeat her in combat. Her father, who pledged her to another, comes with his sons and his huscarls to kill Helgered. They fight, and Helgered and Kara slaughter the entire host except for Kara's beloved younger brother -- who, alas, grows up to avenge his father by slaying Helgered. The depiction of warrior and shieldmaiden as equals will appeal to some women, but a mail-wearing, blood-spattered heroine will shock and repulse others.

I can teach you the poem, 'An Argument in the Garden.' It is a comic poem, which satirizes the conventions of courtly love. A lover steals into a garden in Veluca, and plies her with lots of witty lines to persuade his lover to submit to his embraces. She shoots down all of his advances one by one, then when he is downcast, she takes him in her arms and tells him that she wanted him all along, except on her terms, not his. A lady with a sense of humor may find it amusing, but others might feel that they are the ones who are being mocked.
To teach it to you, I will need some hours of your time -- and, of course, a small fee for my services. About 300 crowns would suffice.
I believe you already know the poems I am best equipped to teach.
Yes -- teach me that one
Never mind
Very well -- repeat after me:^   I deflected her skeptical questioning darts^   with armor made of purest devotion^   purged in the forge of my heart^   from the slag of any baser emotion

Very well -- repeat after me:^   You are the first and the last^   the outer and the inner^   When I drink from the cup of love^   I escape the tread of time^   A moment in solitude with you^   Would have no beginning and no end

Very well -- repeat after me:^  The wind that blows the dry steppe dust^  Stirs the curtains in your tower^  The moon that lights my drunken path home^  Looks on you sleeping in your bower^  If I cried out to the wind^  Could it carry a message from my lips?^  If I wept before the moon^  Would it grant me just a glimpse?

Very well -- repeat after me:^   A light pierced the gloom over Wercheg cliffs...^   Where charge of surf broke on shieldwall of shore^   Grey-helmed and grey-cloaked the maiden stood^   On wave-steed's prow, the sailcloth snapping^   Over din of oars, of timbers cracking^   She cried out to her hearth-brothers, arrayed for war

Very well -- repeat after me:^All the silks of Veluca, all the furs of Khudan^Would buy you not the briefest kiss^What I bestow, I bestow for love^And the sake of my own happiness^But brought you a gift? Let us see! Let us see!^Or should tell my father how you came to see me?
'I deflected her skeptical questioning darts...'
'You are the first and the last..'
'The wind that blows the dry steppe dust...'
'A light pierced the gloom over Wercheg cliffs...'
'All the silks of Veluca...'
Pshaw... What kind of doggerel is that?

Very well. If the poem is not to your taste, then keep your money. But remember -- with poets and with lovers, what is important is not what pleases you. What is important is what your pleases your audience. If you wish to learn the poem, I am still willing to teach.
Very good -- but there are many stanzas to go. Now, listen closely...
Can you tell me anything about the eligible maidens in this realm?
About whom did you wish to know?
Just tell me the latest piece of gossip
Never mind
She is married to you, of course! Clearly, no one would dream that she would do anything to engender gossip.
Very interesting -- but let us speak of something else.
Very interesting -- is there any more news?
What? I'll make that miscreant face my sword
Do you mean that? {s11} will be honor-bound to fight you, but challenging a lord to duel over a woman is seen as a bit hot-headed, even in this warlike age.
Yes -- I intend to force {s11} to relinquish his suit of {s12}
No -- I let my passions run away with me, there
As you wish. I'll spread the word of your intentions, so that {s13} does not try to back out...
Do you know of any ongoing feasts?
Good-bye.
What do you wish to know?
Can I answer any other questions for you?
Is there a place for me in the game of love?
How would a suitor meet a lady?
Having met a lady, how would the suitor woo her?
Tell me about marriage and love among the nobility of France

Nobles are an odd lot. In France, a daughter is a political asset, to be given away to a lord with whom her father wishes to make an alliance. Yet the great families of this land idealize pure love between man and woman, and I have seen many a hardened warrior weep copious tears at the doomed ardour of Sahira and Janun in the songs -- even as he made plans to break his own daughter's heart.

Fathers differ, of course. Some nobles will let their daughters choose a husband who pleases them. Others, however, feel that to allow their daughters any choice at all would be to diminish their own authority, and insist on imposing a groom whether she likes it or not.

But the majority will steer a middle course -- they will want to make the final decision about a groom, but will weigh their daughter's preferences heavily. Among other factors, a happy marriage is more likely to produce heirs. So, there is a place for courtship, and for the use of skill and passion to win a lady's heart.
What if a lady and her father disagree about a suitor?

It happens sometimes that a bride elopes. This is a major blow to the father's prestige, leading to lasting enmities. Indeed, it is possible that a war may be fought over a woman. Now, that is a fine topic for a song.

In the end, however, most brides will submit to their parents' choice. A noblewoman's family is everything to her, and few are brave enough to risk its disapproval for the sake of man she barely knows. She may pine for her lover, but still accept the groom -- and without tragic love, what would we have to sing about?

Of course! High lords make a great deal of lineage, but in the end, lands and money speak louder than one's ancestors. Even though you are a foreigner, if you are coming up in the world, then many parents will consider you a fine catch.

You will have to compete with many other lords of your realm, however, who will have an advantage -- they have known these ladies from childhood, and will have been sized up as grooms by carefully discerning mothers and aunts. Some ladies may be fascinated by the stranger, yet opt for the familiar.

So know this -- you may have your heart broken. But to enter the arena of love fearing heartbreak is like entering the battlefield fearing the enemy's arrows. Be brave, and shrug off the sting of rejection, and victory may yet be yours.

Lady -- I will speak bluntly. Most of the lords of this land are looking for a demure maiden, whose skin as fair as snow -- and your skin is burnt brown by the sun. They want a maiden whose voice is soft as bells -- and your voice is hoarse from commanding men in battle. Also, athough the lords of France appreciate poems about love, most also want heirs, and few women can ride and fight while with child.

However, not all lords will be so conventionally minded. We poets sing of shield maidens and of huntresses, of women who forged their own path without having sacrificed the chance for love. I would not tell you that it would be easy for you to find a devoted husband who will accept your ways, but I would not say that it is impossible.
What advantage is there in seeking a {wife/husband}?

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may forge a strong alliance with the bride's family, and a wife may also assist you in manipulating the politics of the realm to your advantage.
What's more, most of the great families of France have at some point intermarried with royalty, which would boost your own claim to rule -- should you ever choose to assert it...

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may have access to the groom's castles and properties, and be able to work with him to advance both of your standings in the realm.

Every so often, a king or great lord of the land will hold a feast. In towns they will often be accompanied by tournaments, and in castles they will be accompanied by hunts. The feasts provide a chance for the lords to repair some of the rivalries that may undermine the strength of the realm. They also provide an opportunity for families to show off their eligible daughters, and ladies will often be allowed to mingle unsupervised with the guests.

If you have the opportunity, you may attempt to pay the lady a compliment. This indicates to her that you are a potential suitor, and she will usually know if she wishes you to continue your suit. Incidentally, if you come to her fresh from having distinguished yourself in the tournament or in the hunt, then you may make a stronger first impression than otherwise.

To woo a lady takes a certain amount of time and patience, and several meetings spaced over a period of months. A lady who is interested in you will often find ways of letting you know if she wishes you to come visit her. Alternately, you may simply go and ask her father or brother for permission. If you do not have permission from her guardian, it may be possible to arrange an assignation through other means.

Having arranged an assignment, you may then attempt to charm her and win her favor. Perhaps one of the most difficult aspects of this is finding a topic of conversation. Most noblewomen lead a cloistered life, at least until they are married, and thus will have little to say that will interest you. On other hand, she will soon tire of hearing of your own deeds in the outside world.

One time-tested mode of courtship is simply to recite a popular poem, and discuss it. This way, you are both on an equal footing, and neither will have an advantage in knowledge or experience. Of course, different ladies will have different tastes in poetry.

At some point, you will be able to discuss directly the issue of marriage. She will then let you know if you measure up to what she wants in a husband. Some ladies will coolly assess who is the most prestigious of her suitors, others will be guided by their passions. Some will look to your companions, to see whether you are the kind of husband who will treat her as an equal, while others will follow the lead of their fathers.

At any rate, it is a challenging business -- and do not forget, you may find that your suit prospers with a lady, only to have it falter on a father's political ambitions. So you must ask yourself: are you willing to risk disappointment and heartbreak? Alternately, are you willing to throw away your standing in society, to make enemies of allies, in pursuit of a forbidden love? Because if you are, then perhaps some day we will write poems about you.
What is it that you poets and musicians do again?

I compose and write songs for the lords of the land, and their ladies. Sometimes I sing about war, sometimes about the virtues of kings, and sometimes, for the more sophisticated audiences, about the virtues of wine. For most audiences, however, I sing of love.
No, that is all.
Do you have any other questions?
Is there anything else?
{My lord/Madam}, you look like a {man/lady} of the sword and someone who could help us. Will you hear my plea?
What is the matter, my good man?
What are you burbling about peasant? Speak out.

A band of brigands have taken refuge in our village. They take everything we have, force us to serve them, and do us much evil. If one of us so much as breathes a word of protest, they kill the poor soul on the spot right away. Our lives have become unbearable. I risked my skin and ran away to find someone who can help us.
Why don't you go to the lord of your village? He should take care of the vermin.

I did, {sir/madam}, but our lord's men did not let me see him and said he was occupied with more important matters and that we should deal with our own problem ourselves. Please {sir/madam}, you look like a {man/lady} of valor and a fearsome warrior, and you have no doubt many friends and soldiers at your service. If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.
Very well, I'll help you. Where is this village?
I can't be bothered with this right now.
Why would I fight these bandits? What's in it for me?
God bless you, {sir/madam}. Our village is {s7}. It is not too far from here.
As you say {sir/madam}. Forgive me for bothering you.

We are but poor farmers {sir/madam}, and the bandits have already got most of what we have on this world. But we'll be glad to share with you whatever we have got. And we'll always be in your gratitude if you help us.
Thank you for helping us {sir/madam}. Crush those bandits!
For your health, my lord.
Cheers.
Do you have a need for mercenaries, {sir/madam}? {reg3?Me and {reg4?{reg3} of my mates:one of my mates} are:I am} looking for a master. We'll join you for {reg5} crowns.
Any orders, {sir/madam}?
Make your preparations. We'll be moving at dawn.
Take your time. We'll be staying in this town for a while.
Yes {sir/madam}. We'll be ready when you tell us to leave.
All right. I will hire all of you. Here is {reg5} crowns.
All right. But I can only hire {reg6} of you. Here is {reg5} crowns.
That sounds good. But I can't afford to hire any more men right now.
That's a pity. Well, {reg3?we will:I will} be lingering around here for a while, if you need to hire anyone.
That sounds good. But I can't lead any more men right now.
Sorry. I don't need any other men right now.

Good day to you {lad/lass}. You look like another adventurer who has come to try {his/her} chance in these lands. Well, trust my word, you won't be able to survive long here unless you know how to fight yourself out of a tight spot.
Thank you for your advice. This place looks like a training field. Maybe I can learn about fighting here?

Indeed you can. I am a veteran soldier... fought a good deal in the wars in my time. But these days, I train young novices in this area. I can find you some opponents to practice with if you like. Or if you have any questions about the theory of combat, feel free to ask.
Yes, I do have a few questions.
Actually, I can move on to practice.
Well, ask anything you like.
Good. It's good to find someone eager for practice. Let's see what you will do.
That was a good fight.

Ha! Looks like you've developed a bit of a limp there. Don't worry, even losses have their value, provided you learn from them. Shake the stars out of your eyes and get back in there. There's no other way to win.
Good day. Ready for some training today?
Ah, are you ready for some training?
I am ready for some practice.
First, tell me something about combat...
I need to leave now. Farewell.
What do you want to know?
What else do you want to know?
Tell me about defending myself.
Tell me about attacking with weapons.
Tell me about fighting on horseback.
I guess I know all the theory I need. Let's talk about something else.

Good question. The first thing you should know as a fighter is how to defend yourself. Keeping yourself out of harm's way is the first rule of combat, and it is much more important than giving harm to others. Everybody can swing a sword around and hope to cut some flesh, but only those fighters that are experts at defense live to tell of it.

Now. Defending yourself is easiest if you are equipped with a shield. Just block with your shield. [Hold down the right mouse button to defend yourself with the shield.] In this state, you will be able to deflect all attacks that come from your front. However, you will still be open to strikes from your sides or your back.
What if I don't have a shield?

Then you will have to use your weapon to block your opponent. This is a bit more difficult than defending with a shield. Defending with a weapon, you can block against only ONE attack direction. That is, you block against either overhead swings, side swings or thrusts. Therefore you must watch your opponent carefully and start to block AFTER he starts his attack. In this way you will be able to block against the direction of his current attack. If you start to block BEFORE he makes his move, he may just attack in another direction than the one you are blocking against and score a hit.

Good question. Attacking is the best defence, they say. A tactic many fighters find useful is taking an offensive stance and readying your weapon for attack, waiting for the right moment for swinging it. [You can ready your weapon for attack by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.]
That sounds useful.

It is a good tactic, but remember that, your opponent may see that and take a defensive stance against the direction you are swinging your weapon. If that happens, you must break your attack and quickly attack from another direction [You may cancel your current attack by quickly tapping the right mouse button].
If my opponent is defending against the direction I am attacking from, I will break and use another direction.

Yes, selecting the direction you swing your weapon is a crucial skill. There are four main directions you may use: right swing, left swing, overhead swing and thrust. You must use each one wisely. [to control your swing direction with default controls, move your mouse in the direction you want to swing from as you press the left mouse button].

Very good question. A horse may be a warrior's most powerful weapon in combat. It gives you speed, height, power and initiative. A lot of deadly weapons will become even deadlier on horseback. However you must pay particular attention to horse-mounted enemies couching their lances, as they may take down any opponent in one hit. [To use the couched lance yourself, wield a lance or similar weapon, and speed up your horse without pressing attack or defense buttons. After you reach a speed, you'll lower your lance. Then try to target your enemies by maneuvering your horse.]
I train novices in four stages, each tougher than the one before. To finish a stage and advance to the next one, you have to win three fights in a row.
You have passed all stages of training. But if you want you can still practice. Are you ready?
Way to go {lad/lass}. With this victory, you have advanced to the next training level. From now on your opponents will be regular fighters, not the riff-raff off the street, so be on your toes.

Way to go {lad/lass}. Welcome to the third training level. From now on your opponents will be veteran fighters; soldiers and arena regulars and the like. These guys know some dirty tricks, so keep your defense up.

You've got the heart of a champion, {lad/lass}, and the sword arm to match. From now on your opponents will be champion fighters. These are the cream of the crop, the finest warriors I have trained. If you can best three of them in a row, you will join their ranks.
It does my heart good to see such a promising talent. You have passed all tiers of training. You can now tell everyone that you have been trained by the master of the training field.
Thank you master.
I wish you good luck in the tournaments. And, don't forget, if you want to practice your swordsmanship any time, just come and say the word.
Your next opponent will be a {s9}. You need to win {reg8} more fights in a row to advance to the next stage. Are you ready?
Yes I am.
Here you go then. Good luck.
Just a minute. I am not ready yet.
Hey, You will never make it if you don't practice.
Good day, my {lord/lady}. We hope to begin production in about {reg4} days
Good day, my {lord/lady}. We are honored that you have chosen to visit us. What do you require?
Very good, my {lord/lady}. Do you require anything else?
Let's go over the accounts.
Let's check the inventories.
I'd like you to sell goods as they are produced.
I'd like you to keep all goods in the warehouse until I arrive.

We currently produce {s3} worth {reg1} crowns each week, while the quantity of {s4} needed to manufacture it costs {reg2}, and labor and upkeep are {reg3}.{s9} This means that we theoretically make a {s12} of {reg0} crowns a week, assuming that we have no raw materials in the inventories, and that we sell directly to the market.
Could you explain my options related to production?

Certainly, my {lord/lady}. Most of the time, the most profitable thing for you to do would be to let us buy raw materials and sell the finished goods directly to the market. Because of our long-standing relations with the local merchants, we can usually get a very good price.

However, if you find that you can acquire raw materials cheaper outside {s5}, you may place them in the inventories, and we will use them instead of buying from the market. Likewise, if you feel that you can get a better price for the finished goods elsewhere, then you may ask us to deposit what we produce in our warehouses for you to take.
It will no longer be possible for me to continue operating this enterprise.
A pity, my {lord/lady}. If we sell the land and the equipment, and liquidate the inventories, I estimate that we can get {reg4} crowns.
That sounds reasonable. Please proceed with the sale.
Hmm. Let's hold off on that.
As you wish. It was an honor to have been in your employ.
That is all for now.
Good day, my lord.
Hello stranger, you seem to be new to {s9}. I am the guild master of the town.
Good day, {playername}.

{playername}, it was an incredible feat to get {s14} and {s15} make peace, and you made it happen. Your involvement has not only saved our town from disaster, but it has also saved thousands of lives, and put an end to all the grief this bitter war has caused. As the townspeople of {s19}, know that we'll be good on our word, and we are ready to pay the {reg12} crowns we promised.
Thank you. Let me have the money.
No need for a payment. I only did what was right.
Oh, yes, of course. We had already got the money for you. Here, please accept these {reg12} crowns together with our most sincere thanks. Me and the people of our town will not forget your help.

You are indeed an extraordinary person, {sir/madame}, and it is an honour for me to have known you. You not only did what was impossible and put an end to this terrible war, but you won't even accept a reward for it. Very well, I will not insist on the matter, but please know that you will have our eternal respect and gratitude.
Very nice work, {playername}, you made short work of those lawless curs. Thank you kindly for all your help, and please accept this bounty of 150 crowns.
It was my pleasure, {s65}.
Ah, {playername}. Have you any progress to report?
I've killed some looters.
I've brought you some goods.
Not yet, sir. Farewell.

Aye, my scouts saw the whole thing. That should make anyone else think twice before turning outlaw! The bounty is 40 crowns for every band, so that makes {reg1} in total. Here is your money, as promised.

And that's not the only good news! Thanks to you, the looters have ceased to be a threat. We've not had a single attack reported for some time now.   If there are any of them left, they've either run off or gone deep into hiding. That's good for business, and what's good for business is good for the town!   I think that concludes our arrangement, {playername}. Please accept this silver as a token of my gratitude. Thank you, and farewell.
Anything else you need?
Hah, I knew I could count on you! Just tell me which item to take from your baggage, and I'll send some men to collect it. I still need {reg1} crowns' worth of goods.
Nothing at the moment, sir.
Anything else you need?
Excellent, here is the money for your {s6}. Do you have any more goods to give me? I still need {reg1} crowns' worth of goods.

Well done, {playername}, that's the last of the goods I need. Here is the money for your {s6}, and a small bonus for helping me out. I'm afraid I won't be paying for any more goods, nor bounties on looters, but you're welcome to keep hunting the bastards if any remain. Thank you for your help, I won't forget it.
Good to see you again {playername}. I have heard that you have delivered the cattle successfully. I will tell the merchants how reliable you are. And here is your pay, {reg8} crowns.
I heard that you have lost the cattle herd on your way to {s9}. I had a very difficult time explaining your failure to the owner of that herd, {sir/madam}. Do you have anything to say?
I am sorry. But I was attacked on the way.
I am sorry. The stupid animals wandered off during the night.

Well, it was your responsibility to deliver that herd safely, no matter what. You should know that the owner of the herd demanded to be compensated for his loss, and I had to pay him 1000 crowns. So you now owe me that money.

{playername} -- I am in your debt for bringing back my friend's daughter.  Please take these {reg8} crowns that I promised you.  My friend wished he could give more but paying that ransom brought him to his knees.

Well -- it sounds like you were able to track down the bandits, and show them what happens to those who would disrupt the flow of commerce. Here is your reward: {reg5} crowns. It is well earned, and we are most grateful.

I have heard about your deeds. You have given those bandits the punishment they deserved. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} crowns. I would like to give more but those bandits almost brought me to bankruptcy.
According to my accounts, you owe the merchants guild {reg1} crowns. I'd better collect that now.
Alright. I'll pay my debt to you.
Excellent. I'll let my fellow merchants know that you are clear of any debts.
I'm afraid I can't pay that sum now.

In that case, I am afraid, I can't deal with you. Guild rules... Come back when you can pay the {reg1} crowns. And know that we'll be charging an interest to your debt. So the sooner you pay it, the better.
What can I do for you?
Now... What else may I do for you?
Yes?
Can you tell me about what you do?
Do you happen to have a job for me?
About that job you offered me...
About the job you gave me...
I have some questions of a political nature.
How is trade around here?
How does the wealth of this region compare with the rest of France?
I wish to buy land in this town for a productive enterprise
You already operate a {s4} here. There probably aren't enough skilled tradesmen to start a second enterprise.
Of course, {sir/my lady}. You are the lord of this town, and no one is going to stop you.
Well... Given your relationship with our liege, {s4}, I think that you will not find many here who are brave enough to sell you any land.
Well... To be honest, I think that we in the guild would like to know you a little better. We can be very particular about outsiders coming in here and buying land.
Very good, {sir/my lady}. We in the guild know and trust you, and I think I could find someone to sell you the land you need.

A couple of things to keep in mind -- skilled laborers are always at a premium, so I doubt that you will be able to open up more than one enterprise here. In order to make a profit for yourself, you should choose a commodity which is in relatively short supply, but for which the raw materials are cheap. What sort of enterprise would you like to start?
A mill and bakery, to make bread from grain
A brewery, to make ale from grain
