A tannery, to make leather from hides
A wine press, to make wine from grapes
An oil press, to make oil from olives
An ironworks, to make tools from iron
A weavery and dyeworks, to make velvet from silk and dye
A weavery, to make wool cloth from wool
A weavery, to make linen from flax
Never mind

Very good, sir. The land and the materials on which you may build your {s3} will cost you {reg7} crowns. Right now, your {s3} will produce {s4} worth {reg1} crowns each week, while the {s6} needed to manufacture that batch will be {reg2} and labor and upkeep will be {reg3}.{s9} I should guess that your profit would be {reg0} crowns a week. This assumes of course that prices remain constant -- which, I can virtually guarantee you, they will not. Do you wish to proceed?
Yes. Here is money for the land.
No -- that's not economical for me at the moment.
Very good. Your enterprise should be up and running in about a week. When next you come, and thereafter, you should speak to your {s4} about its operations.
[Leave]
I am the guildmaster of {s9}. You can say I am the leader of the good people of {s9}. I can help you find a job if you are looking for some honest work.
Who rules this town?

Our town's lord and protector is {s10}. He owns the castle and sometimes resides there, and collects taxes from the town. However we regulate ourselves in most of the matters that concern ourselves. As the town's guildmaster I have the authority to decide those things.
That's all I need to know. Thanks.

Politics? Good heaven, the guild has nothing to do with politics. We are loyal servants of {s10}. We merely govern our own affairs, and pass on the townspeople's concerns to our lords and masters, and maybe warn them from time to time against evil advice. Anyway, what did you wish to ask?
Did I mention that we here are all {s9}? Because I can't stress that enough... Anyway... Is there anything else?
What is the cause of all these wars in France?

Well, to answer your question generally, each monarch claims to be the rightful heir to the old Calradic emperors. Some of these claims are based on forgotten dynastic marriages and others are based on obscure promises, while {s22} Rhodoks invoke the empire's unwritten constitution. So in theory, any one realm has the right to declare war on any other realm at any time.

In practice, to make war is exhausting work. It is easy enough to lay waste to the enemy's farmland, but crops will grow back, and it is a far different matter to capture an enemy stronghold and to hold it. So the monarchs of Europe will fight a little, sign a truce, fight a little more, and so on and so forth. Often, a monarch will go to war when another realm provokes them. At such times, some bad influences who look to enrich themselves with ransoms and pillage will clamor for retribution, and thus the damage caused by war to a monarch's treasury is less than the damage caused by doing nothing would be to his authority... I'm of course not talking about {s10}, as no one would ever question {reg4?her:his} authority

I would stress again that we in the guild have nothing to do with politics. But if {s10} were to ask for my advice on these matters, as a loyal subject, I would tell {reg4?her:him} that while {reg4?her:his} claim to the throne is truly just, even the most legitimate claim must be backed by armed men, and armed men want money, and money comes from trade, and war ruins trade, so sometimes the best way to push a claim is not to push it, if you know what I mean...

You may tell {s10} this if you see {reg4?her:him}. Don't mention my name specifically -- just say 'the people of {s4}' told you this. Our personal opinion, of course, as to what would be in {s10}'s best interests. None of us would ever dream of questioning a monarch's sovereign right to push {reg4?her:his} legitimate claims.
What is {s10}'s policy in regards to the other realms of Europe?
Which realm did you have in mind?
What can you say about the internal politics of the realms?

Well, here in the {s4} we are all united by our love for {s5} and support for {reg4?her:his} legitimate claim to the rulership of all France. But I have heard some talk of internal bickering in other realms...

The lords of a realm often have very different ideas about honor, strategy, and the way a nobleman should behave. In addition, they compete with each other for the ruler's favor, and are constantly weighing up their position -- how they stand, how their friends and family stand, and how their enemies stand.

Underlying all the tensions is the possibility that a lord may abandon his liege, and pledge as vassal to another. In theory, each lord has sworn an oath of vassalage, but in practice, a vassal can always find an excuse to absolve himself. The vassal may claim that the liege has failed to hold up his end of the bargain, to protect the vassal and treat him justly. Or, the vassal may claim that his liege is in fact a usurper, and another has a better claim to the kingship.

Lieges and vassals still watch each other carefully. If a king believes that his vassal is going to change sides or rebel, he may indict the vassal for treason and seize his properties. Likewise, if a vassal fears that he will be indicted, he may rebel. Usually, whoever makes the first move will be able to control the vassal's fortresses.

Now, men do not trust a vassal who turns coat easily, nor do they trust a king who lightly throws around charges of treason. Those two factors can keep a realm together. But if relations between a vassal and a liege deteriorate far enough, things can become very tense indeed... In other lands, of course. These things could never happen here in the {s4}.
That is all. Thank you.
What about it?
What if I can't finish it?
Well, I'm still working on it.
Good. I'm sure you will handle it.
Eh, you want to reconsider that. Good...
I hope you don't fail. In that case, I'll have to ask for the price of the cargo you were carrying.
Well, just do your best to finish it.
Excellent. I am counting on you then. Good luck.
Well, the job will be available for a few more days I guess. Tell me if you decide to take it.
Well, you look able enough. I think I might have something you could do.

We've had some fighting near the {s5} lately, with all the chaos that comes with it, and that's led some of our less upstanding locals to try and make their fortune out of looting the shops and farms during the confusion. A lot of valuable goods were taken. I need somebody to teach those bastards a lesson. Sound like your kind of work?
Aye, I'll do it.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.

Excellent! You'll find the looters roaming around the countryside, probably trying to rob more good people. Kill or capture the bastards, I don't care what you do with them. I'll pay you a bounty of 40 crowns on every band of looters you destroy, until all the looters are dealt with.

Well, there is a very great favor which you could do us... As you may have heard, some {s10}s have come across the border to attack our people. {s5} is under great pressure from some of the more bellicose of his vassals to respond with a declaration of war. Unfortunately, while the great lords of this land grow rich from bloodshed, we of the commons will be caught in the middle, and will suffer.

We are not saying that {s5} should overlook this aggression -- far from it! But if he charges one of his own lords to respond, then the cycle of provocation will necessarily lead to a full-fledged confrontation. Now, if an outsider were to step in and defeat a {s10} lord in battle, then honor would be done, and it would defuse the clamor for war. If the defeated lord were a known troublemaker -- {s7} -- then the {s10}s might be able to overlook it.

We need you to attack and defeat {s7}. This will not be an easy task, and that outsider would damage {his/her} relationship with the {s10}s, but we would be very grateful. We could not acknowledge a connection with that outsider, but we could be sure that {he/she} would be handsomely rewarded... Could you do this?
Aye, I can do it.
I would prefer not to get mixed up in such things

The raiders are likely to have laid up their ships in a well-concealed cove, somewhere along the coastline, preferably next to a small stream where they have some water. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of sea raiders who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these usually establish their hideouts in the foothills on the edge of the desert, often in a canyon near a spring. This gives them both water and concealment. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of desert bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually establish a base in the highlands, often on an steep ledge where they have a view of the surrounding countryside. This makes them difficult to surprise. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of mountain bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments deep in the woods, sometimes in the middle of a swamp. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of forest bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments in the woodland on the steppe, where they have some concealment. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of steppe bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.

Bandits such as these will usually set up their encampments deep in the woods. The best way to discover its location would be to find a group of tundra bandits who appear to be heading back to their base to resupply, and follow them.
Aye, I'll do it.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.
Very good. We will await word of your success.
We have heard that {s4}, some travellers on the road {reg4?to:from} {s5} were attacked by {s7}.

We would like you to track these {s4} down. The merchants of the town were able to get a description of their leader, and have put together a bounty. If you can hunt them down and destroy them, we'll make it worth your while...
Aye, I'll do it.
Very good. The band may not have lingered long in the area, but chances are that they will be spotted by other travellers on the road.
I'm afraid I can't take the job at the moment.
You're looking for a job? Actually I was looking for someone to deliver some {s4}. Perhaps you can do that...
I have a cargo of {s6} that needs to be delivered to the tavern in {s4}. If you can take {reg5} units of {s6} to {s4} in 7 days, you may earn {reg8} crowns. What do you say?
Alright. I will make the delivery.
I am afraid I can't carry all that cargo now.
You're looking for a job? Actually I was looking for someone to escort a caravan. Perhaps you can do that...

I am going to send a caravan of goods to {s8}. However with all those bandits and deserters on the roads, I don't want to send them out without an escort. If you can lead that caravan to {s8} in 15 days, you will earn {reg8} crowns. Of course your party needs to be at least {reg4} strong to offer them any protection.
Alright. I will escort the caravan.
I am afraid I don't have that many soldiers with me.
Sorry. I can't do that right now
We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks.
Well, we have almost reached {s21}. We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Here's your pay... {reg14} crowns. Thanks for escorting us. Good luck.
Greetings. You must be our escort, right?
Yes. My name is {playername}. I will lead you to {s1}.
Well, It is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want us to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.

Actually, I was looking for an able adventurer like you. There's this group of particularly troublesome bandits. They have infested the vicinity of our town and are preying on my caravans. They have avoided all the soldiers and the militias up to now. If someone doesn't stop them soon, I am going to be ruined...
I will pay you {reg8} crowns if you hunt down those troublesome bandits. It's dangerous work. But I believe that you are the {man/one} for it. What do you say?
Very well. I will hunt down those bandits.
You will? Splendid. Good luck to you.
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.

Actually, I was looking for a reliable {man/helper} that can undertake an important mission. A group of bandits have kidnapped the daughter of a friend of mine and are holding her for ransom. My friend is ready to pay them, but we still need someone to take the money to those rascals and bring the girl back to safety.

The amount the bandits ask as ransom is {reg12} crowns. I will give you that money once you accept to take the quest. You have 15 days to take the money to the bandits who will be waiting near the village of {s4}. Those bastards said that they are going to kill the poor girl if they don't get the money by that time. You will get your pay of {reg8} crowns when you bring the girl safely back here.
All right. I will take the ransom money to the bandits and bring back the girl.

Good. I knew we could trust you at this. Here is the ransom money, {reg12} crowns. Count it before taking it. And please, don't attempt to do anything rash. Keep in mind that the girl's well being is more important than anything else...
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.
Thank you so much for bringing me back!  I can't wait to see my family. Good-bye.
Yes. Come with me. We are going home.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for me.
Oh really? Thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {sir/madam}, do not leave me here all alone!
Oh {sir/madam}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
Yes. Come with me. We are going home.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for me.
Oh really? Thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {sir/madam}, do not leave me here all alone!
Can I come with you now?
Are you the one that brought the ransom? Quick, give us the money now.
You came back? Quick, give us the money now.
Here, take the money. Just set the girl free.
Heh. You've brought the money all right. You can take the girl now. It was a pleasure doing business with you...
No way! You release the girl first.
You fool! Stop playing games and give us the money!
All right. Here's your money. Let the girl go now.
I had left the money in a safe place. Let me go fetch it.
Are you testing our patience or something?  Go and bring that money here quickly.
I have no intention to pay you anything. I demand that you release the girl now!
You won't be demanding anything when you're dead.
What's it? You have given us the money. We have no more business.
Sorry to bother you. I'll be on my way now.
We have one more business. You'll give the money back to me.
Oh, that business! Of course. Let us get down to it.
Oh {sir/madam}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
Yes. Come with me. I'll take you home.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for me.
Oh, thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {sir/madam}, do not leave me here all alone!
Unfortunately I lost the girl on the way here...
Oh no! How am I going to tell this to my friend?
I'm sorry. I could do nothing about it.
You let me down {playername}. I had trusted you. I will let people know of your incompetence at this task. Also, I want back that {reg8} crowns I gave you as the ransom fee.
Of course. Here you are...
At least you have the decency to return the money.
Sorry. I don't have that amount with me.
Do you expect me to believe that? You are going to pay that ransom fee back! Go and bring the money now!

This war between {s15} and {s14} has brought our town to the verge of ruin. Our caravans get raided before they can reach their destination. Our merchants are afraid to leave the safety of the town walls. And as if those aren't enough, the taxes to maintain the war take away the last bits of our savings. If peace does not come soon, we can not hold on for much longer.
You are right. But who can stop this madness called war?
It is your duty to help the nobles in their war effort. You shouldn't complain about it.
Hah. The nobles fight their wars for their greed and their dreams of glory. And it is poor honest folk like us who have to bear the real burden. But you obviously don't want to hear about that.

There have been attempts to reconcile the two sides and reach a settlement. However, there are powerful lords on both sides whose interests lie in continuing the war. These men urge all others not to heed to the word of sensible men, but to keep fighting. While these leaders remain influential, no peace settlement can be reached.
Who are these warmongers who block the way of peace?
Who are these lords you speak of?
They are {s12} from {s15} and {s13} from {s14}. Until they change their mind or lose their influence, there will be no chance of having peace between the two sides.
What can be done about this?
Alas, it seems nothing can be done about it.

There is a way to resolve the issue. A particularly determined person can perhaps persuade one or both of these lords to accept making peace. And even if that fails, it can be possible to see that these lords are defeated by force and taken prisoner. If they are captive, they will lose their influence and they can no longer oppose a settlement... What do you think? Can you do it?
It seems difficult. But I will try.
If the price is right, I may.
Forget it. This is not my problem.

Most of the merchants in the town will gladly open up their purses to support such a plan. I think we can collect {reg12} crowns between ourselves. We will be happy to reward you with that sum, if you can work this out. Convince {s12} and {s13} to accept a peace settlement, and if either of them proves too stubborn, make sure he falls captive and can not be ransomed until a peace deal is settled.
All right. I will do my best.
Sorry. I can not do this.
Excellent. You will have our blessings. I hope you can deal with those two old goats. We will be waiting and hoping for the good news.
Don't say no right away. Think about this for some time. If there is a {man/lady} who can manage to do this, it is you.

Do I indeed! There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?

There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?
Killing bandits? Why, certainly!
My apologies, I'm not interested.
That takes a weight off my shoulders, {playername}. You can expect a fine reward if you come back successful. Just don't get yourself killed, eh?
One of the merchants here is looking for herdsmen to take his cattle to the market at {s13}.

The cattle herd must be at {s13} within 30 days. Sooner is better, much better, but it must be absolutely no later than 30 days. If you can do that, I'd be willing to pay you {reg8} crowns for your trouble. Interested?
Aye, I can take the herd to {s13}.
I am sorry, but no.
Splendid. You can find the herd right outside the town. After you take the animals to {s13}, return back to me and I will give you your pay.
I am afraid I can't offer you a job right now.
My good {sir/madam}. Our village is grateful for your help. Thanks to the {reg5} heads of cattle you have brought, we can now raise our own herd.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
What do you want?
I'm just passing.
Who goes there?
Do not pay attention to me.
Who goes there?
Stop poaching and return to plowing your fields.

If we don't hunt game then we will starve, the lord does not leave us enough groceries and never any meat. Don't you like meat too? Maybe we can work something out, you could look the other away. What do you think?
I understand... I could say I haven't seen you.
Lies... poaching allows you to pay for your drinking, besides I do not like your ugly face.
Die!
Well, any news about poachers?
There are no poachers in your forest for the time being, so you can rest easy.
Music to my ears, thank you a thousand times, my lord. As promised here are your fresh provisions. I hope you come back soon to patrol the forest. These villains are a recurring problem, you know.
Well, any news about poachers?
I have to admit I've underestimated these farmers. There were about thirty and it proved impossible to fight them on my own.
Really? But... our village doesn't even have as many people, they must come from elsewhere for sure...
Welcome {s9}. Forgive me, but can I ask you for a favor?
Certainly.
I'm sorry but I have no time.
Well, what do you want?

I'm concerned about the surrounding forest, which is owned by our lord. It's being constantly emptied of its game by poachers. As you probably know it is forbidden for a serf to hunt on the lands of his lord. I don't know who engages in this activity although I have some ideas. I know especially that I may be ousted by my lord if I can't find a solution. Anyway we want to hire guards to watch over the forest and game. Do you want the job? We're authorized to give out provisions in return for your service.
For provisions? It's ok, I'll patrol your forest.
Understood, thank you. Just follow the trail in the forest. Whether you find poachers or not you've have done the patrol and therefore will get the reward.
I don't have the time to patrol the forest.
Good day, {sir/madam}, and welcome to {s9}. I am the elder of this village.
Welcome to {s9}, my {lord/lady}. We were rejoiced by the news that you are the new {lord/lady} of our humble village. I am the village elder and I will be honoured to serve you in any way I can.
{My lord/My lady}, you honour our humble village with your presence.
Good day, {sir/madam}.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
I'm interested in the history of this town, can I ask you a few questions?
Really? I can help you... I guess it's the castle that interests you?
Tell me about the history of this castle.
I'd like to take a look at the old castle, can you take me?
Do you know the old lord of this village? His coat of arms has a lion holding a halberd sitting on a throne...
That's all for the moment.
It may be that Godfrey of Villieux didn't have offspring when he died in the crusades around 1200. The king must have given the land to new lords. I don't see what more there is to say.
Would you know anything about his friends and enemies, that kind of stuff?
Absolutely nothing. Can I do anything more for you?

You won't find many people to talk about it. They say the castle is haunted by Godfrey himself. People here are simple and very superstitious. I don't believe in these stories, but at the same time I shouldn't get too close either. You know what I mean? Do you want something else?
It's forbidden to enter, but if it's really important to you, I can make a request to my lord for a permission... or not, I'm sorry.
There must be another way, maybe if you agreed to pick up a purse I just drop by inadvertently, keep its contents and open up the door just after that.
And... this purse would contain exactly how much?
10 crowns
50 crowns
100 crowns
I don't have enough gold.
This must be a joke? I'm not interested.
It's okay, I'll open the door discretely. You are solely responsible for what happens to you on the other side of the wall. So do not come complaining when you get killed... I mean...
Yes, I understand. Just open that door now.
Good, I'll come back later.
As you wish, I don't even want to know what you saw there.
Traveller, come, come and have a look at my goods.
What are you selling?
I'm not interested.
A better question would be what I don't have. See for yourself, I'm sure you'll see something that'll pique your interest.
That's all?
Good day, traveller. Welcome to my inn. Are you interested in renting a room or dining?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?
No, I don't see anyone yet.
I should go...
Good day, traveller. Welcome to my inn. Are you interested in renting a room or dining?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?
No, I don't see anyone yet.
I should go...
Good day, traveller. Welcome to my inn. Are you interested in renting a room or dining?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?
No, I don't see anyone yet.
I should go...
Hurry up and go help my client, I fear the worst.
Your client is safe and sound. He'll have to spend maybe a few days by the fire in your inn, which may bring you more money. That reminds me of the promised reward.
By St. Nicolas, you found him! The reward? Oh... yes, well, here. After all if you had done nothing I'd be in trouble right now.
Hurry up and go help my client, I fear the worst.
I'll get out of this mess.

One of my intoxicated patrons went for a walk in the forest. The idiot is risking his life with the cold weather that's out there. As a merchant I don't want the risk of death associated to me. That could force me to close my business. If you could bring him back there would be a substantial reward. If you agree, then make haste.
Excuse me, but do you have a moment? Something serous has happened at the inn, maybe you can help me.
What the hell?
I have enough problems of my own, find someone else.
Okay, I'm off to find him.
I have to go, I can't help ...
Perfect, perfect. Try not to drag the search past the point of getting yourself frozen.
Good day, traveller. Welcome to my inn. Are you interested in renting a room or dining?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
The provisions.
Anything else?
No, I don't see anyone yet.
I should go...
So what? Do you know what's going on at the mansion?
Two deer were stuck within the walls. I wanted the catch them, but they fled. Well, at least they won't be making any more noise at night.
Great news. Curses if those beasts would've eventually bred. I can't imagine the racket they would have caused. Here's the food as promised, something else?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?
No, I don't see anyone yet.
I should go...
So what? Do you know what's going on at the mansion?
Working on it.
Well, that's good to hear, what can I do for you?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?
I should go...
Good day, traveller. Welcome to my inn. Are you interested in renting a room or dining?
I'm hungry! What do you have?
I'm looking for work, do you know anyone who would need to hire a man of arms?
Here's our food selection. I've got more in the attic if that's not enough.
Anything else?

Yes, I have something for you. Strange noise is coming from the house above the river. If you could go and see what's up I'd give you some food. What do you think? I fear that these noises will cause my customers to leave.
Food for simply entering an old shack? It's okay.
I'm not interested, find someone else.
Okay, hold the key and take it back. Tell me what you saw there, of course, but not a sound to customers, I count on you.
I should go...
Hello, don't worry about the guards at the entrance. I saw you from afar.
Do you think that if I wanted to drink and overthrow the benches you could stop me?
Good point.
Welcome, do you need fresh horses? You can also replenish and get some sleep at the inn. It's clean and safe you know.
I need a horse.
You won't be disappointed. They've just been saddled and fed.
My pleasure.
I have to hit the road...
You are our guardian angel, the grace of the Lord be upon you.
Thank you, my dear.
We are living in conditions resembling hell on earth, please have mercy.
Never fear, my dear.
Again, thank you to our savior.
Mind you both.
Welcome back, thank you enough.
Here are some groceries to keep you fed for a while.
It's nothing, take care of yourself.
You are our savior, what can we do for you in return... I'm a craftsman. Take these plans that have no use for me at the moment, maybe they will be helpful.
We will go, is it not what you want?
You have to leave, nothing personal.
Who are you? What do you want?
What are you doing here? The innkeeper sent me to investigate noises, noises that you are the cause for without question.
We fled the massacres in our village, walked without stopping. Now we're exhausted and don't know where my wife and I should go. I implore you to have mercy on us.
I understand, stay here but be discreet or the landlord will send mercenaries. They won't be asking questions. Instead they will set the mansion on fire along with two fresh corpses.
You can't stay, if I come back tomorrow and you're still here, you'll witness another massacre.
Well... as you like, we leave on the spot.
Thank you... thank you, rest assured, we won't make any noise.
How do you manage to survive here?
Well, I trust you.
We hide during the day and go out at night to feed us from the garbage of the inn. Sometimes I manage to catch a fish that we need to eat raw. We don't know where to go, we are lost and penniless.
You should go to town and find a job, you just have to evade the brigands on your way in. Good luck.
What are your orders?
Prepare, we ride at dawn.
Do you need mercenaries? {reg3} Me and my companions are looking for a master. We will join you for {reg5} crowns.
Can you tell me more about your combat skills?
We are Hobelars, light horsemen on fast horses. We take your enemies by surprise from behind. We hound the fugitives and round up prisoners.
Fine, I'll hire the whole lot of you. Here's {reg5} crowns.
Currently, I can not afford to hire additional men.
What are your orders?
Prepare, we ride at dawn.
What are your orders?
Get ready, we leave at dawn.
Do you need mercenaries? {reg4} Me and my companions are looking for a master. We will join you for {reg6} crowns.
Can you tell me more about your combat skills?
We are lumberjacks. With our axes we can easily break shields and then just as easily the bones behind them. Which is the reason why some also call us butchers.
Snap, I'll hire everyone. Here's {reg6} crowns.
Currently, I can not afford to hire additional men.
What are your orders?
Get ready, we leave at dawn.
Finally some rest, right? I'm a messenger and I spend my days galloping around like a madman. How about a small game?
Why not.
No time for that.
Here we go then, what are we playing?
Hello, you're in the area?
I could say that, if I remained more than three days in one place. You?
Not at all, farewell.
I'm from the south, but I run tournaments across France. That is how I make my living.
Really? I do some occasional jousting as well, do you have any tips?
Really? Well, good luck.
Well... okay, as long as you pay my drink.
Of course, what can you tell me?
Unfortunately I'm broke.

Okay, first there's the matter of distance and timing. You should anticipate the shot. Movement will provide the energy, not the thrust. Don't aim directly to the armor of the competitor but a little to the left. If it's too much to the left or if you release too early, victory will elude you. Of course be careful to not hit the head of the horse, or we will talk about you and your clumsiness for a long time.
Very interesting, maybe we will cross the lances in the future. Who knows, my thanks.
I offer you a glass, stranger. After three catastrophic seasons and the disease that struck my animals we finally had a harvest worthy of the name.
What caused the crop failures?
It's very nice of you, goodbye.
The weather, a plague swept away many of my workers. The war, because of that whole fields have been burned, and naturally the scourge of God...
Greetings stranger, are you all right?
Why does it matter?
Perfect as always, farewell.
I'm a doctor and I see that you are covered with wounds, some of which have not healed. If you want I can take care of it, but it will cost money of course.
I have a head injury, do something please.
I have an arm injury, can you do something?
I have a leg injury, can you do something?
Dear lord! How are you still alive? We must close this horrible wound before it gets infected. It will cost you 200 crowns, please.
Okay, here's the money, hurry, the pain is unbearable.
I do not have the amount you request.
I'm sorry, but I can't do anything in that case. I need money to pay for the drugs.
Well, be careful next time. Eventually you'll run out of luck.
Indeed, your arm is a mess, it'll cost 100 crowns for the care.
Okay, here's the money, hurry, I can barely move the arm.
I do not have the amount you request.
I'm sorry, but I can't do anything in that case.
Well, be careful next time or your arm might fall off.
It's not serious. However you must clean the wound and change the bandage regularly. Ointments and bandages will cost 50 crowns, please.
Okay, here's the money, hurry, I can barely stand.
I do not have the amount you request.
I'm sorry, but I can't do anything in that case.
I recommend you to be more careful. No-one wants a captain who can't walk.
It will do for now, thank you.
As you wish, but don't forget to treat yourself if you are injured.
Cursed... walking horse steak!
Nice to see you too.
Cursed horse...
Always walking I see... and a bottle as a companion.
I found your horse and kept it. I'll pay your drink for compensation.
Yes, at least my mug is unlikely to escape.
What?! It's not at all about the money. But on the other hand, how could I refuse a mug?
Cursed... walking horse steak!
Nice to see you too.
Don't approach me cursed horse... oh, you'll laugh. I bought a horse yesterday and he refused to go so I had to make my journey on foot. If I could catch it would already be on my plate.
And where is it now?
Drink all you want, it doesn't bring you a new horse.
Who?
The horse.
Cursed horse, I left it in the meadows around Bourges. To think that I paid a fortune for it...
Traveller, do you value my music?
Indeed. This is for you, one denar.
Certainly.
How do you expect us to cook in such a noise, get out.
Thank you.
This cover is perfect, I hope it is not too heavy. You seem tired, but don't worry.
Softly my friend. I should go see a horse seller to buy armor for this horse.
Softly my friend. I should go see a horse seller to buy armor for this horse.
{playername}, I'd like you to know that I aspire to return to my village in the Lorges forest alive. I'd follow you to the end... but your battles might not be mine.
Either way, you get to go home soon.
I still need you my friend.
Thank you.
Yes? Are you going to ask me to rub your armor? In that case the answer is no, thank you.
That's a great idea, I'll think about it later.
Absolutely not, if you relax, what do you think?
{playername}, I think I want to stay with you for awhile. I realized that there's money to be made in your company. I expect to get my share of the spoils.
I'm sorry, but you'll have to settle for the weekly wage like other soldiers.
You wouldn't happen to need a man of arms by any chance?
Well... I'll take what I need from the corpses you leave in your path in this case, with your permission... or not.
{playername}, you know, being constantly on the road isn't really what I had planned for my retirement.
In that case, you are free to go.
I still need you my friend.
Despite that, I'll stay. Soldier must meet his death on the battlefield. What I miss the most is having a drink among comrades after a fight. At that moment one truly feels alive.
What do we do now?
Let's see your equipment.
We should talk about what you should do in combat.
I'll get it, don't worry.
In combat? Well... poking the enemy with the tip of my weapon and running. That's about all I'm capable of.
Anything else?
We are grateful to you for what you did.
I need volunteers to do help me deal with these scoundrels. We'll descend into the mine, join us and let's get this over with.
It was nothing.
My brother is stuck downstairs with the brutes, no need to say more. I'll follow you.
Whoever is going to help you out of pity?
I'll deal with it, do not worry.
Watch your back especially.
Remember to do that yourself. Or should I watch yours?
You could sleep in a middle of a meadow and have nothing to fear.
Show me your equipment.
We should talk about your combat tactics.
On the way.
After you.
Need to learn from a real fighter?
Have you finished searching through my things? Good...
Who are you? And what are you doing with me? Leave immediately.
I need volunteers to fight the troops of the de Penthièvre. Will you join us?
Well I'm going. My apologies.
So you aren't one of them like I thought... well, that's okay. I'm with you, provided that we are numerous enough to defeat them.
Are you a warrior?

More or less. I'm a mercenary, I was sent on a mission in the forest by the Duke in person. Having no money and no way to finish my mission I stopped walking around in circles. I ended up accepting a wine pot from these soldiers to not stick my nose in their business. But I went back to see if the situation had changed and if I could complete my contract.
Let's negotiate, I'll receive the biggest share of the reward from the Duke?
Of course... if you live to collect it. Otherwise I just have to introduce myself alone to the Duke.
And after the events take place, only one return to the survivor road.
Who are you? And what are you doing with me? Leave immediately.
Well, I'm going. My apologies.
That's ok, pass ahead.
Ok, let's go.
Did you hear that noise?
What noise?
I know... a crossbow that is being used to hunt deer...
Let me see your equipment.
We should talk about battle tactics.
Let's go.
And well what? I am an archer. Usually I just intimidate, sometimes I draw an arrow in front of a guard. I'm not really much of a swordsman if that's what you thought.
Move.
Don't move or I'll pierce you with my arrow. Drop your gold and your equipment, the same goes to you.
Moment, are you with the de Penthièvre?
What's the difference? You give what you have on you. If you really want to know, I'm with myself and I'll pierce your tongue if you do not hurry up.

Fire if you want, but that won't help you to get rid of the armored troops that prevent passengers passing through here? You could help me to take them out and then I'll give you gold, what do you think?
You make sense. Me and the iron coats are not on very friendly terms. But if you lead me into a trap from which I come away alive, I won't give you another opportunity to open your mouth.
There is no catch, just a proposal. These troops have no business being here so we are kind of in the same boat.
Hmm... let's see.
Attention, that's them.
Do you know what to do?
An expedition you say? Do I at least have a chance to make money from the iron coats? Or do you just want to send me to my death for no reason?
Are you all right? I'm a doctor.
Stop the bleeding, please.
Nothing too bad, I've never seen a soldier that couldn't stand the sight of blood. You'll get better soon.
Show me your equipment.
We should talk about your combat tactics.
Continue
Fight? The only fights I've fought are those where I'm armed with a saw doing amputation on some unconscious patients...
Are you finished?
What are you doing?
I need volunteers to fight the troops of the de Penthièvre. Whoever you are, will you join me for an expedition down to the mines?
We have a chance.
Well... the iron coats killed my wife and my daughter. Help me to kill this patrol and I'm all yours.
No wait, no need to...
What? Who gave you permission to enter, who are you?
The guard at the gate told me you'd have work for a mercenary.
I didn't want to disturb you, I'm leaving now.
Really? Well... it's true that we lack the guys to watch everyone?
I'm on the lookout for opportunities. What's happening here?
You think I know everything? Just prevent the villagers from leaving the village and maybe we'll have a pint and some dried meat for you.
Why keep them from leaving?
Are you're deaf? You do what you're told, are we clear?
Regardless, I have to talk to the butler... in private. [attack]
In that case I prefer to leave, but I'll be back.
What are you doing around here? Who told you to come?
That was your friend at the door, he told me that you are hiring.
Who told you to go rogue?
Your friend that's posted at the door, he told me that there was work for me.
What are you doing here, stranger?
Your friend at the door, he told me that the chief would have work for me.
My God, this is unbearable.
Nothing to fear, my lord.
Okay, I'll go inside, you can go now.
This is insane! What do you want now, clown?
Forgive me Lord, but what should I expect?
Well, well, well, what do we have here? Fool, you simply have to wait for another soldier to relieve you.
Are you here for guard duty, soldier? Go to the gate and prevent anyone from entering and ensure no-one with rude manners disturbs.
Understood, my lord.
I have more weapons. What, do you want more? In your place I'd be ashamed to work for that bastard count.
What, what do you want?
You carry that sword poorly, I'd rather you give it to me or risk injury.
I don't take orders from anyone, neither the Count or his dogs.
I may as well pick it up from your corpse.
Okay, keep it.
Okay, here it is, I hope you cut yourself with it.
It's a shame! The Duke expects to see scoundrels arrested, but the Count only thinks about drinking and carousing with our tax money.
I have nothing to do with your Count.
Long live the Duke of Brittany! Death to traitors, like the Count.
Try not to cause trouble while I'm on duty.
By letting things get worse the Duke finds himself surrounded by enemies. If I were you I would pierce the Count with my spear. For the Duke!
Long live the Duke of Brittany! Death to the traitors!
I do not want to be involved in that.
Look at this baronet prancing around in fancy clothes, a real court whore.
Yet you do not have to breathe her fragrance.
Do not bother us, gauche.
Forgive me, monsieur.
Do you know when the relief arrives?
How long does the siege take?
A siege like this? It can last for months, in the meantime we don't need to work and the bowl is filled every night... it's nice.
Not my idea of fun...
Why don't you leave and come back at the end of the siege? It wouldn't be the first time.
Hey friend, if you were to go into the citadel now, how would you get there?
I don't know.
Me... I'd go over the wall. A good grappling-iron and a rope would do. I would enter at night...
And...?
And well... shit! What do you want me to do? Even if I could get de Penthièvre, it's still not enough for me to be willing to get killed.
Are you part of the army of the Duke? The one that will relieve us from this pile of mud?
I'm afraid not.
Where do you hail from, friend? This is the first time we meet and I have served in almost all of the company's campaigns.
Here and there, I really haven't got a home.
Have you heard of the bounty on de Penthièvre's head?
It's possible.
Of course you've heard. Mind if I ask you how to trap this game and bring it to the Duke as a trophy?
When I think of the bounty and the bastard housed in his castle, it's like juicy serving of game and ale were hidden just behind a locked door. We can smell but not grab them.
Instead, we are left with the check.
Hmm... I don't know. If it was up to me, I'd go in there and start a massacre, considering all things we could take - not forgetting the women trapped in there.
It's better to idle than bust your ass off, right?
The best is to grab a wench after a good meal.
Not before the paycheck, my friend.
This insolent de Penthièvre, the least he could do is to catch a disease of death from the breeze, so we could all go home.
Something tells me you get back home early.
It's cold, damp and miserable. Damn, why did we came here?
Merc life is a breeze, you have plenty of time to kill and then you go and kill someone.
I have great difficulty believing that you did it... what you just said, avoid mentioning it to others if you don't want them to slice his hand to take the ring.
I won't reveal this secret to anyone else than the Duke.
Where were you, my friend? The guard post is here, you know?
I was on the other side of the citadel when I spotted an underpass. I took the advantage of surprise and killed de Penthièvre...
I took his signet ring from his body, here...
What? Bugger... how did you do that?
By being bold, Sergeant...
You better show that jewelry to the Duke in person, he will hand 25000 crowns for you. Everyone knows that it's what he promised to give to the person that slays the bastard de Penthièvre.
How much??? I will request a hearing from the the Duke.
Guard the ring well, without it the Duke won't give you anything. Although I still find it hard to believe myself.
Who am I speaking to? Reinforcements?
The captain sent me to increase the number of our troops. Sergeant, please give me a rundown on what has happened lately?
Nothing at all, like you see now, we're just waiting for the armies of the Duke.
We just wait?
Wait and be prepared, so avoid drinking, as much as possible (hint: don't wait).
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. But I doubt you'll run into him at this hour of the night. You would have better luck during the day.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
About the task you asked of me...
Do you have any tasks I can help you with?
I want to buy some supplies. I will pay with gold.
Of course, {sir/madam}. Do you want to buy goods or cattle?
I want to buy food and supplies.
We have some food and other supplies in our storehouse. Come have a look.
I want to buy some cattle.
I changed my mind. I don't need to buy anything.
Have you seen any enemies around here recently?
I am sorry, {sir/madam}. We have neither seen nor heard of any war parties in this area.
Hmm. Let me think about it...
No, {sir/madam}. We haven't seen any war parties in this area for some time.
Well, I guess that was all.
I need you to set a large fire on the outskirts of this village.
We have already agreed upon this, {sir/my lady}. I will do my best. You can trust me.
A fire, {sir/madam}! Fires are dangerous! Why would you want such a thing?
I believe that we have already discussed this issue, {sir/my lady}.
We talked about this {sir/madam} before and your previous offers were low compared to risk you want me to take.
I have my reasons, and you will have yours -- a purse of silver. Will you do it, or not?
Given the risk you are taking, you are entitled to know my plan.
I wish to rescue a prisoner from {s4}. When you light the fire, the guards in {s4} will see the smoke, and some of them will rush outside to see what is going on.
As you wish, {sir/my lady}. You have been a good friend to this village, and, even though there is a risk, we should be glad to return the favor. When do you want this fire to start?
I'm sorry, {sir/my lady}. You will forgive me for saying this, but we don't exactly have good reason to trust you. This is too dangerous.
As you say, {sir/my lady}. But in doing this, we are taking a very great risk. What's in it for us?
I can give you 100 crowns.
I can give you 200 crowns.
I can give you 300 crowns.
Never mind.
This is madness. I cannot take such a risk.
Then let's increase your reward to 200 crowns.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 crowns.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 crowns. This is my last offer.
Never mind.
Very well. You are asking me to take a very great risk, but I will do it. When do you want this fire to start?
I cannot do such a dangerous thing for 200 crowns.
Continue with your preparations. One hour from now, I need that fire.
Do this in at the stroke of midnight. I will wait exactly one hour.
Very well, {sir/my lady}. We will make our preparations. Now you make yours.
As you wish, {sir/my lady}. May the heavens protect you.
Are there any lads from this village who might want to seek their fortune in the wars?
[Leave]
We have {reg5} heads of cattle, each for {reg6} crowns. How many do you want to buy?
I am afraid we have no cattle left in the village {sir/madam}.
One
Two
Three
Four
Five
Forget it.
I will tell the herders to round up the animals and bring them to you, {sir/madam}. I am sure you will be satisfied with your purchase.
I don't think anyone would be interested, {sir/madam}. Is there anything else I can do for you?
I can think of {reg5} whom I suspect would jump at the chance. If you could pay 10 crowns {reg7?each for their equipment:for his equipment}. Does that suit you?
Tell {reg7?them:him} to make ready.
No, not now.
Yes {sir/madam}, have you made any progress on it?
Indeed. I brought you {reg5} packs of grain.
My good {lord/lady}. You have saved us from hunger and desperation. We cannot thank you enough, but you'll always be in our prayers. The village of {s13} will not forget what you have done for us.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
I am still working on it.
I am afraid I won't be able to finish it.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We are praying for your success everyday.
Ah, I am sorry to hear that {sir/madam}. I'll try to think of something else.
Well {sir/madam}, you are already engaged with a task helping us. We cannot ask more from you.
No {sir/madam}, We don't have any other tasks for you.
A task?

{My good sir/My good lady}, our village has been going through such hardships lately. The harvest has been bad, and recently some merciless bandits took away our seed grain that we had reserved for the planting season. If we cannot find some grain soon, we will not be able to plant our fields and then we will have nothing to eat for the coming year. If you can help us, we would be indebted to you forever.
Hmm, how much grain do you need?
I can't be bothered with this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} packs of grain will let us start the planting. Hopefully, we can find charitable people to help us with the rest.
Then I will go and find you the grain you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {sir/madam}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.

We are suffering greatly at the hands of a group of bandits. They take our food and livestock, and kill anyone who doesn't obey them immediately. Our men are angry that we cannot defend ourselves, but we are only simple farmers... However, with some help, I think that some of the people here could be more than that. We just need an experienced warrior to teach us how to fight.
I can teach you how to defend yourself.
You peasants have no business taking up arms. Just pay the bandits and be off with it.

You will? Oh, splendid! We would be deeply indebted to you, {sir/madam}. I'll instruct the village folk to assemble here and receive your training. If you can teach us how to defend ourselves, I promise you'll receive everything we can give you in return for your efforts.
Yes, of course {sir/madam}. Thank you for your counsel.
Bandits have driven away our cattle. Our pastures are empty. If we had just a few heads of cattle we could start to raise a herd again.
How many animals do you need?
I don't have time for this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} heads will suffice for a small herd.
Then I will bring you the cattle you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {sir/madam}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {sir/madam}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.
Thank you, {sir/madam}, but we do not really need anything right now.
{My lord/my lady}, you honour my humble shop with your presence.
Welcome {sir/madam}. What can I do for you?
Anything else?
I want to buy a few items... and perhaps sell some.
Sure, sure... Here, have a look at my stock...
Anything else?
What goods should I buy here to trade with other towns?
Nothing. Thanks.

That information can be best obtained from caravan masters and travelling merchants. If you want I can send you to the district where foreign merchants stay at when they come to the town. If you spend some time there and listen to the talk, you can learn a lot about what to buy and where to sell it.
Then I'll go and spend some time with these merchants.
I have no time for this right now.
Good day friend. If you came to watch the tournaments you came in vain. There won't be a tournament here anytime soon.
Tournaments? So they hold the tournaments here...

Yes. You should see this place during one of the tournament fights. Everyone from the town and nearby villages comes here. The crowd becomes mad with excitement. Anyway, as I said, there won't be an event here soon, so there isn't much to see. Except, there is an official duel every now and then, and  of course we have melee fights almost every day.
Tell me about the melee fights.

The fighters and knights get bored waiting for the next tournament, so they have invented the training melee. It is a simple idea really. Fighters jump into the arena with a weapon. There are no rules, no teams. Everyone beats at each other until there is only one fighter left standing. Sounds like fun, eh?
Is there a reward?

There is, actually. Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} crowns. You'll get {reg12} crowns for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} crowns if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} crowns if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} crowns. Sounds good, eh?

Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} crowns. You'll get {reg12} crowns for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} crowns if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} crowns if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} crowns. Sounds good, eh?
Can I join too?
Ha ha. You would have to be out of your mind not to. Of course. The melee fights are open to all. Actually there is going to be a fight soon. You can go and hop in if you want to.
Hello. You seem to be new here. Care to share your name?
I am {playername}.
Well met {playername}. I am the master of the tournaments here at {s1}. Talk to me if you want to join the fights.

Ha-ha, that's quite the bruise you're sporting. But don't worry; everybody gets trounced once in awhile. The important thing is to pick yourself up, dust yourself off and keep fighting. That's what champions do.
Hey, you managed to take down {reg8} opponents. Not bad. But that won't bring you any prize money. Now, if I were you, I would go back there and show everyone what I can do...
You put up quite a good fight there. Good moves. You definitely show promise. And you earned a prize of {reg10} crowns for knocking down {reg8} opponents.
That was a good fight you put up there. You managed to take down no less than {reg8} opponents. And of course, you earned a prize money of {reg10} crowns.

Your performance was amazing! You are without doubt a very skilled fighter. Not everyone can knock down {reg8} people in the fights. Of course you deserve a prize with that performance: {reg10} crowns. Nice, eh?
That was damned good fighting, {playername}. You have very good moves, excellent tactics. And you earned a prize of {reg10} crowns for knocking down {reg8} opponents.

Congratulations champion! Your fight there was something to remember! You managed to be the last fighter standing beating down everyone else. And of course you won the grand prize of the fights: {reg10} crowns.
Hello {playername}. Good to see you again.
What would you like to do?
About the melee fights...
Will there be a tournament in nearby towns soon?
Is it possible to train jousting?
I need to leave now. Good bye.
{reg2?There won't be any tournaments any time soon.:{reg1?Tournaments are:A tournament is} going to be held at {s15}.}
There will be a fight here soon. You can go and jump in if you like.
Good. That's what I am going to do.
Thanks. But I will give my bruises some time to heal.
Good {man/girl}. That's clever of you.
Actually, can you tell me about the rewards again?
Of course, there are amateur or experienced jousters ready to perform. Whatever their motivations, from a groom who dreams of being noticed by a noblewoman to enthusiasts of this discipline.
Hello {boy/girl}. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
You take more prisoners, bring them to me. I will pay well.
I'll give you nothing but cold steel, you scum!
There's no need to fight. I can pay for free passage.
Silver without blood, that's our favourite kind! Hmm, having a look at you, I reckon you could easily come up with {reg5} crowns. Pay it, and we'll let you be on your way.
Very well, take it.
I don't have that much money with me
That's too bad. I guess we'll just have to sell you into slavery. Take {him/her}, lads!
Hey, I've heard of you! You slaughter us freebooters like dogs, and now you expect us to let you go for a few stinking coins? Forget it. You gave us no quarter, and you'll get none from us.
Heh, that wasn't so hard, was it? All right, we'll let you go now. Be off.
Eh? What is it?
Your luck has run out, wretch. Prepare to die!
Never mind, I have no business with you.
Do you want us to follow you?
Yes. Let us ride together.
No. Not at this time.
Unfortunately. You do not have room in your party for us.
We are at your command.
You will not capture me again. Not this time.
You don't have a chance against me. Give up.
I will give up when you are dead!
I beg you, please leave us alone.
Do you think you can run away from me? You will be my prisoner or die!
Ok. We'll leave you in peace for this time, do not face with us again.
Haven't you got any mercy? Ok, we will fight you to the last man!
Hmmm. 10 crowns for each looter makes {reg1} crowns for all {reg0} of them.
Let me see. You've brought {reg0} bandits, so 20 crowns for each comes up to {reg1} crowns.
Well well, you've captured {reg0} brigands. Each one is worth 30 crowns, so I'll give you {reg1} for them in total.
I suppose that'll be all, then.
Do not try running away or trying something stupid. I will be watching you.
No, I swear I won't.
Greetings, {your lordship/my lady}. How can I serve you today?
Good day. What can I do for you?
I want to buy a new weapon. Show me your wares.
I'm looking for some equipment. Show me what you have.
I'm thinking of buying a horse.
I want my horse barded, how much does it cost?
500 pieces for a thick and solid cover, you take it?
Yes, I take it. Install it yourself please.
I'm afraid I don't have the money but I'll be back.
No problem, here. Pleasure doing business with you.
Ah, yes {sir/madam}. These arms are the best you'll find anywhere.
Of course, {sir/madam}. You won't find better quality armour than these in all Europe.
You have a fine eye for horses, {sir/madam}. You won't find better beasts than these anywhere else.
Anything else?
Tell me. What are people talking about these days?
Well, nothing new lately. Prices, weather, the war, the same old things.
Goodbye
Sir? Are you lost?
Can you tell me about the forest?
I have to leave.
This is the Lorges forest, they say a lot of things about it. Do not go alone, my friend. You risk getting lost or falling into the hands of robbers. Or worse, a predator.
I can't tell you about it, it's bad luck. Farewell.
Sir? What are you doing in this forlorn village?
What's going on in here?
I did not want to disturb you.
I can't say anything, go see the cup-bearer at the inn.
Mon seigneur ?
I did not want to disturb you.
My {lord/lady}?
Good day, {sir/madam}.
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {sir/madam}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
Pardon me, but is that a {s5} you're wearing?
Eh? What kind of gibberish is that?
Never mind.
{s4} sent me to collect your reports. Do you have them with you?
I've been expecting you. Here they are, make sure they reach {s4} intact and without delay.
Farewell.
What can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me about this town?
How is life here?

Disaster has struck my family, {sir/madam}. We have no land of our own, and the others have no money to pay for our labor, or even to help us. My poor children lie at home hungry and sick. I don't know what we'll do.
My life is miserable, {sir/madam}. I haven't been able to find a job for months, and my poor children go to bed hungry each night. My neighbours are too poor themselves to help me.
Then take these 300 crowns. I hope this will help you and your family.
Then clearly you must travel somewhere else, or learn another trade.
Yes {sir/madam}. I will do as you say.
{My lord/My good lady}.  You are so good and generous. I will tell everyone how you helped us.
Thank you for your kindness {sir/madam}. With your help our lives will be better. I will pray for you everyday.
Times are hard, {sir/madam}. We work hard all day and yet we go to sleep hungry most nights.
Times are hard, {sir/madam}. But we must count our blessings.
We are not doing too badly {sir/madam}. We must count our blessings.
What is your trade?
What is the latest rumor around here?
I don't know anything that would be of interest to you.
I haven't heard anything interesting lately.
[Leave]
Yes {sir/madam}?
How goes the watch, soldier?
All is quiet {sir/madam}. Nothing to report.
Good. Keep your eyes open.
Good day, {sir/madame}. Always an honor to have you here in {s10}.
Mind your manners within the walls and we'll have no trouble.
Your orders, {my lord/my lady}?
We are not supposed to talk while on guard, {sir/madam}.
Stay on duty and let me know if anyone comes to see me.
Yes, {my lord/my lady}. As you wish.
I want you to arrest this man immediately!
Who do you want arrested {sir/madam}?
Ah, never mind my high spirits lads.
Forget it. I will find another way to deal with this.
Argh! I hate this.
Thank you for helping us against those bastards.
I will drink from your skull!
Your orders {sir/madam}?
Tell me about yourself
Aye {sir/madam}. Let me tell you all there is to know about me.
Anything else?
I wanted to say that I am proud of you...
It's an honor, captain. We will fight like hell until the final victory.
Nothing. Keep moving.
You have no chance against us. Surrender now or we will kill you all...
We will fight you to the end!
Don't attack! We surrender.
What do you want?
Surrender or die!
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
Heh! I must really be in a tight spot, to place my hopes in a passing stranger. However, something about you tells me that my trust is not misplaced. Now, go see if you can round up some volunteers.
The Heavens alone grant us victory.
I'm glad to see that you're alive, too.

Yes, yes... Now, a couple of my boys have the watch captain pinned down in a back room, with a knife at his throat. I'll need to go drag him before {s5} and explain what this breach of the peace is all about. You don't need to be part of that, though. I'll tell you what -- if all goes well, I'll meet you in the tavern again shortly, and let you know how it all came out. If you don't see me in the tavern, but instead see my head on a spike over the city gate, I'll assume you know enough to stay out of town for a while and forget this whole episode ever happened. So -- hopefully we'll meet again!

We've always had brigands in the hills, driven to banditry by war, debt, or love of violence. Recently, however, they've been getting bolder -- leaving their camps in the wild and venturing into town, looking for unwary prey. The watch commander tells us it's because of all the fighting on the frontiers -- fewer men to keep an eye on the streets -- but I'm not sure what to make of that. It seems to me that the most logical explanation is that these bandits have an ally inside the walls, who helps them enter unnoticed and helps them identify particularly tempting targets... Last week, you see, they took my brother.

I don't know what my brother was thinking -- a lad from a prominent house, out alone after dark in times like these... Well, I suppose you were too, but you're a stranger here, and didn't know how bad things have become. He had no such excuse. But he's family, so what can you do? If you don't protect your kin, then people will start thinking that you can't protect your investments, either, and I can't have that... No doubt the gang will soon send word about a ransom, but I don't care to pay it.

So here's my proposition. You look like you've had a bit of experience with a blade -- and more importantly, you must have a bit of fire in your belly, or you wouldn't be coming to France to seek your fortune. So here's what I'm asking you to do: gather a small party, track down these bandits to their lair, teach them a lesson they won't forget, and get my brother back safe. In return, you'll earn my lasting gratitude and a bit of silver. What do you say?
I am interested.
I am not interested, have more important business to do.

You won't be able to do this by yourself, though. If you try and take on the whole gang single handedly, the hunter will become the hunted, I'll warrant. You'll first want to round up a group of volunteers. There's always a few lads in the villages around here, looking for a bit of work that's more interesting than tilling the soil or hauling water. They'll follow you if you pay. So... Take this purse of 100 crowns. Consider it an advance on your reward. Go round to the villages, and use the money to hire some help. I'll reckon that you need at least five men to take on these bandits.
Very good, sir. I'll go collect some men from around the villages.
Good. You can find me again in the tavern here in {s1} after you've got your group together. Then we'll speak about what we do next.
Surrender or die. Make your choice
I am not afraid of you. I will fight.
Hello. What can I do for you?
Tell me about yourself
Very well, listen to this...
Anything else?
[Done]
Drop your weapons and surrender if you want to live
We will fight you first
Yes, {my lord/my lady}. Which message do you wish to send to the vassals?
I want to start a new campaign. Let us assemble the army here.
I want to end the campaign and let everyone return home.
I wish to invite the vassals of the realm to a feast at {s4}.
Never mind
You wish to invite the lords of the realm to a feast?
Yes. It is time for us to strengthen the bonds that bring us together.
On second thought, this is perhaps not the time.
All right then. I shall dispatch messengers informing the lords of the realm of your feast at {s4}.
You wish to summon all lords for a new campaign?
Yes. We must gather all our forces before we march on the enemy.
On second thought, it won't be necessary to summon everyone.
All right then. I will send messengers and tell everyone to come here.
You want to end the current campaign and release all lords from duty?
Yes. We no longer need all our forces here.
On second thought, it will be better to stay together for now.
All right. I will let everyone know that they are released from duty.

In terms of local industry, the most productive town in France is known to be {s4}. Here in {s5}, we produce less than {reg4} towns, and produce more than {reg5}. Production is of course affected by the supply of raw materials, as well as by the overall prosperity of the town.

In terms of the output of the surrounding villages, the town of {s4} is the richest in France. Here in {s5}, the villages produce less than the hinterland around {reg4} towns, and produce more than {reg5}. The wealth of a town's hinterland, of course, is heavily dependent on the tides of war.
